Also, my Thursday appointment said ‚Äúawaiting confirmation‚Äù still as of Wednesday morning. So he‚Äôs MIA. I messaged customer service about it on Tuesday (the only contact option available on the app), and as of Wednesday morning there‚Äôs been no response from customer service either!! I messaged the therapist asking him to cancel the Thursday appointment so I don‚Äôt initiate some kind of automatic cancellation charge. I canceled my subscription. And I googled a support phone number off the app. There was no support available so I left a message. üòÑ so‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. absolutely do not recommend if you need therapy lol.

This app is a joke. I‚Äôve never had any issues when my employer was paying for the membership. I no longer work for said employer, and I decided to input my insurance information to continue using this platform. It said that I had an available 45 minute session credit, but yet my provider still billed my insurance. I had to jump through hoops (DMing them on Twitter and emailing them) for Joanna to break it down to me that a ‚Äúcredit‚Äù is not a credit. Why would you call it a credit to mislead people? My therapist‚Äôs approach also wasn‚Äôt worth the price ‚Äî I‚Äôd tell her what I‚Äôm going through, and she‚Äôd be like ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a lot to take in, how are you taking care of yourself?‚Äù If I knew the answers, I wouldn‚Äôt be in therapy. I refer my partner to this app, it says we both get $200, and yet my partner keeps getting billed even though they only booked 1 free 10 minute session and cancelled the other appointment. Talkspace also never said that the $200 would be paid out in credits until I emailed Joanna, and she said there was no other way for them to pay me my referral money besides credits. This is an absolute joke ‚Äî run away from this. It‚Äôs not worth your time, there‚Äôs too much false advertisement and lack of accountability.

My experience mirrors that of many other dissatisfied users. I received 
one month of unlimited messaging therapy as a gift. For over a week I checked my account and contacted customer service to see if my gift card had been applied to my account, as it did not show that on the app. Finally someone told me that it had been. At this point I‚Äôve wasted almost two weeks. Their providers are also slow to respond and when they do, the responses seem scripted or canned. I switched providers after my first counselor only had me fill out questionnaires only to receive no feedback or fill me in on what was happening. The second counselor seemed promising & after sending her a detailed message (at her request), she finally replied that she had resigned from Talkspace and they would match me with someone else. That was over two weeks ago and the matching agent has ghosted me too. If I had not received this as a gift,  I would be more irritated because it‚Äôs expensive if you have to pay out-of-pocket. My month will expire soon and so far this app has been no help. I would even say their model seems predatory on people in vulnerable situations.

I was excited about this app because it has the chat feature so you and a therapist can communicate through text. This is a main feature if Talkspace. The two therapists I tried weren‚Äôt ready for giving care this way. Both had been counselors before they joined talk space, so maybe they were used to doing hour long therapy sessions rather than texting. The first therapist didn‚Äôt even answer me on chat, just told me we would talk about it in the appointment which I didn‚Äôt want to do, and the second one got short with me and seemed frustrated when I expressed my desire to use the texting feature. 
I just need someone to ask me questions to help me figure out what‚Äôs going on in my mind and then help me learn how to heal it. This is definitely doable with a chat feature. I am able to communicate much more honestly and learn way better this way. Maybe the therapists will get more used to this kind of communication. 

For now I recommend Noom‚Äôs Healthy Mind program if you‚Äôre like me and need to be able to text. They have coaches who know how to give care through text and so have been much more responsive and helpful in the chat.

They aren‚Äôt transparent about their billing. I am getting charges from October and it is now February even though I had insurance that I was told ‚Äúfully covered‚Äù my plan, all of these charges started rolling in when I got new insurance in January and tried to update my account. Not only that, my therapist and I met on a biweekly basis and the person who emailed me insisted their ‚Äúsystem‚Äù shows me meeting weekly, which was simply NOT true. I can‚Äôt believe an app like this exists with this many issues. The user experience is absolutely terrible and you can‚Äôt even delete your own account? 

Anyway, I refuse to pay these bills I am getting until I can SPEAK to someone on the phone. Don‚Äôt you dare tell me to send another email. I had MULTIPLE open customer service tickets that went unanswered for weeks. But they had no problem sending me billing messages. Once I finally got a response I told them to remove my credit card information from their system and to close my account. I will make a point to tell anyone considering this app to not use it. You all are preying on people seeking help with your shady billing processes.

I‚Äôve never done traditional therapy, but wanted to give this a try because the idea of being able to express my thoughts at anytime seemed appealing. I understood the therapist would only respond when they are working, but my experience amounted to me getting a one 30 secondish sound bite from my therapist a day. I think the concept is really cool, if it worked as intended, it would actually make therapy a lot easier for people especially those who are thinking about trying it out for the first time! But the price is pretty ridiculous to just get 1 response/day - 4x a week. Oh and I spent half of my first subscription matching because my first therapist never responded back, after I poured my heart out answering her ‚Äúget to know me‚Äù questions. My advice is you can reach the same type of help you would get from Talkspace just by journaling, but if you really need help, find the time to go to a therapist. It‚Äôs actually cheaper too.. Again, great concept. Maybe some day when therapist are hired for this platform specifically and can actually deliver support rather than IG like comments on your thoughts.

I don‚Äôt normally leave reviews, but for this I just had to. I signed up with this a while back, probably about a month and a half ago. At first, I was speaking to the person who matches you to a therapist, they were responsive and helpful. then, as soon as i chose a plan, the marcher no longer responded to me. Then the waiting began. After about 2 weeks of not being matched STILL, I was concerned I was paying 300 dollars for nothing, so i reached out to their customer service. They advised me sometimes it can take a little bit to find a good therapist match for you. I am a patient person, so i thanked them for reassuring me, and continued to wait. it has now been 3 and a half additional weeks, still 0 contact from any therapists. I think if this app wants to truly work, they need way more therapists so people can get the help they need. i tried to do this virtually (therapy) as it works better for my schedule, but now i‚Äôm going to have to find something in person, as i can‚Äôt seem to be matched online. How unfortunate.

The past few weeks have been increasingly disappointing. I am in a good place in terms of my relationship with my therapist and our goals etc - but our time together during live sessions is being negatively impacted by issues with the audio where when I talk, it echoes/repeats through my speaker everything I said as if I were saying it twice in a row row your boat fashion. My therapist has reached out to support as it is not an issue only I am having and she has other clients too that are struggling with it and can‚Äôt make it through their sessions, but she is not receiving support other than being given suggestions to restart/reinstall type troubleshooting, all of which we have both already tried more than once. 

I really hope this gets fixed soon - as it is becoming a serious hinderance to the progress and focus during sessions and makes me not want to continue even at times because its too much.

After creating a profile I was automatically set up with a therapist who had ‚Äúno availability‚Äù. There is no way to pick a new therapist at this point. I reached out to customer support‚Ä¶ 6 days later I got a response apologizing for the delay and if I still had the same issue to respond to that email? The therapist did respond and let me know she avoids showing availability but rather chats with the person to determine this‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm sorry‚Ä¶ using my therapy time to (billed or not) to talk schedules. I work full time, this app has a button to view availability under the guise you can schedule time‚Ä¶ so thats just optional. The therapist also mentioned she was in a different location so it wouldn't work (insurance billing wise) like i was the one who picked her or the location. - The user experience/patient experience is sorely lacking to say the least. My employer pays for this benefit. I will be reaching out to them and asking them to not use them in the future and opt for other options that are easier for users/people seeking out therapy.

When I first joined TalkSpace a few years back, it did wonders. I felt that that therapists genuinely cared, weren‚Äôt overbooked, and I received responses quickly. I assume in combination with the pandemic and the fact that every single podcast ever is adventuring Talkspace, it‚Äôs become incredibly over crowded, therapists are too busy (I got tossed around so many times, after not even speaking to them but receiving a message that they could not accept any more patients). I got increasingly frustrated with this and eventually deleted the app. I wanted to come back, and kept trying, but my therapists I was matched to were not helpful but instead send me paragraphs of ‚Äúwhat to know‚Äù for well over a week before I could even tell them what I needed help with. I kept trying to be re matched but continued to encounter the same issue. Finally was matched with someone great, but she kept going on vacation! It got to the point tonight where I was just done. I‚Äôm considering paying $200 a week again for therapy, but at least it‚Äôll be more help than this app.

Think of the bare minimum platitudes you might‚Äôve got from a school therapist. To give you a point of reference, the selections of therapists on this app are less than half as useful as that, if they even respond to you that is. I personally went through four different therapists, two of which immediately ghosted me for two entire weeks after introductions with no scheduled vacations mentioned in the app whatsoever to prepare me for that. One therapist simply sent me a PDF file of self-help strategies and wouldn‚Äôt even let me talk to them one on one about my own personal struggles that I sought therapy for in the first place. It‚Äôs like paying 300$ a month to be gaslit into feeling like it‚Äôs your fault you aren‚Äôt getting anything out of your therapy by a bunch of automated responses that will constantly antagonize you for wanting more out of the service. I was very patient and I‚Äôm sure the individual therapists have little control over the poor system, but don‚Äôt trust Better Help.

I won‚Äôt completely diminish Talkspace because I found an incredible therapist that has been heaven sent in helping me work on my mental health. 

However, Talkspace support is absolutely terrible. The only way to reach support is via email, and responses are never returned in a timely manner. Based off my own experiences, I have had to wait at least a week or two for a response from support. Within the app, there‚Äôs also all these glitches, so during times I took a break from talkspace, I had to be re-matched to my provider all over again each time only delaying when I can start as a result. Additionally, the pricing for the services even on the most basic plan are outrageous.

I recently got a new insurance that I selected specifically because it is accepted by talkspace and I wanted to keep my therapist since she‚Äôs been amazing. Only to find out that even with a strong health care plan, I won‚Äôt be saving any money as it appears Talkspace has now nearly doubled their fees on even the most basic of services. For the most basic plan and having comprehensive insurance coverage, I am looking at nearly $350 per month which is double what I used to pay.

Do better Talkspace. Stop overcharging  especially when you can‚Äôt even provide the customer service support or full-scale of services to charge such a high price

I have been dealing with postpartum rage and anxiety. I was going through a particular rough patch and was advised to find a therapist for treatment. I have twin babies and unable to get out the house so I decided to take the online route. On November 10th  I spoke with Ivanna at Talkspace that recommended I work with a therapist that specializes in maternal mental health. I was then able to find a recommended therapist named Denise Davis-Moore. I was advised Denise would respond to my message or reach out to me within 24 hours. 10 days past and I never got a response from Denise. I had also scheduled my first live online session roughly a week out and Denise never confirmed and ended up missing the session all together. I then reached out to customer support asking for a refund and they too were unresponsive. They didn‚Äôt respond until I reached out again asking for a reply to my original question. I have finally received my refund but I must say I‚Äôm highly disappointed and dissatisfied with their service altogether.

I was using my work benefits so I didn‚Äôt lose out on money, but the fact that i wrote to customer service and i haven‚Äôt even gotten indication that my ticket was under review after nearly two weeks is simply unacceptable. I couldn‚Äôt even make an appointment despite having a credit, if you can‚Äôt reply to customers then maybe cater to less of them, because i genuinely need mental help and the stress of not being able to get the help i need has legitimately given me multiple mental breakdowns. I feel like I am being punished for not being able to properly communicate, one of the the very same issues I came to this app to fix. At this point it‚Äôs a whole lot easier to just continue on with my addictions and friendless life than it is to reach out for help. If you like good customer support, then don‚Äôt worry, I along with quite a few others i‚Äôve seen are proof that those said agents might not exist, or if they do, are drowning in work.

The live sessions do not roll over to the next month. This service was beneficial to me and helped me. But I feel robbed because it wasn‚Äôt clear to me how many sessions I had.  I have a busy life and I lost track in the month how many I had and used. So over the three months I had it I probably missed out on at least two sessions. There is no accounting of live sessions bought or sessions booked in the app. The app does not tell you any message like, ‚Äúyou have 2 of 4 live sessions available‚Äù.  I feel this is underhand.  Customer service said, ‚ÄúBook all sessions for the month at once so you don‚Äôt miss any sessions‚Äù.  That‚Äôs great, but we have busy lives and may not have a clear schedule a month in advance. It‚Äôs almost like they don‚Äôt want to be clear how many sessions you have left and hope you don‚Äôt book all the sessions within the month so they can pocket the money.  I‚Äôm giving it one star for this reason.

Great idea and app! Horrible quality controls, professionalism and payment transparency. Some wonderful therapists for individual and couples ‚Äî overall not a professional experience.

Chat rooms, shares, audios and therapy options would be great if and only if therapists had quality control, contracts or incentives to provide professional services. 

The app itself could revolutionalize Mental Health with the right people, customer service department and reliability. It‚Äôs sad that this app is many peoples first experience with mental health due to the horrible quality controls and execution.

If Talkspace truly cares about their customers, they would have surveys about their experience with each department and fix it! There could be so many more positive reviews with the right controls and qualify service delivered.

Some therapists are wonderful! Others are unprofessional. Where is the standard? What is the service standard for professional, helpful Mental Health service?

App itself is wonderful. Need to get the culture and people to align. Approach with personal responsibility and as a consumer. It‚Äôs a vulnerable space and can be helpful but also very frustrating business operation at this time.

Talkspace gives you the option of texting through the week as a session, or having a one to one 45-minute session. However Talkspace does not differentiate between messages about the mechanics of the sessions and actual therapy messages. So when your therapist messages you to do an assessment before your session, that counts as texting. When your therapist sends you a bunch of handouts or files, that counts as a session. 

In my case, I was authorized 5 sessions through my EAP, and was billed for two sessions for each of the two weeks, and then even though the therapist could see I still had another session, all of my future appointments were cancelled. My only recourse was to send an email, which I was told had a typical response time of 4-6 weeks. 

I‚Äôve filed a formal complaint with the EAP and my HR, as it‚Äôs their money that is being wasted. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone use this provider until they can stop their predatory billing practices.

Finding a provider is really hard and overwhelming, and can take a lot of time. When I saw the promises made by this app I had some hope to be matched and start talking to someone (honestly anyone). They said it would be 48 hours to be matched with a provider‚Ä¶.it took closer to 72, but that‚Äôs okay because they sent an email saying they were busier than normal after I signed up. That‚Äôs forgivable because FINALLY I have a match! ‚Ä¶silence, so I initiated the conversation and then several hours later got a generic response on how the app works and ‚Äútell me why you are here, I am logging off today but I‚Äôll respond tomorrow‚Äù. Great, so I give my background. That was 3 business days ago, (and a weekend) and I have messaged every day and still no response. I also started a ticket with support asking if there is something I am supposed to do for a response, that was 2 business days ago with no response. Very disappointed. Please avoid if you need help.

My husband and I decided to start couples therapy a couple months ago and we were matched with a therapist who we absolutely love. We were also happy to see that Talkspace is covered by insurance, so we called our insurance and they let us know that they cover Talkspace at 100%. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs completely impossible to get in touch with anyone at Talkspace to send a bill for reimbursement. 

Our therapist asked them over and over again to please respond to me, but other than a brief ‚Äúwe‚Äôre sorry you‚Äôve been having a hard time!‚Äù email, no one has provided us with the bill we need for reimbursement. There is no live chat or number to call, which is pretty astounding in 2021. I would never have used this platform if I thought I would be paying this much money, so at this point I basically feel like they lied to me and are lying to everyone when they say they‚Äôre covered by insurance. What a scam.

So far I‚Äôve worked with two different therapists. The first one no-showed for my 10-minute assessment and then canceled two subsequent sessions when I only get one per month. I missed out on my 30-minute session. Then I switched to another therapist who was again late for our 10-minute call and only showed up after I sent a message asking if we were still on for that day. Now I‚Äôve just been no-showed on my 30-minute session despite her confirming early in the week that we had a call scheduled. I‚Äôve been on this app for almost 2 months and haven‚Äôt even had a full appointment. Both therapists were very nice but apparently they all neglect to show up for sessions on time/at all. I haven‚Äôt really gotten any messages from my therapists either so I‚Äôve gotten nothing out of the experience except time wasted waiting for appointments to happen. Completely unprofessional and extremely disappointed

0 STARS! DO NOT USE THIS APP!TalkSpace requires a $199 charge to set up the app and schedule an appointment. The staff they advertise is obviously not even a real person. My initial evaluation for the $199 was rescheduled twice with less than 24 hours notice when their cancellation policy requires 48 hours if we need to reschedule with them. I only received one email back from ‚ÄúAmber‚Äù with no phone number or contact information and have not heard back regarding my refund request. I have reached out to the psychologist ‚ÄúJudith‚Äù that never confirmed either of the 2 appointments I scheduled with her and never responded to my message regarding this issue. Talk space is HORRIBLE! AGAIN DO NOT USE THIS APP. TalkSpace respond to my message ASAP and refund my $199 to my card and confirm no further charges will be on my account. This company is a scam and so unprofessional they should be ashamed for trying to scam individuals struggling with mental health. Shame on you!

I needed help from a psychiatrist and tried Talkspace. The initial matching agent lady was very nice and did her best to help me. However, once I started the matching process, it went downhill from there. First of all, all of the matches were the opposite gender from what I requested. I wrote back and was told that these were the only ones available, so I decided to try one. I finally chose the one who had the soonest appointment available, but the therapist never confirmed my appointment, and it was cancelled. I tried again to find an appointment that was sooner, and I was told by another matching agent that I had scrolled through all of the available doctors. I have since canceled the service and requested a refund. After the refund, the 2nd matching agent messaged me back in a weird tone asking how I ever had an appointment to start with since I had no credits on my account. Unprofessional and not at all helpful. Seek a different service.

I tried this app, they just want your money. I can‚Äôt even speak to my therapist because I don‚Äôt have enough money. The reason why I tried this out is because I have weird work hours and a regular sit down in an office therapist would not be ideal for me. The therapist was nice but she was basically like a friend that you rant to and she responded in a two min voice memo with worksheets. I do not have time for those. I asked customer support if they could refund me my $200 since I did not benefit anything from this app, the service is not what I paid for. They said they‚Äôd refund $90 so I was fine with that. They never responded/issued my refund. I kept responding in the same ticket about my refund, no response. I created a new ticket and they closed it without even a response. This is the worst thing ya‚Äôll could do to someone that is going through depression/anxiety/ptsd etc.

I have been actively trying to get matched with a therapist for over a month and continue to be ping ponged around in their broken systems.

Talkspace‚Äôs process is riddled with problems and promises features that it fails to deliver. From IT issues to incompetent customer support representatives that give you the runaround this ordeal has been taxing at best. 

The ‚Äúprovider match service‚Äù only provides you one option and when you try to book an appointment it loops you through an infinite sign in process.

Many people struggle with mustering the energy to seek mental health services. Their broken system adds additional frustration and mental fatigue.

My work provides me a series of free sessions but I ended up signing up with Alma instead. With Alma I was able to contact a provider within 24 hours. 

Let me re-state that‚Äî even with FREE SESSIONS Talkspace‚Äôs system is so broken that I am choosing to go to another service and pay for a provider. I could not imagine how furious I would be if I had to pay to get this runaround. 

If you have struggled to seek mental health care and you are taking that first step to find a provider: It is so hard to seek help and I am so proud of you for trying to navigate this. Please seek another service so you won‚Äôt be discouraged from seeking help. This runaround is not normal.

After doing TalkSpace last year, I keep thinking about therapy and how I‚Äôll probably likely never do it again after my experience with these guys. After a few sessions, I got told that this isn‚Äôt really supposed to be a chat app, but more of a way for me to be told some helpful things to do everyday that might make me more ‚Äúbalanced‚Äù and ‚Äúhappy‚Äù. Basically I didn‚Äôt feel like I could actually get anything off my chest or speak about a bad day because all my therapist would do was send me daily tasks like write what makes me thankful. I think those things are important to incorporate, but it just made me more upset. I stopped responding after maybe a week of this and lost out on my money because I paid for a month of service.

The intent behind the app is good what with being anxious and not wanting to go into talk to someone, but I just had a really bad experience.

The platform, process, introduction, and orientation  are very appealing initially, but after multiple therapists who No-Showed on meetings, didn‚Äôt respond to messages ever (talk space has a ‚Äúguaranteed response window‚Äù‚Ä¶ pfft!), and being charged my account/ insurance without any response from customer service, I cancelled my membership and took it as a life lesson. It‚Äôs unfortunate that the company would be so reckless with individual‚Äôs mental health and those seeking alternative guidance in the world today. I‚Äôm sure I could‚Äôve cycled through therapists and tossed away money until eventually landing on a good therapist, but if TalkSpace doesn‚Äôt care then why should I try. Very disappointing! If someone is seriously seeking betterment in their life with convenience, there are responsible apps out there. I switched a few weeks ago and it‚Äôs amazing! Someone should tell Michael Phelps about what he‚Äôs putting his name on.

If you plan on using an HSA card to pay, DON‚ÄôT DO IT! I have been waiting and waiting for a super bill because my HSA is requiring verification, and a regular old invoice or receipt isn‚Äôt what they want. I have requested this super bill multiple times, only to be met with the same automated response. I provide the information they‚Äôre asking for, then I never get another response. I‚Äôm on my third or fourth request for a super bill for my first month, and in the mean time Talkspace hit my card for another $280, so now my HSA wants verification for that too. This company shouldn‚Äôt be advertising how they accept HSA if they aren‚Äôt willing to provide the verification HSA needs in a timely manner. I liked my therapist but unfortunately I will not be continuing with Talkspace due to their poor customer support.

I should have known something was wrong when I tried to get ahold of customer service for a billing issue. Still haven‚Äôt heard back a week later. Resolved the issue myself but now I can‚Äôt get ahold of either therapist I matched with and apparently I don‚Äôt actually get the 1 session a week I paid for. Unfortunately for me I paid 3 months in advance (over $1,000) and there doesn‚Äôt seem to be any way to get my money back other than claiming fraud with my bank. I think it‚Äôs a good concept but they clearly don‚Äôt have the manpower at the moment to make it work. For how much they charge they should at least have a customer service phone number‚Ä¶but no just automated responses to your messages and no accountability. Hopefully your reading these reviews instead of seeing the App Store rating and purchasing this service like I did.

This review is focused primarily on the platform itself. I found getting started to be a clunky process. I had signed up for a plan that included a weekly live session. My first 3 therapists that I was connected with did not have availability for live sessions. Once I found a therapist that did have live sessions, the times I requested for live sessions always had to be moved as they conflicted with a session she already had scheduled. 

Ultimately, this platform is not right for me. I signed up while I was in the midst of a major depression and wish I'd recognized that not having a dedicated session time more frequently wasn't going to work. An expensive mistake as I signed up for a quarter. The therapist I landed on would have been a great fit on another platform, but I'm going to cut my losses.

As with everything else in US healthcare, it‚Äôs profit-center disguised as empathy and compassion. 
I recently had my existing therapist switch firms, and unfortunately they were no longer able to take my employer health insurance. I‚Äôve been unable to find anyone in the months since.
I was recommended to check out Talkspace from a friend, and my first question is actually google‚Äôs most common search: ‚ÄúDoes Talkspace accept insurance?‚Äù
The answer that Talkspace uses is ‚Äú40 million Americans have their Talkspace covered by their insurance or employer.‚Äù
In fact, there‚Äôs a prompt for it in the settings with drop down menus to all of the health insurance plans available in the country. Something seemed fishy though, as I couldn‚Äôt progress any further.
When I talked to my ‚Äúmatch specialist,‚Äù I was told ‚ÄúWe generally don‚Äôt accept insurance.‚Äù

If a company is going to be this deceptive and dishonest with its messaging before I‚Äôve even started, what does that say about their ethics?
‚Äú40 million Americans have their Talkspace covered by their insurance or employer‚Äù doesn‚Äôt exactly scream ‚Äúwe generally don‚Äôt accept insurance,‚Äù does it?

The app takes weeks to match you to a provider but they still run the clock on your credits so your sessions expire. Providers have no availability so you pay for a month and can‚Äôt use your sessions. Have not heard back from customer support in TWO WEEKS. There is no phone support, only email that goes into a black hole. One provider missed my video session and then tried to force me to use chat only. Another provider is ignoring my requests to reschedule even though I brought it up at my last session. The app does not give you a way to reschedule nor cancel a session yourself. When you go to the session details page it is blank even on a new iPhone with latest iOS. The only way to reschedule or cancel a session is through your provider. Which you can‚Äôt do if they won‚Äôt respond.

Be careful. They say they take insurance but no you create an account and it says it will look at your insurance and then work with your insurance company. Lies. Got two bills very large and it was ridiculous. Our insurance covers mental health and pays for counseling. They did not charge insurance at all. Then when you try to check the insurance, it makes you upload the information again but it wants you to make a new account. If you put a in a request it takes forever to hear back from still in the process. All I can say is be wary of this app and the fact that it ‚Äútakes insurance‚Äù. Very disappointed!

Please do not say send feedback to the email address and we will respond in one day because this is a lie. If it were true then you would have responded to our support issue in the first place‚Ä¶

Unless you are ready to book that day, and luckily run into no issues, maybe it won‚Äôt matter that there‚Äôs no customer service hotline, and all customer service tickets are handled by bots. 

I tried to use their service for the first time, didn‚Äôt hear back from my matched provider for 5 days because she was out on vacation. (Why did they match me with someone not even available?) She won‚Äôt be free for another week!  The plan I chose was 4 sessions for the month, this means you have 4 credits you HAVE to use within a 4 week period. You get no refunds. Not just prorated refunds, but I haven‚Äôt spoken to anyone yet and already I want to cancel but there is NO option to if you change your mind. I‚Äôm now scrambling trying to squeeze 4 sessions within a 2.5 week period because this app is stupid.

I tried three different therapists and none of them helped at all. I had a partner recently passed away due to a traumatic accident and was not given any real tools to work on my PTSD, but instead was chocked up to ‚Äústages of grief‚Äù. They never checked in and do not really care about your well being, it‚Äôs just an extra paycheck to them as most have in person clients already. They honestly don‚Äôt seem to know what they are doing. Most don‚Äôt even know how to work the app. I was charged for a full session and we did nothing. The entire time the therapist was trying to figure out how to do live messaging. We both messaged the help center and I didn‚Äôt hear back for two weeks‚Ä¶how is that helpful? My takeaway is this app is a waste of time and money full of mediocre therapists looking for quick cash.

Waited over a month at this point to get my situation fixed. Once I ran out my 5 free sessions with a therapist, I set up my payment method to continue therapy. But it still said i have no credits available, so I can‚Äôt book more therapy sessions.

 I messaged support three times within 3 weeks about this issue and no response. Once I did get a response they said they fixed the issue and closed my ticket without confirming it was fixed. Lowe and behold, the issue is not fixed and I still can‚Äôt add credits for sessions. So now I‚Äôve been waiting 2 more weeks after having to make a new support ticket in order to get another response. 5 weeks now and still no therapy for me. Doesn‚Äôt seem like they care about me or my mental health at all. I‚Äôll be going to BetterHelp from now on.

I started their services because i was in dire need of help. I filled out my insurance information and everything, took their little survey‚Äôs and they matched me with a provider. I started messaging her right away and didn‚Äôt get a response for a day. Cool no big deal at least she responded. As SOON as she sent the message the next day, i sent in a reply and then nothing. For two days. Not to mention i said i was suicidal and to not get a reply from her after stating that i was having issues was beyond frustrating. She never answered so i cancelled my account. Don‚Äôt waste your time on this app, go to better help instead or work on getting a therapist through your insurance. Seems like all this app and their providers care about is milking the clock to get more money. Biggest waste of my time.

I just read the other reviews. So many of us were robbed. I‚Äôm down for taking legal action if anyone else is?
 I wasn‚Äôt matched for with a therapist for almost a week and when I did match, they immediately took $396 dollars without any approval on the provider. 
The therapist had 1 year experience, and apologized that she didn‚Äôt have experience with the one thing I signed up for. 
We parted ways nicely via one text. 
The app is too busy and basic to provide actual health care. I asked for a refund (and it‚Äôs not easy to get) and they kept 100$ of the refund. It sounds like a good idea, but it‚Äôs just an expensive experiment. I never had a single session or a talk: Lost $100 bucks?! No one returns my emails. I have to dispute the charges with my CC now. They only exist to take money from people who need help.

Is therapy supposed to be frustrating? Are you supposed to have to spend more time communicating with customer service than talking to your therapist? If the answers to the above were yes, this would be the best service ever. My therapist continually cancelled my appointments (she cancelled 3 out of 4) with her, so I only got to talk to her once. When I tried to get assigned to a new therapist, they were unable to find one for me. Their system registers any messages sent as sessions too, so I made sure not to send any messages and only use live sessions. The issue is that my therapist was constantly sending messages. Even though I didn‚Äôt respond to them, Talkspace still credited them against my account as sessions. Such a rip off‚Ä¶added stress to my life when I was looking for tools to reduce stress.

I signed up for talk space as I have been unsuccessful with other types of therapy in the past, and it is hard for me to fit anything more in my schedule. I went through the initial stages is signing up and selected a provider based on their recommendations (bots), signed all the intake forms and never got a response after waiting almost a full week. This is after messaging the provider to see if she had the capacity to take me on as a client after I had waited a few days for a response. It is not what is advertised, which is sad because I thought this would be a good avenue for someone with my crazy schedule. I canceled my subscription and requested a refund cause let‚Äôs face it I didn‚Äôt actually use their service, but after requesting a refund was only able to get the partial amount.

I was referred by my mom's work to get this as it is covered under her insurance plan. They basically offered a free trial, but once that was over, it became ridiculously difficult to make an insurance claim. I really like my therapist, but I might have to find a new one because the full service costs about $100 per week. I could be wrong about the exact cost, I don't care. It's too expensive to pay for without insurance. I can't get the app to take my insurance, which does cover the service. Customer support does not have a phone number, you just have to send a message and hope that someone responds within the week. 

I've seen reviews here of people unsatisfied with their therapists, but I think the service itself is the problem. Absolutely laughable cash grab.

Three different therapists. Three terrible experiences. 
The first therapist that I was paired with was a very kind lady. Her profile s said she was new to talkspace. Even with that fact‚Ä¶I thought I‚Äôd give it a try. After 2 weeks of very slow (copy and paste) textbook responses, I decided to try a different therapist. 
Second therapist after only 3 or so hours decided that I had a substance abuse issue. Hadn‚Äôt asked me any detailed questions about me or my life yet. Not sure how someone could come to that conclusion via text after just a basic first
Interaction. 
Third therapist. Even with my prior experiences I went in with a positive attitude. I didn‚Äôt take my frustrations out on her. What made up my mind to walk about from talkspace was what happened next. I sent a message on a Tuesday sharing my bad experiences so far and I was thinking about walking away, and it being a waste of money. Third therapist didn‚Äôt even look at it or respond until Sunday! 
Maybe whoever reads this will have a better experience than I did. Maybe not. That‚Äôs for your to decide. I‚Äôm just one person telling lots
Of people that it‚Äôs not worth the money or time.

Perhaps it‚Äôs me, but it seems like the therapists are just answering with an automated messages and more evaluations, which I just completed. She states she wants to know my story, which I put allot of effort in and then you get these automated messages back. I will try a face to face therapist now.
Also if you try to cancel your subscription you will be asked 8, yes 8!!!! Times if you are sure you want to cancel, I mean this is insane. If you want to cancel, you should be able to do this without being asked 8 times if you are sure and trying to lure people in. Again, this could be just me thinking this, but I will leave it here for the world to read.

Talkspace provides a virtual platform to connect with therapists for mental health which is awesome. What‚Äôs not awesome is their customer support team. I was told my plan would expire in 2023 after some confusion about it ending prior. Then my plan is canceled without my prompting and I‚Äôm told I was given incorrect information. This is so incredibly frustrating considering it is my main support for positive mental health. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed and upset that I won‚Äôt be able to continue. Their support team frequently takes a week or longer to reply, and this would happen with some of their providers as well. It seems like an environment that doesn‚Äôt support growth on either end. What a shame when the potential is so great!

I wonder if Talkspace actually looks into the people providing care. I know they don‚Äôt respond to complaints or concerns so I doubt it. My therapist never responded to me even on days when we had a session or she cancelled a session. There was no daily interaction or daily assistance. 

I saw my provider twice before she started cancelling last minute and I was never given the ability to reschedule so I paid for 4 sessions and only received half with no way to reschedule or get a refund. The second month I was charged and had 0/4 sessions due to last minute cancellations. Still limited help from Talkspace with automatically generated responses. I have filed with the better business bureau. Perhaps then I will get a response?

The builders should be ashamed of themselves. With all the mental health issues going on right now, they are stealing from people who are seeking help. Despicable!!!!! 

1. They force you to prepay for sessions before you use them. 

2. They pair you up with a therapist on their own. No choice on your end but request another. 

3. My therapist canceled twice on me an hour before my appointment citing bad scheduling! 

4. After 2 weeks of trying to schedule and the crap customer experience I attempted to cancel.

5. The cancellation system forces you to cancel your account  first so you lose access to customer service and the app, then you have to click on a link emailed to you to request a refund.

6. Refund process goes like this - click on link, you get offered a refund! Great no amount shows and you click accept the which another pop up comes up with ‚Äúconfirmation‚Äù so if you quick click ‚Äúok‚Äù and NOT NOTICE THAT ITS HALF WHAT YOU PAID FOR! That‚Äôs it! No recourse no support nothing!!! 

Save yourself and avoid these criminal companies seeking to take advantage of the people who are already in need of some mental health help.

The app really doesn‚Äôt feel like it is made to help people. I bought four sessions but the credits for sessions expires after four weeks, so if you can‚Äôt find a good time to talk with your therapist, you lose your money, and fork it over to the company instead.

Once you talk to your therapist, the clock starts to tick. If your therapist have a limited availability or go on a vacation, you are going have to keep pushing the meeting back, but when you do that, you have to forfeit your expired credits and buy new sessions.

One credit gets you one session that you have spend in a week. This feature is a pure money grab. It causes lots of unnecessary stress than actually helping.

I signed up to speak with a therapist who was scheduled 2 weeks out. Two days before the initial appointment I was just ghosted. Talkspace said the therapist never confirmed my appointment though I received several assessments that I spent time completing. Then I received a notice from Talkspace that they were canceling my account because I hadn‚Äôt selected a new therapist in time. I reached out to support, who sent me a message 5 days later saying they‚Äôd had a high volume of requests that were all pretty much resolved and to resubmit my request if it was still pending. At that point I elected not to move forward with Talkspace anymore. It sounded like a convenient app but has been nothing but headaches. I‚Äôve yet to speak with a human.

I had talkspace downloaded months ago and everything seemed as though it was going well. I signed up for the messaging plan as i was concerned about the cost of the live session plan. Well life throws us curve balls and i decided to redownload the software and try the live sessions. Everything seemed normal, until i have not been matched with a provider, still stuck with a matching provider who i am now believing has quit, or moved on to something different. So i find myself stuck, cant get matched with a therapist, all my old messages i can go back and read, and im paying a subscription that i am not receiving any time to even talk to anyone! I am very disappointed with the user experience. I would not recommend this app

If you want actual affordable therapy, use Cerebral. 
If you want overpriced journaling, use Talkspace.
The support for the app is poor. Cost is high for limited packages. In my experience it‚Äôs more expensive than in person therapy and I find I much prefer in person to this format. Video sessions are 30 minutes. The prices packages with one or more video session are higher, and while you can add more video time, I consider the video options cost prohibitive. I feel like I paid quite a lot to write a journal that someone kind of reads, and might respond to. It might work well for some. My preference is still in person or remote session therapy.

I signed up for talkspace hopeful for mental health help on a tight schedule. My therapist told me she was over booked and discharging clients before I even filled my intake paperwork out. She did not schedule my one on one until the day the second month charges would go through. I cancelled the membership and found out this is not FSA eligible as advertised because it is considered  a monthly subscription service. So I basically forked out a month of payment I thought was coming from my FSA, but instead had to use my personal account and got no services delivered. Contacted support multiple times and they were slow to respond and not helpful or apologetic about the situation. I highly recommend against this app.

Bought a month subscription and was optimistic about this given reviews, however my first appointment was canceled shortly after I booked it (which is fine, it was a holiday weekend). Second appointment booked a couple of weeks later and I logged in, however my therapist had problems connecting and canceled on me again. No alternative proposed (text chat was clearly working through the app) and now I‚Äôm still looking at a calendar trying to get in. Overall feels very impersonal - I‚Äôd recommend going with someone local in your community if possible instead.

Update 6/14: The developer commented below on this review which is great, but refers me to an email account which still has not responded to my above issue.

UPDATE: Unsurprisingly, I‚Äôve only received automated responses to my support emails (except one that didn‚Äôt go anywhere). 

First I was matched with a therapist that didn‚Äôt actually have any availability for live sessions. I shouldn‚Äôt even be able to match with a therapist with no availability. When I tried to find a new one I was notified that there were no more matches. I opened a case and from the customer service representative‚Äôs message it was obvious that they didn‚Äôt even read my message. I can‚Äôt imagine how stressful this would be for someone who isn‚Äôt in a great mental state. I absolutely cannot recommend, it almost feels like a scam. Trying to get my money back since it seems like I won‚Äôt be able to get what I paid for.

the system works fine if you‚Äôre initially matched to a counselor that will work for you. If not, the system will not allow you to switch, it will tell you to contact customer support and they will not get back to you. Several weeks later you‚Äôll get a response telling you to try the steps you‚Äôve already taken that don‚Äôt work. And they will bill you for those sessions that you‚Äôve never attended and there‚Äôs no way to get a refund until (ha) you contact customer service to get a response because by then, it will have been too long since your session that never happened. There‚Äôs also no way to remove your match that you wanted to replace.

I bought the video and text package, the most expensive you could get; guaranteed at least once daily text response and 4 video sessions. The therapist stopped responding to texts (this is not bombarding, rather making daily observation about issues and mental status) and then she no-showed for our second session. No notification, no apology, just ghosted. Zero professionalism. Talkspace offered a refund of $109 out of $436 I paid, I declined and requested $316, not a full refund as I was willing to compensate the therapist for the time she did dedicate, but Talkspace hasn‚Äôt responded. Nice app UX, garbage therapist, garbage customer service. Pay more for a real therapist that will respect your time.

They charged my card for 4 sessions ($396) without my awareness or any email or text, then booked me with a therapist who had no availability, then informed me 30 days later, just as they auto-billed my card again, that sessions expire each month regardless of whether I was seen or not. I scheduled with a new therapist who then didn‚Äôt have any availability until the last 2 weeks of my billing period, so I had to cram 4 sessions into 2 weeks. Way more anxiety than therapy. Honestly brutal customer service, I can‚Äôt imagine how bad this must be for anyone that has trouble navigating apps or websites. I‚Äôm ok but I‚Äôm 40 and get confused with apps sometimes. Feel really bad for older or less tech savvy people trying to get help.

I spent a week fruitlessly trying to find a provider to work with on this app. 

Their automatic match connected me with someone in the Midwest who was completely inappropriate for the issues I‚Äôm dealing with. The one halfway okay match told me flat out that she doesn‚Äôt want to work with me. 

Their matching system asks about the areas you want to work on ‚Äî it does NOT list all the areas that their FAQ claims they specialize in, btw, LGBQTIA is notably missing ‚Äî then modifies them to other issues, which may or may not be related, or completely ignores them. 

I contacted support to ask for help with matching as their system wasn‚Äôt working. The first response took several days to tell me how to search for a new match ‚Äî something that I‚Äôd obviously done already by my message. The second response said to wait another week and try again to see if more therapists are added for my area. 

So, yeah. When you‚Äôre selling time based subscription services that you can‚Äôt provide, I can see why delaying would be you‚Äôre preferred troubleshooting step. 

So shady.

I‚Äôve been having ongoing issues with this company. Either they don‚Äôt accept my Visa cards or my insurance company and charge me mote than my copay. When I speak to my insurance provider they can see the recent claims from Talkspace and I do have coverage to use them, but every time my therapist or I try to book a session there‚Äôs always an issue. When I try to reach out to support there‚Äôs no use, it‚Äôs always an automated response and on top of that, the response is a week after I sent the original email. There‚Äôs no customer service either when you do have any inquiries. This is extremely unethical especially for a app that‚Äôs supposed to provide virtual therapy. I DO NOT RECOMMEND TALKSPACE TO ANYONE !

It took them approximately two weeks to get back to me when I asked them if they accepted my insurance. Their ‚Äúinsurance checker‚Äù doesn‚Äôt even tell you if they accept your insurance. It just asks you for your info then beelines to the payment page.

I got connected pretty to my therapist quickly unlike the other reviews. But trying to book a time with her just yields endless loading screens and white screens. Talkspace really needs to invest in proper UX/UI and devs. Their website and app just takes the user in circles where they have to re-enter the same info over and over and over again.

I used this app for six months because they told me every week that it was covered by my insurance. After that six months they started billing me for my past sessions because they filed it wrong and my insurance didn‚Äôt cover it. So for six months they lied to me saying it was free and wasn‚Äôt. Then when I tried to talk to them about the bills they ignored me until it was due and I had to pay before it went to collections. They also have no phone number so good luck trying to get anyone to actually answer you. And their ‚Äúfeedback‚Äù email, no one ever answered me. Use another company, because Talkspace has showed me that they will lie and cheat the people that come to them for help.

First, it took weeks to match with a provider. When I finally did, the provider cancelled what was to be our first session immediately when it began saying she had ‚Äútech issues and ‚Äúif video didn‚Äôt work immediately, it wouldn‚Äôt work for the session and we need to reschedule.‚Äù She told me she had availability Thursday, so I picked a time. The next day, I get a notice that she‚Äôs suddenly on vacation for 10 days and the day after that, I get a notice she is no longer on Talkspace. This whole experience makes me think the person was some kind of scam. Who is vetting these people? In a time of widespread mental health crises, Talkspace was supposed to be here to help but it‚Äôs been nothing but misery and wasted time.

Very disappointing experience. First psychiatrist was very nice, however after my second month she no longer responded to me and I just stopped taking the meds she prescribed because I had concerns. Seems very dangerous and irresponsible to me. 

Second psychiatrist I messaged him and said my therapist believes I should get tested for adhd. He told me to make an appointment so I did. That appointment lasted 5 minutes and consisted of him telling me he can‚Äôt help me‚Ä¶..okay I understand, but you couldn‚Äôt have told me that when I messaged him on the first place? Made me feel like they just wanted me to spend the money on the appointment. Made me feel stupid.

Please if you are dealing with mental health issues, go elsewhere.

Paid close to $300 to sign up. Still haven‚Äôt spoken to a provider and being given the run around to get back a refund. Multiple emails to their support team and they provided automated responses only this far. I really should have read the reviews before signing up to check out this service (which looked promising from the outside when I signed up), since it seems lots of other people are having similar issues. A real disappointment. I even said in my email to their support team that I don‚Äôt need a refund if someone can call me, then I would choose to give them another chance. No one has bothered to contact me yet.

Had a genuinely awful experience with Talkspace. Was really disappointing since I was very much looking forward to using the app and starting with a therapist. My insurance should have a covered majority of the cost of the app, but I have been charged full price. When I reached out to Support they have been unresponsive. Have not heard back from anyone and it‚Äôs been over a week. Also, The therapist that I worked with was incredibly unprofessional. She was late to our first video session and missed our second one completely due to ‚Äúcomputer issues‚Äú. She was also unresponsive via the messages and I had to initiate contact for her to tell me what to do next.

The app doesn‚Äôt work properly, every time I tried to have a live video sessions with my  therapist the app didn‚Äôt show the other had joined the session so the video session couldn‚Äôt be completed. We were only able to text each other and the app usually never notified my therapist I had sent her a message. Customer support is a joke. I swear it‚Äôs just a bots in customer support because they clearly never read your message and never answer your questions. If you do send a message to support, start off with that you want to talk to a supervisor. It was the only way I was able to finally get a refund since the app never worked to let me do a video session.

I have a plan from my work that I supplement because every provider available recommends more than the given plan. That said, the platform just really doesn‚Äôt provide a lot of mental health support. It‚Äôs frustrating to try to find a provider, I keep having to fill out the same information over and over again to be told it‚Äôs taking longer than it should be and to try again tomorrow. Same with booking an appointment once you are paired with one. I literally dread using it and wish my employer would give the money they‚Äôre spending using it to us for mental health support that actually supports instead of making it worse.

The service was offered through my employer‚Äôs medical coverage so I was amenable to paying the $20 up front; however, the only service I received was being kicked around between various counselors because I asked for a weekly ~60 minute virtual visit in lieu of having another person to have to text throughout the week. The counselors either could not meet with me for several weeks or did not bother to give a thoughtful/helpful response. Maybe this service is good for people to like to talk about their lives and feelings over text message but I would like more personal service.

Our therapist was great but due to insurance issues I had to make some changes which were totally mismanaged by customer service causing me to lose sessions that I had already paid for. 
Then when I got different insurance I again reached out to customer service and after waiting several weeks for a response I received a reply that was generic and not at all related to the questions I had asked. 
It is as if customer service does not even read or take the time to comprehend customers issues before cutting & pasting generic replies.
If they even bother to reply to this review I suspect it will also be generic and not respond to my complaints

Customer Support: 100% Non-existent. An ‚Äúautomated‚Äù refund wizard is buggy and useless. Accepts Health Insurance: They pretend to, but don‚Äôt. Rather they trick you into thinking their services will be covered by your health insurance and then bill your card without consent. Experienced therapists: They don‚Äôt share therapists backgrounds or credentials, so who knows. It‚Äôs sad to see an organization pretending to address mental health by ripping off those seeking help for mental illness. Michael Phelps should disassociate from this racket, and Apple should remove it from the app store. I would hope others have considered reporting their experience to the NY AG fraud department. Edit: Don‚Äôt be fooled by their sympathetic reply to this. They have 0 support. 0 replies.

I tried this as it is included with my insurance, but I cannot believe that a company is trying to profit off of much needed mental health services like this. 

You need to let patients select their therapist. It is insane that providers are randomly assigned to people. I requested a provider with experience handling PTSD and depression and got a new graduate who specializes in anxiety. Then the plan cancellation requires me to rate them even if we haven‚Äôt had a session. I gave a 5 stars to the provider as it‚Äôs not their fault the technology isn‚Äôt working, however the cancellation reasons then only allow you to select tech issues or some variety of blame on the provider. Absolutely insane.

Very poor customer service!

I am a resident doctor who needed someone to talk to after going through the Covid pandemic after being surrounded by death and sorrow for a year. Despite what people think, residents actually don‚Äôt make very much money at all. 

I am, however, eligible to get reimbursed for my mental health expenses from my hospital if I send them some basic information about the therapy that I‚Äôm receiving (things like diagnosis, therapist information, etc‚Ä¶)

I contacted customer service multiple times, and they would never contact me back! I just got my first reply since October (4 months ago!) The problem still isn‚Äôt resolved, and I‚Äôm spending what little money I have out of pocket on my mental health because of their poor customer service.

There is no way to call, you can only send text messages through the app and you will not get a response. Not only is the Talkspace customer service abysmal, but they should truly be ashamed of themselves. They are doing active harm to people.

DON‚ÄôT SAY YOU WEREN‚ÄôT WARNED!

This is a terrible app! Definitely do not download it‚Ä¶. Go and get a real therapist!

They make you pay hundreds of dollars upfront and then you get matched with therapists who aren‚Äôt even specifically what you were looking for. In our case this was simply couples therapy‚Ä¶ not exactly an uncommon need. They managed to produce only 3 therapists!

Worse still, after being charged around $300 for the month of October, (which would renew in November), I then found out my therapist couldn‚Äôt even have an introductory call with me until January 2022!!!

Oh and it gets worse. When I then tried to raise this with customer support, they just ignored me until 3 days later when they finally responded after numerous attempts to contact them. All in all it took about a week to get my money back.

If somebody was suffering from severe anxiety, stress or depression, I would go as far as saying this useless app could actually cost lives. It should be banned from the App Store!

DON‚ÄôT SAY YOU WEREN‚ÄôT WARNED

I think this is the only time I‚Äôve ever left a review for an app in 10 years of having an iPhone.  The therapists cancel appointments on the same day with no explanation.  They talk more than they listen. They waste the entire session. And then if you actually need support from the company you literally never get a response. I sent in 5 different support requests over the span of 7 days and not one of them got a response.  I finally had to delete the app.  I paid $500+ for one month of service and got literally no help at all.  A complete waste of time, zero support, zero help.  A total waste.

My therapist just sent me workbooks and pamphlets to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù me with my problems. She was incredibly hands off. After trying to find another female therapist, the app kept recommending male therapists until eventually it directed me to the matching agent. I didn‚Äôt really want to wait around and waste even more money so I cancelled my subscription and received 3/4 of my money back. I truly felt like I was robbed. I thought that this would be a good place to have a back and forth conversation with someone, but I could have gotten the materials she gave me from Google‚Ä¶ for free. I only wish there was a free trial period so that I could have saved that money for real therapy.

I never leave reviews but I‚Äôm so dissatisfied with this service that I have to help other people. 

Do not spend a large amount of money on this service. I paid 430 dollars for a monthly subscription and it‚Äôs close to the end of the month and I received no help. My therapist hasn‚Äôt looked at my messages. So I reached out to customer support and they sent me an automated message about a refund and I clicked the link and the system told me that I was not eligible for a refund. There‚Äôs no number to call to speak with a person either. The entire operation is sketchy. 

Please please please consider another service until these people get it together.

I was excited to try Talkspace when my company offered the service. Now after being on Talkspace for a month I am disgusted by this service. My company plan provides 1 live session a month. When you first sign up you get a 10 min live consultation. My provider cancelled 5 mins before because she had a family emergency. She said it would come back so I could rebook but my free consultation was never reimbursed. 
Then I booked my 30 min live session with her. She did not show up or answer any of my messages asking where she was. 

I reached out to Talkspace a week ago asking for a new provider and a reimbursement of my live session that I lost because she didn‚Äôt show up.
They have still not responded to my ticket. 

For a company that is supposed to be helping people I am disturbed that they are making it so hard to get help. I am currently in the process of speaking with my company about the potential of them changing services from Talkspace.

You login, there‚Äôs a multi-step process to sign up. Mind you, people seeking out this app probably aren‚Äôt in the best place to fill in a form and verify their email address. Then you get directed to a traffic controller that doesn‚Äôt respond immediately and you can wait up to an hour before getting contacted by even a person to help, let alone a licensed therapist. Take it off the market, Apple. It‚Äôs even more shameful because this app is supposed to help people in need. You think those that download an app blinking tears away are going to deal with this? I hope not, they deserve better.

The matching agents  leave you in the middle of conversations. If you don't meet their criteria, they just don't talk to you. They just send you resources and never reply even when you try to send a message back. You can't get past the screen, so you're stuck there. This is extremely insensitive. I don't really understand how the value is to make therapy easy and affordable. They only partner with three insurance plans, and if you're not one of them, they're like, oh, we only work with self paid clients. They don't even TRY to understand your situation, I'm actually wondering if we're talking to humans or robots.

I did the package with video for 450? The first provider I got we talked once and then I didn‚Äôt hear from them for over a week, since it wasn‚Äôt a great vibe I changed provider.  The. That provider was away and then we we had a meeting scheduled they cancelled and hour before meeting, had to reschedule but no openings for a week.  Basically I‚Äôve been in the service for a month and a half and paid for 8 sessions but I only have 3 left, but they expire, but I‚Äôve only had 2 initial conversations goodbye 900 ( I think I got a refund of 100?).   It‚Äôs actually sad because I really could have used someone to talk to.

It‚Äôs a bit dangerous to offer a therapist / a way of talking to someone about your mental health issues only for that therapist to ignore your messages. 

When that happened the app suggested a new therapist that had nothing to do with my mental health issue and then I was told there were no other therapists nearby (I live in a major metropolitan city). 

Not worth it, I was super excited to try this but TalkSpace - make sure you have reliable therapists. I will be okay and will keep trying to find one in a different way, but others may not be.

I tried TalkSpace when they first started and was immediately matched to an amazing therapist who really helped me overcome my GAD and PTSD. I have been having difficulty since then and decided to try talk therapy again. This app unfortunately has went down the drain and it‚Äôs unfortunate to someone who may be starting out with therapy and incredibly discouraging. I signed up for a 1 month membership - having an acute situation to work through. I was matched with a therapist that appeared perfect. I set up a 10 minute consultation and we went through the ‚Äúpaperwork.‚Äù She was kind and professional. She suggested I book my first video session as her calendar was filling up quickly. The first available appointment was over a month out at an extremely inconvenient time. I contacted her and let her know I couldn‚Äôt wait a month. Additionally, the other therapists I matched with were not at all skilled in areas I needed. I sent an email to customer service requesting a cancellation of service. No where when I signed up was I informed that schedules would be so far out or so difficult to accommodate. I went through the cancellation and refund request steps and was refunded 2/3rds of the total amount paid, even though I used NONE of the service provided and cancelled w/in days of signing up. I have reached out to their customer support team at minimum of 5 times with no response. I even contacted the extremely nice (and obviously busy) therapist for assistance. She was told someone would contact me - still nothing! There is no phone number to contact this company! I have never experienced anything like this. How can a company that is supposed to assist with ‚Äúmental challenging times‚Äù be the one that creates the most stress in your life? I am unable to move forward with my local therapist without my full deposit. His services are more expensive and that money is critical ‚Ä¶. I would NEVER suggest that anyone use this service. Although it appears that there are some well qualified therapists, if you ever become in a situation where you require help from the company, it‚Äôs nowhere to be found! Hopefully, at some point, I will be able to provide some sort of update ‚Ä¶ but in my opinion, this is deceptive boarding on fraud‚Ä¶

Not one to leave reviews but just want to warn people away from this app. TLDR - as far as my experience is concerned this is a scam, they rope you in with initial responsiveness and as soon as you pay you are stranded without support or appointment availability for months while you pay.

First interaction with the person assigning you to a therapist was great, immediate responses and good support explaining how the service works. As soon as I was assigned my first therapist though it went immediately downhill, they had no availability for appointments and when I asked over chat the therapist responded (rudely) saying they were overbooked and way over their allotted appointment number. They then probably realized I was a customer for help and not a bot/scheduler asking and changed their tone but they still could not take me and could not help me find a new therapist who did have time. I reached out to customer support to help me change therapist but I had no response (over one week to this date). I finally figured out that rating the therapist negatively would allow me to change provider and after doing that and trying my best to pick someone who according to the app had matching availability / experience I got stuck with someone who had just a 10 min slot 2 months away. So once again I am in a position where I cant change therapist so the money I paid for this month looks

I understand that therapists are busy and its hard to book appointments but you cant have a monthly paid service in which you recommend unavailable people to new subscribers and give them no way out or support. As far as I am concerned the approach of pulling you in with responsiveness to leave you stranded for months  while you pay is the definition of a scam, no matter how fancy your app is and how much celeb advertising you have.
The providers in my state were all NPs. There were no MDs available. Use BetterHelp app.
Unresponsive, no shows by therapists, unhelpful and uncaring advice. Save your $$ and go somewhere that cares.

I‚Äôve had issues with every session except for my first. Here‚Äôs a running list:

* Have had to cancel/reschedule because the app isn‚Äôt working
* Lost half a session troubleshooting why they couldn‚Äôt see or hear me in the room and vice versa
* The app has blocked my counselor from booking sessions when we try to reschedule
* Sessions have disappeared from their calendar
* The app has allowed them to double book causing them to have to cancel
* Customer support is MIA and takes weeks to get back to you so don‚Äôt expect technical support

All this is when you finally get a counselor. Signing up for a counselor who is a good fit and has availability is a nightmare. 

Previously I was using better help and it just worked. You take a survey and you get matched with providers who specialize in the areas you want to work on. Easy. 

Talkspace shows you three people and in my case they did not have the expertise I specified. I decided to give it a chance and try someone. Well they had no availability for 3 weeks. And it was sparse after that. Not to mention their schedule was 7am-1pm, which did not fit my schedule. I went to switch counselors but the app requires you to rate counselors before switching. I reached out to Talkspace to see if they could help. A few days went by and I figured I was on my own so I rated them 4 stars to move on. Talkspace got back to me 3 weeks later. 

I ended up with a therapist I liked because the second time around I hit refresh to see providers until I could get a hint from the tiny bio that they might have expertise in areas I needed. The problem is that when you refresh those matches the previous ones are gone if you decide you‚Äôd like to go back to someone. It feels a bit like the app is removing choice in a way that is counter to therapy. The therapeutic relationship is super important it needs to be a good fit or you do more damage than help.

My therapist is great but we have had technical issues 90% of my sessions that result in canceling, rescheduling or losing lots of session time. This kind of makes therapy impossible. I‚Äôve reached out to be credited for lost sessions but still haven‚Äôt heard back. Until they fix basic functionality I would stay away from this app. If you have the option I would go with better help.

My experience with Talkspace was very frustrating for a few reasons. 
Although the therapist I was matched with was awesome, the frustrations with the app and how payment is structured lead me to quit and also lose about $400.
Note: I have been doing different forms of teletherapy for a few years now, including using BetterHelp. While not perfect, I still believe the pros outweigh the cons of teletherapy vs in person .
1. Talkspaces payment method gives you ‚Äúcredits‚Äù for therapy sessions . I paid $400/month for the privilege  of scheduling 4 therapy sessions in a month. If you don‚Äôt use them, you lose them in the next billing cycle .
2. You can‚Äôt just set up a weekly time to meet with your therapist. Instead, every month you need to schedule for that month. So, if you forget to schedule right away, you may miss a week or a few.
3. If your therapist does not have times available, then you are out of luck. This would not be a problem if you could just schedule a set time every week to meet with your therapist. This is how typical therapy as well as Better Help works . 
4. I had to reschedule a session prior to when the scheduled session took places. My therapist was fine with rescheduling , but without my knowledge I got charged an extra $65 dollars for the session . My therapist was not aware that this would happen either. 
5. Finally, For the month of March I had 3 sessions scheduled using the credits I had already paid for. However, because i chose to not renew my monthly subscription, with a renewal on March 10- the system shut me out on the last day of the billing period , even though I still had sessions scheduled that were prepaid for. So, I essentially paid $400 to just have one session . 
As someone with anxiety, this app made my anxiety worse . I would tell any therapists or clients  to avoid this app at all costs, it is not worth the confusion and frustration .

I sent my first message to a therapist in early September. Waited 3 weeks. got no reply. Switched my therapist. Sent the same message to my new therapist end of September. Got no reply. I messaged talkspace to tell them I was disappointed. Deleted the app. In December  (over 4 months later!!) I got an email saying my therapist sent me a message. So I reinstalled the app. It was a generic message asking how I was doing but I was just glad to get a response. So I responded to the message. No reply for a few days. Then another message: ‚Äòhi how are you doing?‚Äô No response to the quite specific information I had given in my initial message or my response to the first one.. so I asked if this was a real person. ‚ÄòYes my name is...*****‚Äô then a few days later, ‚ÄòI hope you‚Äôre doing well‚Äô so once again I responded with a specific response about how I was actually doing. Nothing. Days go by. So I tell the therapist ( and sent a message to talkspace support again)that I don‚Äôt see how this is supposed to be helping me or in any way construed as therapy and that maybe they don‚Äôt have time to take me on as a client.. Therapist then responds (very quickly this time) that they are so sorry but they are recovering from COVID. Wow. Why would you have people providing a service that for whatever reason they cannot provide? So am I supposed to feel bad because I expected actual therapy or Counseling from a counseling service??? What is the point of this????

It is literally impossible to choose a therapist that fits your schedule as you don‚Äôt know theirs until you pick them. Then you are locked into choice hoping person reaches out to you via text daily and video call weekly according to your insurance plan. If your therapist tells you to book next day, you can‚Äôt cancel less than 48 hrs without being charged for a no session (even if therapist cancels on you). If therapist chooses not to do video (so they can do other things while you are in a session like care for a baby) or decides to put you in speakerphone (a HIPPA violation of privacy), you‚Äôre out of luck (and sessions). Emailed ‚Äúticket‚Äù notes to TS is never answered until weeks later and they threaten to close the ticket if they don‚Äôt hear from you (no advance warning and no person our department to call). A waste of money and time as they use covid as an excuse to delay responding to your glitches joining a scheduled session due to technical difficulties. After over 1 month of trying to actually schedule a meet with someone, I gave up and TS charged my insurance for 1 session therapist canceled last minute and stated they couldn‚Äôt do on their end nor could they give me a session back. Another one had a speaker phone convo while tending to their baby and refused to go on video. Of course, month long billing already expired and. O sessions were achieved. Now they want to do an assessment on me- with what sessions to measure?

I originally wanted to try talkspace because I have a tendency of running away after a few sessions. I thought the low commitment of talkspace might be helpful to me. Seems like low commitment is all you get from your therapists. I went through two different therapists that just wrote fortune cookie grade short responses that I‚Äôm sure they only wrote those so they wouldn‚Äôt get in trouble with talkspace as they‚Äôre required to respond to you in a certain time frame. I feel like that system is made with good intentions, but it seems seriously abused by the therapists. I absolutely would not recommend the therapists on this app. Your money is better spent on a REAL therapist. I‚Äôm sure the ones on here are better in person, but the system just makes it ripe for abuse.

The app itself is great to use and the user experience and onboarding process is great and welcoming, but that‚Äôs where the feeling of progress stops.
