I had nothing but great things to say about talkspace and my therapist of nearly 2 years, up until recently... now, I would recommend that everyone stay AWAY from this service and this company, who doesn‚Äôt seem truly invested in mental well-being at all. 

Without warning, without indication she was taking time away, my therapist stopped responding to messages, there was no formal termination of care, and I haven‚Äôt been able to get ahold of her for 3 months now. I can see that she has ‚Äúread‚Äù texts I‚Äôve sent, but they go unanswered. She literally just ghosted on me. I am mentally vulnerable and was dealing with a lot during the Covid pandemic, self isolating for over 400 days due to being high risk. Talkspace doesn‚Äôt provide you with any sort of recourse for a situation like this. To make matters worse, there are apparently ‚Äúno records‚Äù covering my care from my therapist, so if I wanted to change providers (inside OR outside of talkspace), I‚Äôm going to have to start from literally ground zero. Over 2 years of therapy on talkspace is over $5,000 worth of time that I have spent working on many topics with my therapist, and talkspace is not doing much to help me get my records (which are legally my property). This company treats mental health patients as if they are using a service like Uber. They don‚Äôt hold themselves accountable when things go wrong. I‚Äôm constantly told how my ‚Äúconcerns are being escalated‚Äù but nothing changes. Now, after being abandoned by a provider I trusted and worked with for 2 YEARS, I am afraid to trust another provider. It will take me months, if not years to recover from the trauma of being abandoned by my therapist when I really needed her. Talkspace offers me no solutions of how I can get my records or what I can do. There‚Äôs no consequence for the abandonment and I had to fight to get money back for the weeks I went without therapy. 
I‚Äôm disappointed‚Äî the concept could‚Äôve been great, but clearly there is no protection for patients being really hurt when a therapist on talkspace fails to uphold their professional duty and obligations.

I‚Äôm wholeheartedly disappointed and thoroughly traumatized by this very lonely experience

I struggle with an anxiety disorder and depression. I needed to start speaking with someone quickly and thought this would be a good way to do so while finding a local therapist for tele-visits. 

For the cost of the service I could have had three actual therapy sessions. I heard from the therapist after the time the app told me I would and they explained that they have no control over how many patients they have so they cannot even begin to meet the deadlines set in the app. We‚Äôre talking about 100 people being assigned to a single therapist. No one can be expected to provide quality therapy to that many clients. 

Did some more online research and found out that therapists are barely getting paid so why would there be any incentive for them to answer messages let alone provide meaningful responses? So yes, I could switch therapists, but then a person who has done nothing wrong but can‚Äôt keep up with Talkspace‚Äôs ridiculous client numbers gets penalized and I would just get shifted to another therapist in the same boat. It‚Äôs not right for either of us. 

I wish I‚Äôd researched them more before signing up but I was in need of help and short on time. Now they have my money, don‚Äôt offer refunds and I‚Äôm at square one and facing the same issues I signed up to get help managing on my own.  $300+ dollars has given me some generic exercises easily found in any CBT/DBT workbook and an expensive digital journal and no actual therapy. 

I feel cheated out of my therapy budget for the month and will not continue with the service. If you are struggling with any diagnosed condition this is not a good place to seek assistance. While they claim that it‚Äôs less expensive than traditional therapy, it‚Äôs not and the value for the money is low for both patients and therapists. Talkspace strikes me as a very predatory business taking advantage of already vulnerable people attempting to find legitimate help for actual health concerns. 

Spend your money elsewhere, their business model is harmful to both patients and therapists.
It cost money and they are kinda rude

I signed up for Talkspace and tried to get a therapist. First of all, they make you talk to something called a ‚ÄúMatching Agent‚Äù who isn‚Äôt the therapist. They talk to you about ‚ÄúWhat brings you to Talkspace?‚Äù This is completely wrong because it‚Äôs not the therapist. I was kind of tricked into opening up to this person. 

Rates are really bad. 
$65/week for JUST TEXTING. 
$260/month for JUST TEXTING. Oh, and a free 10 minute video session. I didn‚Äôt even look beyond this price point. 

Went with the $260. 

Then I picked ‚Äúmy‚Äù therapist. I typed to her and typed and typed. She never responded. Talkspace‚Äôs response to the FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTION of ‚ÄúWhy isn‚Äôt my therapist answering?‚Äù  was a pithy article about how ‚Äútherapists are humans too‚Äù and they‚Äôve got a lot of work to do, or something. I wish I could tell my boss that! 

Instead of an actual solution,  Talkspace offers TWO options: 1) wait for a reply or 2) choose a different therapist. 
(Then what the was all that ‚Äúmatching‚Äù for?)
I decided that I had spent WAY too much money to be ignored and wanted my money back. I submitted a request ticket stating that I hadn‚Äôt even gotten to use the services and I wanted my money back. They completely ignored my first service request. I ended up submitting 3 more service requests. Still ignored.  

Then, I went on Twitter. The ONLY WAY to get their attention was to get on Twitter and publicly decry them for stealing. I got a DM from whomever was running the Twitter and THEN AND ONLY THEN was I able to get my money back. I still haven‚Äôt actually gotten it back, it‚Äôs going to take 2-5 business days. 

Suffice it to say, they‚Äôre taking advantage of depressed people during a pandemic. The matching specialist never even offered up the fact that they accept insurance until AFTER  you‚Äôve already paid the money. Then, if you want to add your insurance card, that technically starts another ‚Äúaccount‚Äù, and both accounts will remain open AND auto renew unless you fix it and close the first one. It‚Äôs money. Money money money. Don‚Äôt use it. Spend the time searching for a REAL therapist that is covered by your insurance.

I was thoroughly disappointed - I thought this would be perfect for me with a busy and irregular schedule. The one live session I scheduled was canceled by talk space because the therapist never confirmed it.

The few responses I did get from the therapist were so boiler plate generic that I'm positive everyone gets exactly the same response. I felt like the after thought obligation of someone trying to "get their work done" while running out the door to a party. I sent very thorough messages, waited a long time for a response, then the response was generic, so I elaborated even more and waited again for another generic response. Really no "therapy" happening. You could achieve the same therapeutic benefit by just writing in a journal - the responses you get will be just as useful. 

I set up therapy through a local clinic that offers in person or telemedicine. They take my insurance unlike Talkspace, scheduling is easy, and they do therapy live over face time. For the same $260 per month, I could literally have 26 hours of LIVE sessions with a highly trained therapist over face time, due to insurance copay. You'd be surprised how many places are offering similar telemedicine these days. Talk space live session is very short, and I can't speak to how effective it is since my session got canceled. The talk space model is not necessary any more, since most clinics are offering telemedicine due to covid. 

Talkspace only issued a partial refund after I had the service for less than 3 days, literally 4 very generic responses from the therapist, 1 canceled live session, and not responding to my support ticket for multiple days. I sent support an email and got an automatic response which thankfully had instructions for canceling and requesting a refund. Unfortunately the refund is calculated pro rata automatically and I'm waiting for a response from a human being. As of this moment, I'm still out $35. I'm so tired of these companies that make it really easy to spend money, and really difficult to get it back if you're not satisfied.

Hopefully you will find a better experience. For me, it only served to increase the anxiety that I was hoping to relieve.
They owe me 199 because of a matching agents mistake .

A good concept but a disappointing experience.

First, it is very misleading when it says 24/7 chat. Some sort of chat therapy would be a really great thing to have, but that is not talkspace. They should openly say that you will only get one message a day from your provider 5 days a week. This is not what I expected.

The first week is all just about setting up your therapy, and with one message a day and multiple forms to get through, this goes at a snail's pace. It feels as though the therapist are trained to drag out the set up period for as long as possible. So the first week is essentially wasted, but you are still charged for it.

 The other thing which seems unethical about this app is it constantly threatens you that you'll lose your therapist and never be able to pick them again. I feel that if this were a legitimate mental health app and you could not afford a therapist for a couple of months that you should be able to get back your old therapist no matter how much time has gone by. Your issues are personal and therapy is meant to build on your relationship with a therapist.  

*Edit* To their credit the support team did refund me which I am very grateful for. 

I found my therapist online which seemed like he had his own practice, but when I messaged him saying that the Talkspace format was not going to work out for me and that I wanted regular therapy sessions, he said he was sorry and that he could only offer therapy through Talkspace. 

This was just my experience with one therapist but it makes me question the credibility of the therapists on talkspace, I'm just not sure if they are real or not. Either way, one text a day just wasn't going to work for me. :(
If you want to be ignored and denied a refund. Go for it

I‚Äôm an ER nurse and single mom who was in between insurances. You got me to sign up for one price that I agreed to then overcharged me over DOUBLE the following month when I barely had time to utilize services. 

I‚Äôm also canceling because you guys have a poor app and poor customer service with no receipt of acknowledgement that a ‚Äúticket‚Äù or email was received with an anticipated response time. 

Don‚Äôt create an app to make money off of the vulnerabilities of people with no intention of actually helping, only getting paid. With the amount of money you guys charge and therapists you have I‚Äôd think you'd have enough to pay a human to sit behind a 1-800 number. Very disappointing because my therapist Danielle was phenomenal.

For anyone wanting to use this app: don‚Äôt fall for the ‚Äúdeal‚Äù they give you to sign up. Also don‚Äôt pay for the audio and video chat options at first unless you think you will utilize them. I paid for them and the options were never offered to me so it was a waste. Also, they want this review to be about my ‚Äúprovider‚Äù not any ‚Äúapp or site‚Äù issues lol because they clearly have MANY. They cost more than an actual therapist!

Also, please don‚Äôt respond to this review with how ‚Äúsorry‚Äù you are (NOT) and giving me your feedback@talkspace email as you have copied and pasted with every other bad review. I‚Äôve emailed you multiple times with NO response. 

Reporting to Better Business Bureau and disputing bank charges. Kudos Talkspace CEO for attempting to take advantage of the mental health crisis we have in this country in an attempt to just make money!

I signed up for Talkspace at the beginning of November of 2020 after realizing I needed to seek counseling for my general anxiety and severe insecurity and social anxiety. Like most people who struggle with these things, particularly social anxiety, it took a great deal of courage to take the step to get help, especially because I had never been through therapy before due to cost and extreme hesitancy to reach out for professional help. This is something I mentioned repeatedly to my therapist and the matching representative throughout my brief time with Talkspace. 

I was assigned to a therapist named Lisa within a day or two of signing up with Talkspace. I was very open with my deep sense of imposter syndrome and social anxiety and though I wasn‚Äôt in immediate peril, it was really important for me to talk to someone so I could regain control of my life. It was going fine until I received a notification that my therapist would be on vacation until the end of December. At this point, it was around November 8, and I‚Äôd used Talkspace for less than a week. Neither Lisa nor Talkspace gave me any prior notification that she would be gone or gave me a substitute‚Äîor, assigned me to a therapist who didn‚Äôt have a month and a half vacation planned. Instead, the automated notification in my chat with Lisa said I was encouraged to keep sending messages to her so I could write down my feelings and she‚Äôd get back to me when she returned from vacation. Yes, Talkspace expected me to continue paying the fee for a MONTH AND A HALF while I message myself in an echo chamber. Especially as a person who struggles with self image and feeling valued by others‚Äîwhich, again, I made very clear to everyone at Talkspace I talked with‚Äîthis was a massive blow and completely undid what little therapy Lisa had provided me. 

I emailed Talkspace explaining the situation in detail, how horrible it made me feel, how irresponsible both Talkspace and Lisa were, and asking for a refund. I received a very sterile automated response telling me to fill out a form so I could get my refund, and everything I had written about my displeasure with my experience fell completely on deaf ears. I felt so insignificant, which was intensified by the fact that it was a therapy service that supposedly made counseling affordable, accessible, and empowering. It did none of those things for me. 

I had very high hopes for Talkspace and thought I was doing myself good by accepting that I needed help, but all I received in return was invalidation and a complete distrust of therapy.

I am thankful to my therapist for being responsive, and checking in at least once a day. He was also respectful and professional. I did get 1-2 nuggets of useful advice. However, I found the therapy lacking in many ways and ultimately unhelpful. I was hoping for insight into my situations, but most responses I got were very basic‚Äîeither easily googled or common sense. Still I was hopeful and wanted to give it a chance. I reiterated my goals with my therapist so he knew I wasn‚Äôt just here to vent, that I was looking for deeper understanding of what was going on. I continued to find the responses more of repetitions of what I said rather than anything I could learn from. I even tried nudging him in the right direction by suggesting possible explanations I learned from my own reading, hoping he would delve deeper. In response my therapist would agree with me and give a one sentence ‚Äúelaboration.‚Äù I felt he was just trying to keep me happy and ‚Äúfeeling heard,‚Äù but I couldn‚Äôt get much depth or new information from him. He honestly seemed to be trying his best but either through lack of skill/knowledge or the format‚Äôs limitations, this therapy did not deliver. After a few weeks I found that answering the messages felt like a chore. I responded to the therapist just to get it off my to do list. I wasn‚Äôt getting anything useful from it.

 

Btw, I was a little put off that I had to include an emergency contact‚Äôs full name and phone number. I had hoped for some anonymity due to the personal nature of things I would talk about. I tried to give just a first name, but he would not continue without a first AND last name, and phone number. 

Overall, from my experience I don‚Äôt think this format of therapy is going to help people looking for real therapy. The delay in response time (which to be fair, they warn you about) and that it‚Äôs written, makes it hard to connect or get deeper. Not sure who this would work for? It really makes me wonder about the validity of some of these reviews.... If you want to pay $300+ a month for someone to read your texts and agree with you then sure. But I regret opening up about highly personal things and spending the money I did. I feel I can get better information googling mental health advice than from this.

I wanted to like this app so much.. but no.. 

I‚Äôm a very straightforward person. I told my backstory, how that effects me, and how I‚Äôd like to improve, and what type of things I expected from therapy/needed.

The first therapist was an okay person, but bad therapist.. He literally compared every ‚Äúproblem‚Äù of mine to a bigger problem he had once in his life. He provided no coping mechanisms. And talked like a fortune cookie. No help whatsoever. He made life sound like a sad existence that you just have to get used to... No Thanks!!

Second therapist was a young woman who just sounded really cocky after we actually talked. Like she knew everything and how to fix everything. But didn‚Äôt actually try to ‚Äúfix‚Äù anything. And basically belittled me and told me what I thought was wrong and sent a passive aggressive message ‚Äúproving‚Äù me wrong. 

Third one seemed like she would have been actually helpful. Helped me learn a breathing technique right away. But we didn‚Äôt really talk as much as I hoped we could. And by this point, I wasn‚Äôt really willing to waste more time and money on this app. 

As I was trying to cancel my subscription they kept offering me cheaper and cheaper deals and plans. Not sure if it was because they actually want to provide help to less fortunate people, or because they want any and all money they can get...

Either way, it would be nice if they could screen their employees before letting them actually see patients. People deserve great mental health care and I‚Äôve seen a couple subpar therapists right off the bat. Real therapy can and should help you. And it shouldn‚Äôt be this hard to find a good therapist. I feel very sorry for all the people taking there first step towards getting better, just to end up with subpar health ‚Äúprofessionals‚Äù.

I decided to give Talkspace a try after hearing so many great reviews from YouTube influencers smh. Big mistake! I‚Äôve been trying to talk myself into starting therapy for at least a year. I finally decided to try Talkspace because it‚Äôs advertised on The Read and I wanted to use their code. I should‚Äôve trusted my gut when I signed up and it wouldn‚Äôt allow me to use my own promo code. 

I signed up 6/1/22 and was matched to a provider the same day. That allowed me to request a refund, but of course it‚Äôs a prorated refund because it‚Äôs been a week that I‚Äôve have the subscription. Even though I‚Äôve had NO SESSIONS and am not even matched. 

This was the worst outcome for simply seeking help. I would never recommend Talkspace to anyone. I just want a full refund, to speak with a real human. But of course there is no phone number to call, no real people to speak with. I‚Äôm so disappointed and this will make it that much harder for me to try to start therapy again.

ZERO live customer service or even responsive chat options to help straighten out difficulties. 

I had to forfeit half of my money because time had wasted while I waited for help‚Ä¶

I live remotely and was desperate to find couples therapy so thought I had found a great solution with Talkspace. 

Theoretically yes. When it came down to trying to find a licensed couples therapist, the field narrowed fast and the matches schedule never lined up with ours.

I purchased a plan with them and spoke with 2 therapist and I want to tell you that these people who sign up to work on these apps clearly don‚Äôt care at all. Something you‚Äôll become painfully aware of after you pay them your money. Just started using talk space and will not be using any longer. App matched me with a therapist with a 1 star review and several complaints. The cheapest price is 89.00/week. For a company supposed to be helping people, and people with mental health struggles are often poor, this company is doing nothing to lessen that burden. THIS COMPANY IS A SCAM. I requested for them to cancel my account on February 5th and asked if I could get a refund for the first months service (260 dollars) which I signed up for on February 1st. The one therapy provider who got in touch with me was a no show and sent me a total of two messages trying to schedule a time we could talk (she never showed up for the time we arranged). So they have altogether stolen 520 dollars for me. Not to mention, throughout my subscription I got ZERO THERAPEUTIC HELP. I was unable to talk to a SINGLE PERSON/THERAPIST.

Even if Talkspace were the best therapy app out there, I personally wouldn‚Äôt use it because I find this to be strikingly lacking in honesty and transparency. Bad branding, terrible ui for a prospect.
Zero customer service.

DOUBLE AND TRIPLE YOUR INSURANCE COVERAGE BEFORE GIVING THEM A DIME.  I paid $316 for my first month of therapy before my insurance became active. I absolutely loved the therapist that I was matched with. I put my insurance information in a few days before it became active, just to see if I would be covered, and was redirected to a screen that said, with my insurance, I could continue for $40 per week. Only for my card to be automatically charged $316 on 01/01/2021, the day my insurance became active. The day my insurance became active, I paid another $196 for the month, believing that my insurance was covering the rest. I messaged customer support asking for a refund of the $316 since my insurance was now active and had just paid an additional $196 for, what I believed to be the out of pocket cost with my insurance. Customer support replied that they are not, in fact, in network with my insurance, and that it was a ‚Äúone time discount‚Äù advertised after just checking for insurance benefits. I am more than disappointed that I cannot continue with my therapist on this app because she was amazing. But also cannot believe I ever gave a penny of my money to this money hungry, misleading app that conned me out of almost $900 for 2 months. I recommended this app to many friends, but will definitely be retracting my recommendations and advise everyone to stay away, unless you want to be conned out of your money.

You know it‚Äôs expensive when it hard to find pricing and easy to ‚Äúsign up‚Äù first. 

At this price you could get much better help from someone you can see in person. No offense to the professionals but you will also not be getting the same level of service. These are folks that are new or don‚Äôt have an established practice and client base. Again, nothing personal and everyone must start somewhere or grow their business somehow. I just don‚Äôt want to pay twice as much for lesser service, especially without an additional benefit. 

I was really hoping this would be an affordable option for the masses but at this price, I don‚Äôt know anyone that could afford it that wouldn‚Äôt just get help locally.

The therapists on here seem overwhelmed and share way too much personal information. I am not exaggerating when I say that they might be able to use therapy themselves (we all could use some at various times in our lives). Perhaps it‚Äôs due to COVID and the sheer numbers of people requiring therapy, but my first therapist started off decent (although she mainly shared YouTube links on mindfulness - I kid you not) then turned the tables and dumped all of her work and personal life struggles on me. This is not what a client wants to hear when seeking an avenue to work through his or her own stuff. Therefore, I switched therapists, had to share all of my issues a second time (not sure why he couldn‚Äôt simply read the chat record), and he never responded once in two weeks after stating that he would once a day. I canceled my subscription but they really should be reimbursing me for the three months. I would not recommend this service to anyone. Lesson learned. I‚Äôll stick to traditional methods or practice mindfulness myself which has been working for me using Insight Timer.

Will definitely take full responsibility and say maybe I was a bit sensitive. I made 2 accounts initially the first one the lady said something about consultation was $200 upfront(of course half off with the cyber Monday dealüôÑ) and when I told her I have trouble financially, she didn‚Äôt even say anything about insurance or another form support.  The second time was when I saw refer a friend link from a YouTube video and when I resigned up, I was greeted by another lady who pretended to want to know how I feel and then pushed plans in my face. 

I was kinda turned off only because after why I wanted help and the steps I took and how it was my first time and that I honestly didn‚Äôt know what I wanted or got myself into she just didn‚Äôt care and pushed a plan at me once again.

So I will say if you are trying to understand what‚Äôs going on with you, this is not the app for you. Go seek help from a hospital like I‚Äôll try to. 

Will keep on my journey to better mental health.

No screen asking about insurance when I signed up. Once I filled out the multiple forms and connected with a counselor via chat I tried to schedule a video session but the button is grayed out/disabled.  I took a screenshot to send to tech support (no ph# to speak with someone directly) and the attachment feature for the screenshot is also grayed out/disabled. Double checked settings on my iphone 11 and I‚Äôd already permissioned the app to access my photos which is where the screenshot is located but it doesn‚Äôt work. Later, from within my account settings, went to insurance coverage to add my info and after I provided it I‚Äôm taken to another screen that has me filling out the same forms as if I‚Äôm not yet a member and need to get matched with a counselor. I have a counselor, I have an account, i‚Äôve provided my credit card info and filled out many assessment forms. Do I go through all those forms again when I can‚Äôt live stream with my counselor? I‚Äôm a database manager and the fact that they can‚Äôt add my insurance details to my existing record blows my mind. I‚Äôve reached out to this site because of anxiety and frustration that has manifested into chronic headaches and this experience is only aggravating the situation. So glad I don‚Äôt have suicidal thoughts because this sh*t would send me over the edge.

Its crazy hearing how many people blasted a lot of money on this thing. If you try it out, just make sure you use the $200 off referral link version, I found mines off a YouTube video of someone reviewing this app. At the end of the day I only spent $60 trying it out with the basic plan, so I dont regret it, it was nice to vent to someone for once. The quality just wasnt there for me. I didn't expect to do it longer than a month anyways, but after looking up this app more, ive read that they train their "therapists" to take things slow to keep the money coming in. It certainly felt like that with the kinds of messaging I was getting. It also looks like theres a therapist shortage on their end right now, it took a while to get one to reply. This is a business first, unfortunately, and it grosses me out/ive quickly outgrown it. Try it out but dont waste too much money on your first month.

I reached out for therapy for the first time ever. My matching agent asked what was going on and if I would be interested in how it works. I said yes and then I got what seemed like a copy and paste message about what it will cost. I looked over the plans and I told her I understand it is lower cost than ‚Äútraditional‚Äù therapy but I simply cannot afford on my income. She sent back a message ‚ÄúI shared a discount code above‚Äù which I had already said that with the code I could not afford. I‚Äôm in need of therapy but feel like I can‚Äôt get it simply because I cannot afford it and do not have insurance. My matching agent shared another copy and paste message explaining why it cost what it does. She did not seem very compassionate. As much as I could use the help, I‚Äôm glad I did not spend my money on this after seeing the reviews of therapist not being as available as what is advertised.

This is the worst service out there!!! I signed up for$852 never have had 1 counseling session at all.  Have requested a refund several times no response at all from Talkspace.  On Friday I was trying to cancel my subscription only to find out I was charged another $300.46.   My next step is to file a complaint with better business bureau since there is no contact number or way to get a hold if anyone.  I will be sure to tell anyone I know even thinking about using Talkspace how horrible it is!!!   Especially since this is supposed to be about helping people????

This app is truly terrible. I‚Äôve been overcharged, support doesn‚Äôt respond. Booking appointments is difficult and unintuitive. This is truly the worst piece of garbage app I‚Äôve ever used. Do not use this. A 10 year old developer taking classes on YouTube in their garage would create a better app. The worst I‚Äôve ever used.
Incompetent clinicians & therapists
Overpriced and condescending
üëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèº

I was charged 4 times at an amount of $65.00 each time when I only had to video sessions. Furthermore, Talkspace is partnered with Cigna as my account details show. I already met my deductible and each session should be directly billed to Cigna. Customer service correspondence has been non existent although I have written six times. There is no phone number to call. I must have an itemized bill for my transactions and I haven‚Äôt received those either. Please contact me 215-501-2901

They have no free trail, despite what you may read online. 

I needed someone to talk to, IMMEDIATELY. I looked up free online therapy, i got a code for this app that said first week free. I downloaded it and began messaging with my assigned therapist Erica Marchetti. Erica was not kind to me in any sense, she was not understanding. Erica asked me why i downloaded the app,  and i wrote about 3 sentences explaining my situation. she asked me to pay $200 ish dollars and i said i am interested but would rather try my free therapy first . she said ‚Äúwe do not offer free therapy‚Äù . i sent her the code and she said it is $100 off rather than free. This left me feeling even worse than I was, and it was because of this apps intentional misleading marketing.

Purchased the 3 month deal for a 30 minute meeting once a week for 800$ - had a discount code and got it down to 580$. Therapists was great but I was soon told I got 1 30 min session once a both ... asked for a refund and was denied ... total waste of money is a very tough time / was laid off .... my best friend is a therapist and was considering doing this and I strongly recommended he does not and he‚Äôs telling his professional community

This is definitely a life-saving, life-changing service and I am glad it has come into my life, however the app developers really need to A improve the app in general but also B consider their clientele in the app building. By that I mean, I use this app service because I am someone who going to a brick and mortar building for a traditional therapy appointment is difficult, remembering the appointments is difficult for me, executive dysfunction is a huge issue for me and I‚Äôm sure for a lot of other people who use this app. So why is it that I can get a little red notification bubble for anything from angry birds to YouTube to tinder to amazon to literally any other app in the world, but the service that I am *paying for* doesn‚Äôt show me a notification that my therapist has texted me back? I‚Äôm not checking my app 15 times a day to see when my therapist has texted me back, and I do get banners that say that they messaged me but if I don‚Äôt respond as soon as I see that banner (which let‚Äôs be honest, most of us don‚Äôt always have time to respond to messages as soon as we get them) then it gets lost, and there is no reminder bubble like literally every other app out there. I‚Äôm mad because I‚Äôm paying for this service and I go 5 days thinking my therapist hasn‚Äôt texted me back, or missing video sessions because the notifications don‚Äôt work like a normal app, and if I and thousands of other people are paying for this service the least you can do is hire a developer who can get the notifications right so I am aware that I‚Äôm not just waiting on a message back from my therapist.

Okay facts: the cheapest plan is 240 per month. No insurance will be applied. 

I really needed to talk so I thought it might be worth it. This doesn‚Äôt give you live chats with help. The therapist will reply once per day 5 days per week. That‚Äôs it.

 I tried 2 therapists. I took their surveys and they confirmed my prior diagnosis and labeled it severe. 
Let me give you an example of exchange: 
Me: So what can I do to work on this? (After no talk for 3 1/2 days)
Hours later: therapist copied and pasted links to Wikipedia and YouTube...
I reply: yeah but we never said this was an issue for me... So can you please help me with this issue you said I actually have. It‚Äôs day 4 with you and I‚Äôve got nothing? 
Therapist: thanks for the feedback. I‚Äôll talk to you tomorrow.

That was the entire day. 

Honestly the ad says you can chat with someone then but the first therapist I matched with sent an auto message Friday evening that he would check his messages Monday morning and reply then or Monday at 5 each day. That‚Äôs it. 

Again there is no back and forth chat. I haven‚Äôt had one piece of help. It costs as much as any other therapy more with certain plans.

I don‚Äôt know if I just got one crazy outlier of a therapist but my therapist seemed completely unqualified and spit up all the trauma back into my face when I didn‚Äôt comply with her orders anymore such as take antipsychotics and take antidepressants and go to the hospital and do IOP and do this and that. She would ask inappropriate sexual questions, seemed to not understand why I was in therapy, do the bare minimum and repeat the same thing she did every single week and would constantly threaten to call ambulances and cops. It seems like this platform is good for crazy therapists like her who can jump from platform to platform and not have their name tarnished because they don‚Äôt answer to superiors they‚Äôre just freelance and can bounce any time they get a bad review. There‚Äôs a reason they‚Äôre not in therapy offices in town. This is $60 a week for the cheapest price and the therapist can just take a week or two off and not notify you and you still have to pay the $60 each week that you‚Äôre subscribed to this plan. They can also just fire you at any moment to and not give you any referrals and no notice. I feel like BetterHelp gets such high reviews because they pay people to write good things about them. I don‚Äôt know guys, I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app. You‚Äôre much better off finding a cheap therapist through your insurance, they‚Äôre probably much much much more qualified than they would be here.

First, the app and website are hard to navigate at first. For instance, my first therapist wasn‚Äôt showing available slots for me to book. There‚Äôs nothing on Better Help‚Äôs site/app to let me know I had to wait for him to open up slots. I also wish that in general, I knew what my therapists hours are before being matched because their hours are often not my hours. 

Second, I found scheduling to be very difficult. I‚Äôve tried two therapists and both were extremely difficult to schedule. I also wish there were reviews for some therapists. I know that sometimes it‚Äôs not a fit, but the second therapist I was seeing showed up 5-15 minutes late every time and cut off the sessions 5 minutes early so we never had time to talk about anything. After the third time, I realized her excuses were not legitimate, and she was just not interested in being helpful. This level of unprofessional behavior should be something others know about so they don‚Äôt go through the same frustration. 

Lastly, I dislike how I would receive so many notifications to remind me about my appointment but nothing for billing. Now I‚Äôm on the hook for another month of therapy despite having had two bad months of experience (or non experience given the lack of therapist availability).

I‚Äôve been through a lot of different therapists/counselors who have failed me and this one did not break the mold. First of all, it‚Äôs too expensive for the amount of time you get with your person. I forget what the exact price is but it‚Äôs around $50 a month just to see your person once a week for only 30 minutes! That‚Äôs ridiculous. I appreciate the concept and the software itself is fine but the person I was connected with had an incident on the second week. Keep in mind the first session was basically nothing since it takes more than 30 minutes just to introduce each other. In reality it‚Äôs around 20 minutes if you take into account that it takes a while to connect and the person decides to leave early. Anyway the person I had had canceled all her appointments and had basically wasted two weeks or roughly $20. The people who run the service tried to compensate me by adding two extra weeks but by that point I wasn‚Äôt feeling well about the app. None of the people that were open had schedules that made sense for me and the extra time they gave was just going to be used by introduction. Make it at least an hour which is typical for therapy or counseling. By the time you actually talk about the tough situations, you‚Äôve already spent more than $50

I was really excited about this app as I live in a rural area where most of the counselors and therapists are very faith-based and conservative (both of which i am not), but the price of therapy on this app is insanely expensive. $80/week (one month is billed at once for a total of nearly $400) is WAY more required disposable income than i was expecting. In addition, BetterHelp does not accept insurance‚Äîor if they do, they make it very difficult to find any info on it. They also do not offer any sort of substantial financial aid or assistance. I am a disabled, unemployed student and was offered a discounted rate of $60/week, which is still insane.

I switched to Cerebral immediately and for nearly the same price right off the bat ($85/month, with a discounted rate of $30 for your first month), I can get access to a prescribing doctor, counselor, AND therapist and have medications mailed to my door. In addition to this, they readily accept insurance.

I am giving two stars because BetterHelp does seem to have a wide range of professionals available‚Äîfrom relationship issues to mental health to chronic illness‚Äîbut the cost is way too much for me and discounts are laughable. I will be switching to their competitor for good.

I‚Äôve had betterhelp for about two weeks. In that time, it took me 6 days to get matched to a counselor, I was repeatedly prompted to tell more about myself so they could match me up. I contacted customer service and said ‚Äúwhat more can I give you to assist you‚Äù kinda thing, no response. I didn‚Äôt know what they needed to know and what would make it better, so I started going into my past and reasons for therapy etc. still no response. Then I get matched to a counselor. She seems nice. She messages me ONCE A DAY at like 9:30-11:00 PM only M-T. I reply about 8:30AM usually, only to hear back over 12 hours later. Every time I respond, it digs up all the emotions you typically unpack in therapy. However, since it‚Äôs so spread out with hardly ANYTHING being covered (she‚Äôs been my therapist for a week). I want to get another therapist just so I‚Äôll have someone to schedule a call with and actually reap the benefits I paid for with counseling but I‚Äôm afraid it‚Äôll take another week to match me up with someone! in theory i really dig the idea but in reality I just dredge up strong emotions daily with no conversation to direct them, Ive been in a bad mood all week bc I keep having to talk about stuff and I haven‚Äôt even heard back since I messaged her Thursday after she asked me to unpack some heavy stuff!

O my God guys I literally do not recommend this app to anyone. Trust my story. I subscribed and paid for therapy session. And set up my first session at 10 am in the morning. Everything started good. The therapist was a man, we start talking and he was completely not interested to me at all. He yawned like ten times and I asked him if he was ok. And can you imagine?! He fell asleep during the session!!!! I paid almost $70 for 30 min session and he fell asleep!!! Ok I thought it happens sometimes. Then I changed my therapist and the second one was a woman. And It was much more terrible experience than the first one. She literally told me to hold on during her session and start talking to someone on her phone. I was expecting it would take like 2-5 min. And was trying to understand but she kept talking more than 10 minutes!!! And imagine i paid almost $70 for 30 minutes session and half of this time she was talking with someone else on the phone. Like come on BetterHelp, your both therapist was very unprofessional and I am very disappointed. Cause I saw so many targeted ads in every social media and was hoping it will work. Even I explained you what happened BetterHelp never tried to compensate me at least half of the price I paid to them. Shame on you!!!

I signed up for better help in hopes that I can deal with my anxiety issues. I matched with a therapist in a few minutes once I signed up. The therapist had a very limited schedule but I managed to fit my schedule to meet. After the second session, I didn‚Äôt think my therapist was helpful. It felt more of a conversation (that I would have with friends/family) about my future plans and life versus actually staying on topic with my anxiety issues. The only advice she ever gave me was to ‚Äústay in the moment.‚Äù I made a third session in hopes we would discuss ways to deal with my issues. She rescheduled last minute with me on my third session. The third session was such a waste. I contacted BetterHelp for a refund on my last week and it was easy to get the refund. They gave me a complementary week. I decided to get a new therapist and see if maybe this therapist would be better. The new therapist was helpful and I felt heard. I made another session and continued with therapy‚Ä¶ only to wake up to a message from my new therapist saying she was leaving the platform. What a joke. My experience with BetterHelp added more stress in my life! The only good thing about this platform were the webinars.

I know this is a great app and I‚Äôm guessing this is an issue on my part but it is still very frustrating. I am struggling with money but my mental health comes first, so I paid 260 for the month and then decided to cancel it but I got distracted and it was too late. I thought nothing much of it; get advice and care for a month and pay again IF I can afford it. I scheduled for an appointment and then suddenly I got a new counselor. No big deal, but when I tried to make a new appointment it told me to pay again. Now I can‚Äôt buy it again because I will be negative in my account, and I made of the mistake of the purchase without saving money but I wasn‚Äôt too worried because I thought that this was my chance to get help and treatment. I don‚Äôt know if I want a full refund back because I have little hope it would be refundable or if I‚Äôm able to get the month subscription back. I‚Äôm rating this a 1 star so this can get someone‚Äôs attention, and hopefully I don‚Äôt have to make an upsetting call trying to get my money back which is something I need but if it‚Äôs against policy then I should have my subscription back. But either way, I canceled counseling which I think is equal to canceling my account, so hopefully I get my money back.

I signed up April 1st but didn‚Äôt get matched for a therapist until April 5th. It took longer than expected to get matched. I talked to a therapist on April 7th but honestly I didn‚Äôt feel a great connection with her. I told her how I felt and that I have depression and anxiety, she told me I needed to go to a psychiatrist to get medications to get more help. Talking to a therapist didn‚Äôt help me but to be nice I told her it did. It was nice talking to someone but again, I felt no connection. There‚Äôs no point in keeping the membership if I have to spend more money to get help elsewhere. Also, I contacted BetterHelp to ask about finding a psychiatrist because the therapist told me they can help me but they messaged me back saying they couldn‚Äôt. Again, BetterHelp wasn‚Äôt helpful for my depression and anxiety but that‚Äôs my opinion. I‚Äôm sure for others it helps. If you‚Äôre looking to get medication prescribed then this app/website isn‚Äôt for you but if you want to talk to a therapist then make sure you have a good connection with them. If you get matched with a therapist that you don‚Äôt feel comfortable with then you can always let BetterHelp know so they can help with finding another one for you.

‚ÄúUnlimited‚Äù therapy is not what one would assume it is. You can only schedule ONE session per week. The unlimited part just means you can text someone as many times as you‚Äôd like in between. The system will not allow you to have any more than one session scheduled at a time!! This is incredibly frustrating and entirely misleading. I can get a normal therapist who also lets me email them for much less money. By the way, it takes a few days to even be matched with a therapist, so you‚Äôre paying $55 to stare at a useless app until that happens. I liked the therapist that they paired me with, but I need more consistent therapy at the moment. I might have stuck with this but the platform is deceitful and that‚Äôs the last thing I need in my life right now. So, if you‚Äôre up for paying $55 for 1 phone or video session per week (if you pay for the weekly plan, other subscriptions may be less), or if you don‚Äôt have health insurance that covers therapy, then this is a great option for you. Otherwise you might be better off getting help from a normal therapist that accepts insurance if you can go that route.

BetterHelp, a website that purports to help people find mental stability, misled and gaslighted me with the navigation of their website design. I pressed a button to ‚Äúbrowse therapists‚Äù and it charged me an exorbitant amount that is not even available in my bank account. I have the mental clarity to know when $260 can and can‚Äôt be charged on my bank account but perhaps that is where BetterHelp is placing their bets. Exploiting people in their time of need. Nowhere on or near that button did it say that I was agreeing to pay by pressing that button. Nowhere on the site had I entered my new card information. The platform had creepily held onto my PayPal login information for two years, without my knowledge, which is where my new card info was entered.  Two years ago is too far for me to even remember I signed up in a dire moment. I don‚Äôt even remember the therapist I supposedly paid $100 to talk to. Their billing department has not gotten back to me. PayPal has denied revoking the transaction. There is no way to call billing department only email. I ended up finding a number to text on BetterHelp site and talked to an unaffiliated crisis prevention counselor about it. I can‚Äôt believe this is how they operate made even more unbelievable by the covid crisis.

Probably ok for someone looking for a listening ear but NOT for someone living with mental illness. I‚Äôve worked for a decade with a psychiatrist and for quite a while with a psychologist on a clinically diagnosed mood disorder only to have some jabroni I met with four times tell me he didn‚Äôt think I had a diagnosis and ‚Äúmoods change.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt work through all the pain of an illness to reach a place of stability and self-acceptance for someone who barely knows me or my history to tell me I don‚Äôt actually have an illness at all. 

And I mean BARELY got to know me. I signed up to discuss relationship issues and over the course of four weeks I learned all about this guy‚Äôs divorce, how his ex-wife cheated and is with someone new, his honeymoon to the city I live in, the book he‚Äôs writing about mating patterns and how people usually break up in springtime(??), and how he can ‚Äúsee‚Äù where his patients were headed and was there to ‚Äúguide‚Äù them. Was looking for a psychotherapist, not a psychic! 

I learned from some therapist friends that BetterHelp pays their therapists $30/hr, so you‚Äôre getting what they pay for your therapy.  Advekit is a better option if you have insurance.

Besides BetterHelp stating they wouldn‚Äôt charge me until I was paired with a counselor, they charged my card the same day as signup, and then took an additional SIX days to find a counselor for me. As well, I turned to betterhelp to manage my anxiety and trauma so it wouldn‚Äôt relapse again. During the video call the counselor stated ‚Äúwell you seem to have your life under control so why would you turn to therapy‚Äù (before I had even mentioned the situation that made me join). As well, she felt very inattentive playing with something off screen and barely looked at the camera. Then, despite her mentioning she would be around to talk 24/7 (which I know can be an exaggeration), I sent two very long messages that I felt were desperate and it took her TWO days to respond and she messaged me at 12:40am. I understand the therapists are busy. They have a lot of clients but where betterhelp really turned be off was her reply was ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know your situation so I can‚Äôt give you advice. You don‚Äôt have to do anything if you don‚Äôt want to‚Äù in response to childhood trauma. I wish it worked out better for me because I could see myself using it but they don‚Äôt seem to care about their customers too much.

While BetterHelp has been extremely helpful in terms of providing a more affordable option for online therapy, the way they handle payments for subscriptions is stupid and manipulative. There is no warning whatsoever that the subscription will expire soon so that you can be prepared to pay to renew it, and once your subscription expires it will automatically cancel your appointment (even though the system allowed it to be scheduled) and lock you out of communicating with your therapist until payment is processed. 

Especially when you are providing service to a community who struggles to afford traditional therapy, this feels extremely manipulative and shady. It isn‚Äôt that hard to include the subscription ‚Äúvalid through‚Äù date on the website/app dashboard, send a reminder 2 weeks before the subscription expires, or lock the scheduling in the system when a subscription expires so that a client and therapist can see that they can‚Äôt schedule the following week until a payment goes through. If other companies can do this, BetterHelp should be able to as well.

Ive had this app for a month now, supposed to get unlimited messages and weekly live sessions. 1st therapist scheduled me almost 3 weeks out from my original message, i was fine with it, maybe she has a lot of other clients, whatever‚Ä¶ then she straight up ghosted me on our first session with no reason or excuse. Her name was Rebecca Edwards. My second therapist seemed very spiritual and i had high hopes she would be better, until she scheduled me a week and a half out and again canceled our appointment day of just 2 hours before. While i appreciate ms Angelica Bennet cancelling beforehand, not after, why did she do it day of?? again with very short explanation ‚Äúsorry i have to cancel today im sick‚Äù was her only response. So it has been one month now and i have received a total of ZERO help. I was not going to renew and pay another $320 to get canceled on again next month. $640 for what?? one session?? I thought this app would help, i really did. but it has only cause me more stress and heightened my abandonment anxiety. wish i could get a refund. highly do not recommend this app.

For a mental health app they sure do trick you. They charge you 200 something for your first month without telling you or making it clearly known that there are cheaper options available. The 200 covers webinars and counseling and a free journal platform plus 24/7 access to your therapist. But be careful‚Ä¶ your therapist will probably offer to text, call, or video chat for your live sessions. If you choose to do something like text or call there‚Äôs actually a cheaper rate for those services. I was using the calling method for weeks and being charged that 200 for it when I could‚Äôve been paying 160. Be wary of your therapist as well. I went my first two weeks without talking to someone because my therapist had a mishap with her schedule, then finally, when I was able to see her and I logged into my appointment 15 minutes early just to see she cancelled my appointment for not having a profile picture. Which I could‚Äôve done in three minutes. My second therapist didn‚Äôt remember who I was and ate while she was in session with me. She was very nice but it was just disappointing.

I tried using this app because it was a little bit more affordable than seeing a therapist face to face. I was matched with a counselor but she only responded to me once every day or two, & didn't really help me with any of my problems. She just sent me worksheets, & sent me short messages that were difficult to respond back to because of how short & bland they were. Because of my work schedule, I‚Äôm not able to use the features of the app like live chats & things like that, I feel like it may have been more helpful had I been able to use those but I still don‚Äôt recommend this app as a substitute for face to face therapy. I was spending $45 a week to get one response a day that did not help me or make me feel any better. Even when writing large messages to her, she responded very seldom, very short answers, & most of what she said was to fill out work sheets or to use other features of the app like the journal or the groupinars. When I cancelled today (March 5th), I was not able to get my $180 back that I was charged for the month of March. I was told I can use the app until April 5th but I can‚Äôt get a refund.

Since the beginning the site/ app was pushy for feedback and positive reviews without really having offered much. Paying that much per week or month for an online journal, a counselor that yes you can write at anytime but they will only respond every other day or so with less than in depth feedback wasn‚Äôt really what I was looking for. You also can only book 1 therapy appointment at a time. You‚Äôre unable to view your therapists schedule to book in advance besides one appointment. So if you‚Äôre busy you‚Äôre scrambling to fit in an appointment each week after your session and it‚Äôll be a different time each time so planning ahead isn‚Äôt an option. The company is HUGE on promoting. Pushing for feedback with automated systems after every minor step was annoying. It‚Äôs expensive to most of us who don‚Äôt have a lot of extra money to spend on a subscription that doesn‚Äôt offer efficient help. That‚Äôs in a nutshell how I would describe it. Expensive for inefficient service.

I signed up thinking I‚Äôd give the virtual therapy thing a try. Every single therapist I was matched with only had openings in the morning or dead smack in the middle of the day. The profiles say they can accommodate schedules outside of theirs availability, but that is a lie. When I brought up the fact that I would like to attend live sessions but the availability doesn‚Äôt work for my schedule, she recommended I try the weekend. I went to her schedule and there was no availability for the upcoming 3 weeks. Her response was, yeah.. i‚Äôm booked up pretty far in advance. Which is fine but why charge me for a service i don‚Äôt even have access to????? Now I‚Äôm out of $256, with no type of refund in sight. I‚Äôve never been able to even attend a live session. I feel like if I‚Äôm going to take off work for therapy I‚Äôm going to go to an in person session. Im not taking off work to talk on the phone. Honestly, the whole ordeal felt like a scam. They only wanted to text with me and they responded 3-4 hours after the fact. Don‚Äôt waste your money. Just find an in-person therapist.

I would talk to my therapist for about 20 mins and I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs long enough to cover much.  I felt I didn‚Äôt really get anything from it. Maybe I need a different therapist but I‚Äôm not going to spend another 400 to find out.  I get more out of self help books. Anyway, I felt my therapist always just wanted to get off the phone or text.  What really turned me off was me discussing my own issues and she ended it with ‚Äúwell, I think what‚Äôs more scary are the people who are supposed to serve and protect‚Äù.  Ummmm, we are not talking about what‚Äôs going on in the states.  We are discussing me, I don‚Äôt know why or how police officers got thrown in there.  She didn‚Äôt seem like she had any advice or ideas for me. Too bad they don‚Äôt give out refunds cuz I wasted money on this.

*i did email customer service, who was great and they gave me a partial refund for sessions I didn‚Äôt use.  She also offered me an extra two weeks with a different therapist but after some thought, I decided not to go with that option. So A+ on customer service. I really appreciate it.

It really saddens me to leave this review, as I used to sincerely love BetterHelp. I love my counselor, and I love the accessibility of this platform. But my counselor told me during my last session that they are cutting the reserved one hour slot down to 50 minutes, and eventually down to 45 minutes. That means I have 25% less time to talk with my counselor.
That in itself isn‚Äôt the issue, but the fact that I had to hear that from my counselor, NOT BetterHelp, is another part of the problem. Also, I‚Äôve found out that BetterHelp will not be lowering their monthly price, despite them lowering my therapy time.
This is a platform built for people like myself with mental health issues, and they made a MAJOR change without transparency. This wreaks of corporate greed, and I could not be more disappointed.
I‚Äôd highly recommend online therapy for anyone whose thinking about it. Do it!!!!! It‚Äôs 100% worth it!
... Just as long as it‚Äôs not with BetterHelp.. sorry.

Signed up for the app, thought I was paying $80/week, but apparently that‚Äôs not the case. After 4 days I canceled my subscription because I decided it wasn‚Äôt right for me. I was okay with eating the $80 cost but then I found out I would be charged $320 for a full month of a service I‚Äôm not going to use??! Now I‚Äôm out $240 that I could put towards food, gas, mortgage, other psychiatric care that I can actually use- thanks BetterHelp!

This is extorting people who are in bad enough shape mentally to decide that virtual ‚Äútherapy‚Äù is their only option. I signed up because I was in emotional distress 24/7 and absolutely desperate for help. I live in a metropolitan area with many options for therapy and no one- I mean literally no one- is accepting new patients. This was supposed to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù while I wait for an opening, but it‚Äôs awful. I‚Äôve switched therapists so many times because everyone has just been so cold and most have very little availability- some of them have just one session available a MONTH. $320 for one session? NO.

There is no way to contact anyone on the phone for the app. You have to email and wait 24 hours for a response. I‚Äôve been paying for the app for 3 weeks and I still haven‚Äôt been about to get counseling. The app asks you if you would like a male/female counselor but they matched me with 2 men before I found a women- then the female counselor said she thought I needed in person help and suggested somewhere in town (she also said she would no longer be working for betterhelp). I‚Äôm now on my 4th counselor and I still can‚Äôt schedule a video chat until my counselor has responded to a message. Everything takes so long because everyone involved is taking the full 24 hours to respond. There is no communication between the app and the counselors. If you really need help and can‚Äôt wait and also have had trouble with feelings of abandonment.... don‚Äôt use this app. If anyone on this app team is reading the reviews- please please please add a phone number for people who need assistance.

I decided to try betterhelp because it seemed reasonably priced, and easier for my schedule. i was matched with a counselor that seemed fine at first. i told her all of my past trauma which i have not done with many people, so it was difficult and exhausting for me to do so. she had me write a letter to my father, and i read it to her during our 2nd session together. then on our third session, she asks me: ‚Äúdid you ever write a letter to your father?‚Äù clearly not paying attention/taking notes. i felt like she was not listening to me at all, and there was multiple things she said to me that seemed very unempathetic. i ended my counseling with her after she very abruptly ended our session with no advice for me. i feel worse now than i did before, and am not interested in trying a different therapist. it was already very difficult and exhausting for me to open up to one person (who didn‚Äôt listen), and i don‚Äôt think it‚Äôd be worth it to try again with any of their therapists.

After the absolute waste and time of money of using this app, I almost gave up on counseling altogether and haven‚Äôt been to a therapist in months. One example was a therapist telling me to read his profile after I‚Äôd already sent him a hello message mentioning that I read his profile and was excited to speak with him. The same therapist overlooked an entire paragraph I sent to him about my depressed thoughts/feelings, no acknowledgement of the message AT ALL and instead told me to read his profile (again) and complete the intake form. Which I‚Äôd already done. I wasn‚Äôt blowing the guy up with messages either. One or two initial messages and he couldn‚Äôt bother to read. Fed up with therapists who don‚Äôt actually want to help!! If they‚Äôre overwhelmed with clients, they should say that instead of half assing it and making clients feel insignificant/ignored. I wish this had worked out but the whole idea of the app was a lie for me and proved to be 2x more expensive than just paying a regular in person therapist.

When I signed up for the app, I completed the profile questions. It didn‚Äôt save my answers correctly because apparently I had made an account before. Instead of saving my correct answers, it imported my old answers, which are not relevant. Unfortunately, I had already been charged $, so I didn‚Äôt want to have to go through the effort of changing it.

I was matched with a counselor who didn‚Äôt work for my needs. The app advertises live chat sessions and the counselors profile said that was offered. She told me via messages that she would do phone or video, which I am not comfortable with or capable of doing right now. The app advertises you can change counselors, but there is NOWHERE where this is an option. I checked both in the app and on the website. 

Naturally, after these issues, I contacted support for help in changing counselors. I have yet to hear back and am actively being charged for this service. This is a waste of money. Avoid BetterHelp at all costs. It seems like a scam.

I‚Äôve specified in 3 different questionnaires I want to speak to a BLACK WOMAN. Of course it paired me to some random white 20-30 something year old lady. So I choose a different questionnaire and specified AGAIN and wrote in my review AGAIN I was only interested in speaking to a black woman. My search consisted of mostly MALES and white women, the exact opposite. Of the results only 2 were African American women and both of their schedules were very limited. This would not be an issue if I had the option to browse and filter based on my specified preference to find one that did. I even found a therapist online that worked with BetterHelp I was interested in working with, but when I clink the link to her profile on the app it redirects me back to the same search results. I‚Äôm extremely frustrated and offended and feel like this automated process is a waste of my time and was almost a waste of my money. Thank god I didn‚Äôt subscribe. Moving over to talk space instead.

The theory is great, access to messaging a therapist whenever you want. I was struggling to find a local therapist I liked and thought this would be a good way to get me through a tough period of loss while continuing my local search. I didn‚Äôt have high expectations but figured it would be better than nothing, and being able to message someone when the feels were too much instead of waiting until a pre scheduled appointment sounded great. However the good marketing was not worth the money at all and it ended up feeling like I just threw several hundred dollars away. Matching took the full few days both times, both therapists I was matched with made me feel like I was talking at someone instead of having a productive conversation that was helping me work through things, and one therapist left the program while still assigned to me. I can not NOT recommend this enough. Go through the effort to find a local therapist that works for you.

For me, this is what my experience looked like:

- friend suggested trying this app and said she‚Äôs loved it
- I signed up on a Thursday and was hoping to have someone to talk me through some things by Saturday. 
- The therapist I got matched with said she is taking weekends off for her mental health (understandable but frustrating) so I hoped to get a reply by Monday. Still nothing. 
- I tried switching therapists, but the app is not user friendly and I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to switch ANYWHERE on the app. 
- I decided to cancel and ask for a refund after reaching out to customer service through their email and not hearing back. 
- I found their number online by some miracle and when I called, they said they were an answering service and could take a message... I asked if they had a customer service department and she gave me another number. 
- Called that number and asked for a refund. She asked a bunch of questions like the last four of my cards and the expiration but said someone ELSE would be emailing me about canceling. 

At this point I think this app has just grown too quickly without doing the work on the backend to make it a good user experience. They need better customer service training and a more intuitive app layout. 

Assuming most people signing up have mental health issues, it‚Äôs not the greatest combination to have a frustrating experience with a therapy app.

I‚Äôve tried Betterhelp for a month but did not feel as if my counselor was particularly helpful, and was also billed a week early for the next months renewal (it took over a week to match with my first counselor and my subscription started before I was matched rather than after the match, as their policy states). I brought up the billing issue when trying to cancel my subscription, and I was persuaded to try another month with a different counselor and promised 2 free weeks to accommodate for the previous billing issue as well as the counselor change. I was given an August 14 renewal date explicitly and I agreed to try for another month, but was billed two days before my old renewal date, on July 23 without the free weeks! The result is that I‚Äôve had 7 weekly sessions while being billed for 3 months already! Definitely frustrated with their questionable methods to prevent people from cancelling subscriptions and not following through on correcting billing issues.

In my experience, it felt like Uber for people who got a psychology degree. An opportunity for them to make some extra cash, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it if you‚Äôre trying to find someone experienced that can actually help you with anything deeper than daily life stress. I spent $790 while trying three different counselors during a pandemic when I lost my jobs. 

I don‚Äôt like that they only give you a few choices of counselors the first time and when you try to change it they give you another few to pick from. You end up wasting money while trying to find someone that works which is so discouraging when you‚Äôre trying to get help and you don‚Äôt have the mental capacity to keep digging and digging and it‚Äôs already so hard to reach out. 

The concept is cool and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs helped others. I just didn‚Äôt get lucky and couldn‚Äôt afford to keep trying.

This app is way too expensive for unreliable counselors. First I was match with a counselor who had zero availability for a live video sessions and he hardly responded to any of my messages. That I was match with another counselor which I only had a 20 minute live session with which strictly consisted of her talking about herself and the relationship she had with her children,Then she messaged me and told me that she couldn‚Äôt meet with me anymore and then never responded afterwards. Then finally I was matched with a great counselor whom I worked through a lot with but then with no notice changed her availability, which we had discussed at the beginning of our sessions to times it absolutely would not work with my work schedule. I already have issues with abandonment and frankly these counselors it made it worse. If you‚Äôre looking for good consistent long term counseling I would not recommend this app.

I‚Äôm going this app 2 stars. Not because of the app but because of the company model. The therapists are mostly part time and don‚Äôt have enough time and/or training to adequently take care of their patients. Leading to patients feeling alone, vulnerable, and in worse conditions. My therapist forgot who I was and forgot we had met. The second therapist I had never picked up the calls and in a month barely would respond to my messages. My sister‚Äôs therapist took her session at her son‚Äôs little league game and was eating during it. I had another friend who‚Äôs therapist feel asleep on the call. I don‚Äôt blame the therapists fully but I blame the model they are put in to over book themselves and ultimately not having a good client roster cause they need the extra cash. This isn‚Äôt helpful and can have negative effects on the consumers who are struggling.

I feel the the ‚Äòtherapists‚Äô on this platform are either recent grads or low rated counselors who couldn‚Äôt attract real life clients. I was constantly cancelled on, often hours before my appointment, and when I tried to schedule (or usually reschedule) I found most therapists only offered morning or late afternoon appointments, which don‚Äôt work for people who have 9-5 jobs. If there was more availability around lunch hours/weekends/evenings I would have been willing to try again, but there was just no flexibility, which I thought was the purpose of the platform.

I was also disappointed I was paired with therapists who ONLY offered chat. Better Help says they offer live calls and video sessions, but never clarifies that not all their counselors offer all methods of communication. Chat therapy just doesn‚Äôt work for me, and I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair to charge everyone the same amount of money if they don‚Äôt have access too all the communication methods.

I‚Äôm really disappointed because I really thought I had found something wonderful and amazing! After about a week of getting to know my counselor, and reading what the other recommended counselor said, I am convinced this place pays for their positive feedback & reviews. There‚Äôs just no way. I was shocked by the treatment of both counselors, Jennifer Wickman and Alice Hamil said to me and how they dealt with my very sensitive & fragile state of mind. Also, I believe they don‚Äôt follow the privacy act, and the client/therapist rule of discretion, because the new therapist knew about things that I had only revealed to the first one, so I believe they communicate amongst each other without respecting the doctor/patient confidentiality agreement. Not cool! So I‚Äôm out. Just be careful with what you say. In your journals too! They make you write in your journal every day, but I started feeling like others were reading my private journal entries so I felt really uneasy about that as well.

The app doesn‚Äôt deliver on its promises.
One counselor had a very busy schedule, I couldn‚Äôt find more than one slot with him for a given week. As a working professional it‚Äôs sometimes not enough to have one slot to choose from.
I tried asking to have my recurring time (so that I have a session let‚Äôs say every Tuesday, same time, convenient for him). Nope, the recurring sessions aren‚Äôt an option. Each week it was unpredictable when I‚Äôll get a chance to speak to my counselor. (Exactly what you need when you try to bring more structure and order into your life.)
This one never really engaged into messaging between the sessions and never checked in on me.

Another counselor had more slots, wonderful. Though she bever really checked in on me. And after she overshared ABOUT HER problems, I thought it‚Äôs not going to work and I switched.

The next counselor did have availability, checked in on me periodically (which was great), but never replied to my messages!!! (So what‚Äôs the point of checking in then?)

Seriously, why can‚Äôt I have a __professional__ professional counselor (all-in-one pack)? Knows the theory, practiced before, does weekly follow ups, responds (one time per week would be enough, but just a meaningful not a template!!! answer)

WOW!!! All I can say is thank you to every single one of you who wrote an honest review and I want you to know that I‚Äôm truly sorry for what you had to experience but I also want you to know that sharing your experience has done for me personally and I‚Äôm sure 100‚Äôs if not 1000‚Äôs of others.  You have saved me from going through the horrific nightmare that you all have had to endure and I‚Äôm forever grateful to you.  It enrages me that you‚Äôve all been put through this when all you were looking for was help.  Karma is a real thing and although it doesn‚Äôt fix what happened to you please know that what comes around goes around and this company and the others just like them will fail miserably and I‚Äôm hoping that those that have a solid case take this misleading conduct to the next level and hit them where it hurts.   I can‚Äôt imagine there not being many lawsuits in the making here.

I joined BetterHelp because I was feeling depressed and initially it was great. But over time what happened was that scheduling an appointment would take up to a month. Then when I‚Äôd meet with my counselor, if I didn‚Äôt feel bad she‚Äôd prod until I came up with something to be upset with. Essentially the pressure to schedule sessions (because the app is so expensive) caused me to focus on my problems so that I had something to discuss. Which over time, made me more depressed! So be careful!

If you have money to burn I‚Äôd say this is a worthwhile app. But if $260 a month seems like a lot of money to you just go to regular counseling. In the long run actual counseling is much cheaper and getting appointments is the same hassle. Plus with live therapy you pay per session instead of through a subscription. And due to covid most therapists do video sessions so there doesn‚Äôt seem to be any benefit to using BetterHelp over regular therapy.

I have thoroughly enjoyed being able to talk with my counselor on my own schedule. But the app is difficult when it comes to scheduling. There have been multiple issues for updating when appointments are on my counselors end which had resulted in a waste of my time waiting for them to log on but them not be available. It also does not allow you to schedule more than one appointment at a time or even see availability last your currently scheduled one. And if a session is supposed to be happening, you can't do anything except use the chat feature. It's frustrating and has caused a loss of my time and value. I've had 4 incidents in the last two months that have had these issues. I wish there was also a feature to sync the schedule to google calendar or outlook or something.

I‚Äôve never had counseling before and I thought especially during the pandemic this would be a good way to dip my toes in. For the first couple of weeks it helped tremendously, mainly just having a neutral party to vent to and the groupinars were extremely helpful. After a couple weeks my counselor would randomly cancel my appointment without notice and reschedule it for another day. This happened several times until finally I decided to switch and see if another counselor would be a better fit. My next two counselors both did the same thing, and the bummer is that you‚Äôre charged for your session ahead of time, and if you‚Äôre cancelled on there is no reimbursement. Tbh it felt like after the first month they decided that they were already getting my money so why try ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I would say if you want to try it choose the pay by the week plan juuuust in case.

After having only 1 session and scheduled for another one the following week, the app stopped working, right when I was to start my second session. Other than through the App, there is no way to contact your therapist to tell them you are late. I missed my scheduled session because the app stopped working at a critical time. There is no phone number to call to get technical help. The only  number provided to help you is the suicide prevention hotline. You have to email them and they will contact you within 24 hours. I contacted better help to help get help in my technical issue and the solution was to do things I already did like uninstall and reinstall the app and update my phone. Done and problem still persists. I can‚Äôt log in. Unfortunately this was the help my company provided and I can‚Äôt get the help needed. My complaint will go to my company now.

Had a terrible experience. Used the service for 2 months. Each one of my weekly sessions (8 of them) had at least one instance of a connectivity issue, whether it be poor audio or the call just ending altogether. The first one was so bad that the therapist suggested we just continue the session via text message. My final session, the call dropped out three times and for most of the session the therapist‚Äôs voice was inaudible. I‚Äôve never had an issue using zoom for voice and video chats, and I was only using the voice call feature on this app so I‚Äôm not sure why the audio was so terrible.
