Also, repeated messages to customer support were unanswered. This led me to canceling my membership. Save your money and find a service that actually cares.  My money is very tight and I tried to make an investment in myself but I was essentially just fleeced for over $500.

Huge rip off! I spent 240 something a month for nothing! When I made the profile it asked how I would like to do my sessions and I said video call, so when my ‚Äútherapist ‚Äú asked how I‚Äôd like to do my sessions every week I felt uncomfortable telling her video call because I felt like she was pushing me to do texting. After like week 3 I legitimately couldn‚Äôt make a session so she asked if she could text that night which was fine but she took that as permission to text every session. She never asked again what type of session I preferred but after the sessions we did have I didn‚Äôt feel like I was ever being listened too in the first place . ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll what type of problems are u having?‚Äù ‚ÄúWell my uncle just died for starters and I ..‚Äù ‚Äú oh that‚Äôs great have you thought about cleaning your room?‚Äù Don‚Äôt spend money on this app go to a real therapist or a boxing gym you will never find help here.

I‚Äôve been using this app for almost 9 months now, I used to rave about it to anyone who would listen! Then, I decided I needed a bit more of a challenge from a counselor and wanted to try a new person. This new person was a horrible counselor and told me I have too much trauma to work on anything but trauma. I‚Äôd been doing trauma work the past 8 months, and wanted a change. She made me feel like I don‚Äôt know what I want. She told me she didn‚Äôt want to work with me. It was upsetting. I complained about the experience and emailed them saying I want to cancel. As of right now they won‚Äôt cancel my account unless I redownload the app? They‚Äôre acting like I can‚Äôt cancel my account through them? I‚Äôm so disappointed to be getting the run around when this is supposed to be an app supporting your mental health. I feel totally judged and taken advantage of. What a bad experience!

Horrible beyond measure. I had to go through a parade of absolutely laughable ‚Äútherapists‚Äù before I finally got the message and cancelled my subscription. I spent at least half hour writing a heart felt message to one, and received a reply that probably took 30 seconds to write. Another one copied and pasted a reply into our chat after I told her of one of the problems I was dealing with. Like she had a ‚Äúfile‚Äù of preloaded responses for each condition. So disrespectful. Another one told me to join a support group for my addiction and then ‚Äúget back to her after having a zoom call or two with them‚Äù...and she was supposedly an addiction specialist! What a disrespectful joke of a counselor. This app was an interesting experiment, but will NEVER be able to replace in-person therapy. There‚Äôs nothing like physically sitting across from the therapist as you discuss your issues...sorry BetterHelp, you failed.

After using their service for a month, I decided not to renew. Apparently I didn‚Äôt follow all the steps to cancel and I was charged $156. After emailing them to get a refund the day of because you can‚Äôt get in touch with anyone over the phone. I was emailed back saying that I qualified for a financial scholarship which I did not ask for. I specifically told them I DO NOT HAVE THE MONEY I was charged for in my account and that I want a refund because now I am stressed about it and that I want a full refund.  So instead of just giving me a refund of the money that I don‚Äôt have. She gives me a partial refund of $46 because she decided that my problem was that I couldn‚Äôt afford  to pay the whole bill. Does this sound like people who want to help you or just take your money? Thanks a lot BetterHelp for screwing up my bank account

Nothing? After 2 counselors and 2 months of sessions, I think I would have preferred nothing. It may be the luck of the draw, but the two counselors I worked with weren‚Äôt helpful. The first took more of a life-coaching tack and began insistently telling me what I should do half way through the first session. With the second counselor, I felt like I was constantly re-explaining my situation, and these sessions unsurprisingly did not lead to much progress with my concerns. 

I‚Äôve been fortunate to talk with effective counselors in the past, and the BetterHelp interactions were nowhere close to being as helpful as those previous experiences. I recently switched to a more traditional therapist, and the difference is night and day; so far, this new therapist has been much more supportive and empathetic, fostering deeper engagement that led to greater progress in a single session than all of the BetterHelp sessions combined.

My wife has been having having therapy sessions with Sharon Simmons now for a little over a month. I recently found out my wife was committing infidelity with a co worker. Shorty after she wanted to move out and figure things out and probably get a divorce. I told my wife that‚Äôs fine if you want to take some space to figure things out. But please, break things off with this other man while you make this big decision. She says ‚Äúok I‚Äôll ask my therapist‚Äù then messaged Sharon Simmons ‚Äúis it a fair request to break things off with this man I‚Äôm committing infidelity with while moving out from my husbands house and deciding if I still want to get a divorce?‚Äù Sharon responds with ‚Äú I think it's okay to still talk to the guy but keep your focus on healing. Sounds like you're moving forward and that's good.‚Äù As far as I'm aware the Sharon Simmons did not recommend couples counseling.

The interface is so bad.  I hate that you have to be in the session in order for the therapist to call you.  I also feel like the therapists need better tech training with how to use the interface because I‚Äôve experienced a lot of therapists being 10-15 minutes late due to ‚Äútech difficulties‚Äù but it shouldn‚Äôt be that hard.  Also 10-15 minutes is literally 1/3 of my session that I am paying for!  Often times my therapist would be driving or doing other work during our sessions which I feel like is unfair and divides their attention.  I tried 3 therapists and none of them actually replied or even read my text or audio messages.  If the therapist is allowed to completely ignore texts and audio messages, stop advertising your services as 24/7 audio message & text!

My counselor was pretty checked out and it often felt like she was trying to pawn me off to someone else. I would mention one tiny workplace problem and her response was ‚ÄúI could refer you to someone who specializes in workplace anxiety‚Äù without even trying to really help me.

Other reviewers have said counselors are swamped and don‚Äôt really have time to focus on you and that‚Äôs 100% true. My counselor often cut our sessions (which were supposed to be an hour) down to 30-40 minutes, and gave me contradictory advice week to week. She never seemed to remember what we talked about the week before.

The ads say you can switch counselors at any time but after trying for awhile to do that and not being able to figure it out, I just cancelled my service. By the end of it I felt worse than when I signed up.

I though it would be a good idea to get this app to ease myself into therapy without the pressure of being face to face with someone. My therapist didn‚Äôt respond to me at all unless I was messaging her within her scheduled time to meet with me. I didn‚Äôt enjoy the few sessions that I had with her because she was taking up all this time asking me questions about my life and family when I came to her with one issue that I wanted to resolve. I felt like after a few hour long sessions we still hadn‚Äôt even talked about what I needed help with. I also felt that she was biased in her conversations with me when I was discussing family issues with her. She wasn‚Äôt listening to my side of the story and then judged what I was doing with my life and what my future plans were. I am sure there are great therapists on this app but I just got a bad one.

Had one bad therapist after another on this app. The first one was very condescend and made me feel worse about myself. The second one said she couldn‚Äôt send any messages because she had injured fingers, which to me was a no because I need someone that can be responsive to my messages. And the third and final straw was when my therapist responded to my messages once a week and had no live session availability for 3 weeks out (she only did Monday's and Tuesday's of live sessions). When I asked her if she could fit me in sooner because I really needed someone to talk to she told me that the times I saw were what she had and she couldn‚Äôt talk to me sooner. Completely ridiculous that I‚Äôd pay for a month subscription and get one session 3 weeks out.....I feel like I was totally scammed by BetterHelp and would never recommend this service to anyone.

Both my SO and I have been using this for a couple months to work on individual areas and regainus (the couples version). We‚Äôve both been bounced around multiple times. It seems like they, like everyone, are having a hard time keeping staff. The counselors are in way over their heads. Most are 20 something‚Äôs with very little real life experience. One was bragging about 5 years ‚Äúin the field.‚Äù  Scheduling is simple if you can get your counselors to commit. I‚Äôve had sessions rescheduled multiple times. 

On a plus side‚Ä¶ the three counselors I‚Äôve personally spoken to seem nice enough.  The technology also works well. Obviously a benefit that sessions can be anywhere any time. 

Don‚Äôt get me wrong‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a value price so you get what you pay for. It also seems like the counselors are trained to keep clients coming back‚Ä¶

I could not be more disappointed with the services I‚Äôve gotten from this app. My first therapist showed up late hung up the phone while I was talking to her and when I messaged her after she hung up while it was still our time for our appointment it took her hours to respond. Then when I went to look for another therapist who had live sessions I was only able to find one on the list. The one I found when I schedule a session to one of the timeslots that she has open instead of messaging me asking me another time I‚Äôm free she just change my slot. I‚Äôve never given her my availability so there‚Äôs no reason for her to think I‚Äôm open at that time. Also when I talk to her all she does is say OK. If I wanted to vent I would just do it to one of my friends for free I‚Äôm not paying for someone to vent to. Not worth it!

I tried this app. I heard so many good things from YouTubers, friends, etc. My first counselor I got paired with was aloof, cold, and disconnected. I quickly found that she was not a good match for me and switched therapists.

My second and final therapist was a disaster. Our second session, I was annoyed that she was talking way, way more than me (25 minutes in, I had spoken for TWO minutes). I ended up hanging up on her AFTER SHE WENT THROUGH A DRIVE THRU DURING OUR SESSION. I was appalled. I felt so disrespected which is the last thing anybody should feel during therapy.

For a reduced price rate of $208 a month, BetterHelp is entirely too expensive for what it is. I recommend searching for a therapist in your area and if cost is an issue, inquire about a sliding scale or pro bono work. I know from a firsthand experience that therapy can be life changing, I would just not recommend  BetterHelp.

The only reason I gave two stars is because BetterHelp did reach out to me after I reported my experience and offered a free week of therapy so I could connect to a counselor (not enough compensation in my opinion) and because I do have some friends that love BetterHelp and have found amazing therapists.

I went to the app to start my first session, and the app didn‚Äôt work (‚Äúinternal server error‚Äù). I finally found a phone number online, called, and the person I spoke with told me he would pass my concerns on to the customer success team and they would email me within 24 hours. Not sure why they even have someone to answer the phones if they just write down your question and have someone else email you about it a day later. I‚Äôve now missed my appointment after waiting almost 2 weeks for it, and I‚Äôm now 3/4 weeks through my first month that cost me over $200 and I haven‚Äôt even spoken to a counselor.

If you are looking for counseling to improve your patience or address anger issues, BetterHelp will probably make them worse with their embarrassingly lacking customer service.

Therapy overall was fine; however, the customer service contact options are horrible. There is no phone number listed in the app - you have to fill out a form to request contact. I‚Äôve submitted 3 requests over the span of 3 weeks & never heard from anyone. I had to Google a number to call. Once I was finally able to speak to someone, all they did was collect my information and submitted a request for someone to contact me. I was told I‚Äôd hear from someone in 1 business day, but 3 days came and went. I called the number again, just to have my information submitted into a portal for someone to contact me back. There are so many people looking for jobs, Betterhelp, please get some employees. I‚Äôve spent over $1,000 with this company and cannot get basic needs met‚Ä¶ smh

The app works fine it‚Äôs the behind the scenes that is completely off at BetterHelp. I think it‚Äôs because the therapists are independent contractors and yes they ask you and ask you if the therapist is doing a great/good job, you can switch pretty easily if you do t like your therapist. God forbid you have a question about the different levels of subscriptions. I have asked at least 4 times and instead of the person assigned to me in customer services asking a manager to respond I‚Äôm either getting my answer half-a$$ed answered or just not answered at all. It is so frustrating I‚Äôm cancelling my subscription. Their customer service is adding stress to my life and I‚Äôm having to talk to my BetterHelp therapist about it. That‚Äôs ridiculous.

I had a lot of trouble matching to a counselor who would be a good fit for me - I specifically asked for someone without a religious lens and was first matched with a therapist who mentioned prayer and god in the bio, so I changed counselors. The next one sent me a couple brief canned queries and was then unavailable for a couple weeks - which is cool, because we all need a break - and subsequently was still very difficult to schedule conversations with except at the last minute. I thought about going for a third different counselor but also felt resentful that this was making my life harder instead of better. I really needed help and was charged for four weeks of therapy to receive none. Other folks seem to have had better experience, so maybe I just fell through the cracks here.

You have to pay for 4 weeks of therapy upfront regardless of if they match you with a therapist or if that therapist‚Äôs availability fits your schedule. I didn‚Äôt receive any therapy sessions in my first week which I paid for and won‚Äôt receive credit for.  I was able to schedule a session in my second week and my first intake appointment, the first time the therapist ever met me, was less than half an hour.  How do you get to know someone and show them that you care in less than 30 minutes? (You can‚Äôt). She was late to our session and then ended it abruptly at the 30 minute mark without offering anything helpful to me.  She was emotionally unavailable for me, forgot about things I had just told her, and apologized that her brain was ‚Äúfried‚Äù because it was late in her time zone.

I can‚Äôt speak for everyone, but personally, I had a bad experience and it was a waste of money. I signed up, filled out all of my info, and requested a CA psychologist. They assigned me to someone from Alabama. Not a huge deal, but took me a few days to transfer over and find a new one. I finally get someone in my area, and had to wait a week for an appointment. He comes in to the zoom meeting 15 minutes late, for a 45 min session. I go to schedule a follow up appointment, but the next availability is 2.5 weeks down the line (I wanted a follow up a few days later). I finally have my follow up meeting, but he has to re-schedule. It was the biggest waste of $250 or whatever it cost. Stay away from this company. I have had therapy before, this one just felt cheap and low quality.

I dont wanna give you guys a single star. I was going through alot and i thought they might help me with my problem. Wo i paid $320 for a month so i can get some help with my depression my anxiety but once you pay them they dont care about you. Nobody gonna answer your messages on time nobody is gonna be there on you scheduled video counseling. Once they got their money they dont care you are trying to reach them or you need help. I canceled their service but next month they charge me again $320. They charged me $640 in total. Instead of helping me they are making it worst for me, frauds. And there is no contact number to reach them if you want to contact them if you leave them a message they will reply you that somebody will reach you in shortly but nobody will ever try to contact you.   

0/10

Been on here for about a month and so far I have spent nearly 400 dollars for 2 text messages from my therapist. At this rate it‚Äôs going to cost me tens of thousands of dollars to work through my issues. They really need a pricing model that includes text only subscriptions for those of us who can‚Äôt effectively communicate our feelings in real time. Basically you‚Äôre paying for an hour long session every week regardless of whether you schedule one. Also I‚Äôll add that I just started therapy because it was free. I never really had anxiety before but after a year of this I‚Äôm riddled with constant and anxiety and self doubt from all the issues that got brought up during therapy. BetterHelp has broken my brain.

I would have the app open and ready for the phone call live session but would receive a message from my counselor that I appeared offline. This happened the first time but were were able to eventually connect and have a 20 minute conversation until we lost connection. Rescheduled a week later and I made sure my WIFI was fully connected and waited with the app opened. She told me I was offline and I tried to restart the app but then it wouldn‚Äôt load for a few minutes. I asked her if I appeared online now but she never responded. I tried to restart again and then the app wouldn‚Äôt load at all. I was very excited to start this process but I was so frustrated that I canceled my subscription

First therapist admitted outright they had no expertise with adhd. That‚Äôs fine. Thanks for being honest. Same therapist then Talked Over me when I tried to explain moving meditation and said that sitting meditation hasn‚Äôt worked for me.
Even worse the therapist suggested I make my animal an ESA so I can fly with them in the airplane cabin. That felt highly irresponsible to me as 1) they couldn‚Äôt know yet if I even need an ESA (first session). 2) they asked nothing about my pet. Said animal would increase my anxiety because they are Noisy when traveling. 3) Untrained ESAs increase the stigma against service animals because they act so unpredictably. 

Could I have tried to get matched with a new therapist? Sure. But if I‚Äôm going to have to bounce between therapists for a while I‚Äôd rather do it with therapists my insurance covers.

My experience with Better Help was that I‚Äôd try to connect with the therapist in their app, and‚Ä¶. Static. Try reconnecting, and‚Ä¶ static. Tried a direct phone call instead of through the app, which did actually connect for about 20 minutes and then failed. Attempted a video chat, and that froze up. Repeated processes with no success. Mind you, this was done with 4 of 5 bars of phone service, and a 1gbs fiber optic internet connection, there was no problem with service.

So, you will be charged an entire months worth at bare minimum for a service you will not be able to use. Maybe not a scam, but I paid for a service that due their cheapness of server provider (or whatever is the actual cause) can not use, and I lost $360.

This isn‚Äôt better help. They‚Äôre better thief‚Äôs.

I did better help for a while and they used to give 60% off to me in ‚Äúfinancial aid‚Äù but now they don‚Äôt do that. They say they are cheaper then regular therapy but there not if you have insurance and they don‚Äôt take insurance. I‚Äôm glad they give access to therapy to some people but most people who need it can‚Äôt afford 260$ a month. The therapist I had was also incompetent. She spoke about other clients and I ultimately ended things with her because she judged me. Another therapist I felt unhelpful to. I have I guess a high standard for who I talk to as I‚Äôve been to therapy a long time. They need more quality checks on people or something. I hope someday they accept insurance or give help to low income people. Because that‚Äôs really what people need.

I signed up for BetterHelp as a way to continue therapy after in person visits have been stopped due to covid19. My therapist doesn‚Äôt do video chats so I decided to try this out. The counselor I was matched with was okay over text but once we video chatted, I felt no different than I had before the call. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs a privacy issue but she only showed an eyeball when we were talking. It‚Äôs hard to want to talk to someone when it‚Äôs that awkward. Based off that and some of our communication, I decided to switch counselors. It kept asking me to write more about myself and 3 days went by before they said they couldn‚Äôt match me to anyone. AWESOME. They immediately kicked me off the app with barely any notice. I‚Äôll miss the webinars the most. Such a waste of time but at least they refunded me immediately.

They charge you by the week, not the month. Base pay is $65 a week. Why would you pay for something every week when realistically and ideally you‚Äôre not using their services every week? They‚Äôre just preying on the mentally ill. Good luck getting therapist, it takes a minimum of 24 hours but can very easily take longer. I just signed up under the misconception that they‚Äôd charge you only if you had a therapy session every week, not charge for the week even if you didn‚Äôt use their services. I can‚Äôt afford to pay $65 every week, I barely work BECAUSE of my mental health. I don‚Äôt have that kind of cash flow so I have no choice but to cancel my subscription before I even get to use it. So ‚Äúthanks‚Äù BetterHelp, you really did me a lot of good.

The apps idea is great but the execution is so poor, I‚Äôll basically categorize it as the definition of clickbait. The prize per week it‚Äôs not as bad however one isn‚Äôt able to pay weekly instead you have to pay for the entire month in order to even get to use the app. Because of how much help I need I decided trying the app for the entire month that it forces you to pay. So far I spent about a week just trying to get match with a therapist and every time I have had to go for find new therapist because once I‚Äôm match the therapists won‚Äôt reply; which makes the 24/7 service questionable. In conclusion, if you are part of the working class I don‚Äôt recommend the app as the amount of money that is pay in comparison with service is not worth it.

So first off the app is glitchy as heck and will get stuck on a single page, but on several different pages this will happen. The only way to get out is to close the app all together, and there appears to be no rhyme or reason to the issues. The platform is not at all intuitive, and will also send you a million notifications via app, text, and email, even after you opt out. 

Now for the actual therapy - I can‚Äôt comment on this because my first therapist rescheduled so many times that it caused me to switch, and then the next therapist had no experience in the issues I needed help with, so I cancelled my account. 

There‚Äôs a shortage of therapists in the US but this does not even come close to bridging the gap.

This app charges you per week, even before finding you a therapist. Instead of charging once you are paired with someone: it charges for delays and incompetence. So you‚Äôre paying for no service at all. Once they paired me with a therapist; that therapist did their appointment with me while riding around in a car with her friend. I should sue BetterHelp for all of my money back. They billed my HSA, so if they aren‚Äôt following the law and are billing weeks before they actually provide service- than it should fall under medical fraud. I asked the therapist (after I noticed a seat belt) if she was driving. She responded, ‚ÄúNo‚Äù. So someone else is driving you? ‚ÄúYes, my friend.‚Äù I had had it immediately with Better Help. Better Help should reimburse all of my tax-free money.

I‚Äôm happy for BH bringing me to my therapist, she‚Äôs amazing and actually provides me with homework, tools, and enlightenment. Our sessions aren‚Äôt just chats, they are work and I‚Äôve never felt better. 

However, I can‚Äôt justify paying $140/month for ONE session a month. This was after I was paying $230/month for unlimited sessions (and that was a discounted price btw) which I found pointless cos my tolerance for sitting and talking and going through my trauma more than once a week is zero. I was drained trying to justify the price point.

Anyway, I would only recommend this app to find your therapist, get to know them, then ask if they take on private clients for more than half the cost.

I am going to stop using this service. My counselor has cancelled about half of the sessions I've scheduled. ( 4/8) It's definitely hard to build any kind of trust when they are simply unreliable. Also, if I am being honest, I have heard from others that their therapists on better help cancelled all the time on them as well. It does seem like maybe this app is a bit of a scam. Promising 1 session a week, the counselors double book and cancel often,  so I‚Äôm only getting about 2 sessions a month. That means I‚Äôm paying double the advertised price per session. Also, the availability is poor, so a counselor often won‚Äôt have a single opening in a week. I think this company is taking advantage of people who are genuinely trying to get help.

If you have insurance in the US therapy is whatever your specialist copay is‚Ä¶ for me that‚Äôs $40 a session. Most therapists will book you weekly or every other week for a 50 minute session, on the same day at the same time‚Ä¶. So it would cost about $160 a month.

This is $270 a month. The sessions are 30 minutes, and it‚Äôs not possible to book more than one at a time, so I‚Äôve been constantly scrambling to fit therapy into my life.

The only thing good about it is that you don‚Äôt have to find your own therapist and you can probably get your FIRST session in the next few days, but after that you‚Äôll be waiting every two weeks for sure.

Thinking about trying a 1 month trial? I was really excited and interested until I was continually losing days until my entire 50% off (still paid $180) trial was practically gone. First a couple of days to be assigned a counselor, then a few days to make contact, then a couple of days to fill out this form, then a couple of days to fill out that form with zero acknowledgement regarding my efforts. Days slipped by as the counselor I was assigned really didn‚Äôt care and continually sent generic messages with no sense of humanity. Also, I was assigned to a social worker who clearly does BetterHelp on the side and was only available on the weekends.  $180 to be led on and beat down.  Never again, and I will never recommend this service to anybody.

My assigned therapist took advantage of my trust. They told me about another patient to have me recommend solutions to their problems, they included the other patient‚Äôs name and personal details in direct violation to patient confidentiality. This did not bother me much at first until I realized they were taking up most of my sessions doing that. Eventually I felt entirely pointless, taken advantage of, and was paying to be used. This was a huge violation of my trust and very damaging to my mental health. Update: Currently the only support or contact with Betterhelp has been for them to pass me off to TECH SUPPORT and pretend there was a software issue. This is disgusting and anyone should be wary using this service.

All I learned from using BetterHelp is that I am an absolute fool to have spent $320 on this. The therapists are extremely under-qualified for dealing with mental health, and I can only see this being helpful to people with extremely mild and treatable anxiety. Any other mental health concern, you will leave feeling totally alone and hopeless. My therapist prompted me to talk about my traumas, then responded extremely inappropriately with a text about her religion and how a holy day is coming up to bring light to my life. (I did not list religion in my profile, so this was totally uncalled for and unprofessional). Most of the responses look like they were copy and pasted and sent to every client. Did not feel listened to at all. If anything this app actually spiraled me into more of a depression.

I was SO HOPEFUL and excited when I signed up for this app. My first counselor had an excellent bio. I was excited. She never got back to me ever. When I asked for some kind of ‚Äúwork‚Äù to do til our session she gives me 2 work sheets with no explanation whatsoever. Changed my counselor. He sounded great also. Excited again. Although he did get back to me he just kept telling me to pray when I very clearly told him I pray all day everyday. Changed counselor AGAIN. After telling her I needed help with anxious thoughts consuming me she offers me help finding a new job (my job being one of the things that makes me anxious). I told her I don‚Äôt need help finding a new job I need help with anxiety. She literally never got back to me after that. Cancelled app. VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!!!!!!!!!

Why are we billed weekly or monthly? Sometimes therapists have no time available a given week‚Ä¶ but you still pay. And since you can‚Äôt book more than one session in advance, you always run into the same problem. Or if you go on vacation and can‚Äôt see someone a given week‚Ä¶ you still pay!
This is pretty expensive, so this problem is very frustrating. Instead, I would like them to offer ‚Äúpacks‚Äù: instead of billing for a month, bill for 4 live sessions which are only counted if you actually do them.
(Let‚Äôs be honest the ‚Äúunlimited texts and emails‚Äù is silly, you only text your therapist to schedule a session)

I‚Äôve been working with Better Help since the beginning of the year, and I‚Äôve made no progress. I‚Äôve been in therapy before, so I know what a good connection with a therapist should feel like. It is hard to build trust with a therapist in this format. I like routine, so the inability to pick the same time each week disrupts my momentum. Worst of all, one therapist failed to show up to a session twice, so I switched to another one. The second therapist was having technical difficulties tonight, so she sent an apologetic message. I appreciate the communication, but why am I paying for people to not show up? They‚Äôre good people, but it‚Äôs not working for me. It may be worse than nothing.

Paid for a week. I got a counselor that had no time for me. Literally, the day I had off 5 days later she was booked! Why pair me with someone booked out multiple weeks when I paid for just one? Not only that, but I listed my concerns as financial, and before my counselor and I even began to chat, literally 3 instant messages in, she tells me I need to allocate more money to counseling. Oh, so the week I paid for is worthless? I chose to decline further help, but the app keeps auto pairing me with new people which is just stressful. I want it to stop completely. Just take the money I spent, I know I‚Äôve been with you for less than 24 hours but it‚Äôs clear there is serious issues and I don‚Äôt want to be taken advantage of any more.

i tried to use this app for a couple months before i realized its not for mentally ill people. first therapist canceled our appointment last minute without saying why or rescheduling. second one didn‚Äôt have availability. a couple more were religious & not lgbtq+, when i specifically requested the opposite. they say it takes 24-48 hours to match with a counselor and this is a lie. it‚Äôs taken me 3+ days to find a match each time. worst part is they charge you $400/month for this ‚Äúservice.‚Äù it‚Äôs crap, don‚Äôt fall for it. i did have one therapist i saw a few times but i didn‚Äôt get anything out of it. she basically just would say ‚Äúoh that‚Äôs awful‚Äù or tell me to just think about my problems differently which‚Ä¶ if you have a serious mental illness that just increases the sense of guilt and shame. if you are lonely and just stressed this is probably a decent app but if you are actually mentally ill i wouldn‚Äôt recommend it at all. they also make it seem like it‚Äôs easy to be matched with an lgbtq+ counselor but i tried half a dozen time and never found one.

Charged up front for full month subscription, not weekly. Went through 3 counselors in the first week because of scheduling conflicts. Finally got one, but you only get 30 min sessions. Week 2, I had a 30 minute session. You are lucky to get an actual session within a week from each other. My counselor was late on the last two sessions, which were 2 weeks apart. Once 20 mins late (week 3) and the last one (week 4) she messaged me 30 mins late saying she wasn't notified I was online. For the counselor to initiate the call you have to be on the chat screen. So I sat there waiting and refreshing for 30 minutes. I paid $300+ plus for two 30 minute sessions in a month time. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

Every time I got matched with a counselor their availability was very limited and I had to wait days weeks to hear back. Definitely was not worth the $250 when I was only able to get 2 counseling sessions in. Not to mention a lot of the counselors act more as just people to talk to rather than actual counsel and assistant you through your issues which defeats the purpose. I finally got a great counselor when I opted to cancel my subscription and even then I couldn‚Äôt get a chat session or live session or phone session until my 2nd to last week before my subscription was over. I rather try to find in person counseling at this point.

I had the program for about a year, near the end I didn‚Äôt receive real therapy(no advice) and had hired regular appointments with another therapist to deal with my anxiety.  Then tried it again and was abandoned by my therapist after a couple months by her cancelling all contact without notice.  She gave some lie about I had to be physically in that state when she talking to me. Very unprofessional.  She cancelled everything without notice.  Which is called patient abandonment.  She did during the pandemic. 

Why pay for therapy if I have to do all the work by learning dynamics of relationships. Isn‚Äôt that what a therapy is paid for?  To help me stand up against abuse and anxiety.

Not real therapy, I wasted my money.

They give me a therapist 30 years my junior who lacked empathy.  Image a therapist who that lacks empathy.   Who really couldn‚Äôt connect with me about my life nor did she care.  Very little experience. The bare minimum of programs requiresments.  Seems most are the same, therapist who lacks life experiences to give you empathy.  Try in person appointments you gain more. Be good to yourself with a real appointment. You deserve better!!!

This app is a complete scam do NOT JOIN! I paid the money up front, was matched with a counselor , made my appointment and she never even showed up to our session. She never replied to one message, nothing.  I chose another counselor and her only available appointment was in 2 weeks!!  I emailed support demanding a refund and they sent a form letter trying to SELL me more weeks offering a free week and another counselor?? I have anxiety and THIS is supposed to help me? This experience has given me MORE anxiety! They don‚Äôt care about anyone they are serving and the FORM email from customer service is proof. Do they even vet out their counselors? I am so upset, it took a lot for me to look for help and another door was slammed in my face, with no one to help me.

I am sad to write that my therapist stopped showing up after 2 sessions. On my third one she just disappeared. I am so disappointed in this app. It should have gone like this. I have never in my life been stood up by someone with a professional license with no explanation as to why. It‚Äôs been a few days, I have reached out to BetterHelp and gotten no response. If you open your heart to a therapist and they just don‚Äôt even show up and you have to find a new one, that‚Äôs just not ok. Some people can‚Äôt open up more than once or to all these new people all the time. It takes a lot just to do it once. I can find better in person. I deserve to be treated better.

I was matched to two different counselor. The first was a very abrasive woman told me to quote, ‚Äújust stop feeling this way.‚Äù 
The second counselor, when she found out that I was visiting my parents out of state told me she couldn‚Äôt speak with until I returned to my residential state. While I understand the legality involved, she completely dropped me during a very stressful and unstable time in my life without any advice or help to find another counselor. I had sent her a series of messages outside of business hours that were marked urgent and didn‚Äôt hear from her until four days later. I‚Äôm not saying there aren‚Äôt good and helpful counselors through this service. Just be wary. These women did not have my best interest in mind.

Signed up, their only option was monthly, so paid. The first week they ‚Äúmatched‚Äù me with counselors that didn‚Äôt meet the basic questionnaire I filled out (two were religious when I specifically said no religion, one didn‚Äôt do video chats when I specifically said video chats), so then I had 3 weeks after paying for 4. Then, I only had a half hour session, the next week was maybe 10 minutes and the last maybe 5 minutes. I was expecting some sort of counseling, rather then ‚Äúhow was your week? Ok? Well, call me next week.‚Äù This is not counseling service, they just take 2 months (I was renewed before the last 5min session) of cash for about 45 minutes of small talk.

I had to keep switching therapists because sometimes they will not show up to sessions without a word about them not being able to make it. A few therapists that I‚Äôve had the displeasure of matching with are comically bad. I had a lady that would just talk on end for minutes that had me questioning if I was I there for therapy or was she. It was so strange. The group sessions proved to be unhelpful for me, some of the other group session attendees seem to love it though. Customer service was always great though, they would respond within 24-48hours and extended my subscription whenever something interfered with my sessions.

1. The video chat feature is very buggy, making a video session with counselor more distracting annoying annoying than helpful.
2. While the words you type and the things you say are private from what I can tell, when you open the app, how long you‚Äôre in the app, how long sessions last are all available to companies like Facebook so they can target you with ads based on your mental health as they perceive by your data. 
3. They do not verify the qualifications of counselors. They state in their terms of service but you must perform independent verification.
4. This is basically Uber for therapy in a broken car and the driver may or may not have a suspended license.

I signed up last week to receive much needed counseling. I signed up for the $65 weekly plan. I had one session with my counselor, and I enjoyed it. She was very nice. Yesterday I changed my plan to the $45 weekly plan, and today I check my bank account and they charged me the yearly amount of $585. I tried to get in contact with customer service 4 times, and the only way you can get in touch with customer service is through email. And it takes one business day to respond. Also, I checked my bank statement, and they charged me with the highest rate of $80 a week instead of $65. BEWARE!! They will steal your money! It‚Äôs so unfortunate that a service establishes to help people is actually just stealing from them.

I signed up for a plan based on the ads that you could have text conversations with your therapist, thinking it would be a somewhat regularly available option.  Instead, you have to choose a provider and schedule a time where you can text them for an hour. The timings are hard to obtain, the wait period is long, and I don‚Äôt feel this is any way more convenient than an in person therapist.  I found a local therapist, got a video call for intake, and scheduled future appointments before I was able to speak with someone through this app.  It was wasted money and I think you‚Äôre better off going with a local option.

There is no way to pause any kind of plan without paying 200 a week. They can obviously see you aren‚Äôt using the app and never notify you of any billing or reminder/check in.

For an app that prides itself on helping people struggling mentally - you would think there would be grace or a feature that doesn‚Äôt bill you for a month of thereapy you don‚Äôt use. Maybe there is a lot going on? Maybe they took a month away from their anxiety inducing devices? 

A real therapist would only bill you for the sessions and if you stopped responding they would request you get removed from their client list - but they wouldn‚Äôt bill you for 4 sessions every month.

I did not have a good experience with this app or my therapist. Little to no communication and lack of response in the session portion where you can message your therapist etc.

She would ask me to explain and then wouldn‚Äôt respond. 

During the first and only session (I have since cancelled my account and deleted the app) I discovered my therapist was not at all competent to deal with sexual trauma and completely invalidated my experience and honestly it was awful. If you‚Äôre needing more in-depth therapy instead of worksheets and surface level conversation, I do not recommend this app at all. Very disappointed with my experience as it has taken me years to seek help for this. Back to square one.

I‚Äôve been going through a lot of depression and anxiety this late year and I finally decided to give this app a try because I don‚Äôt have a way to go out and see one and for this whole week I haven‚Äôt been able to reach anybody and when I did it was two days later ... I‚Äôve tried to get in touch with 7-8 different counselors and just no one is reaching out within a reasonable time and it‚Äôs making me feel worse than when I didn‚Äôt try to reach out for help in the first place. I had high hopes that I was going to get the help I really need but maybe I just one of the unlucky ones that couldn‚Äôt get the help they needed if that makes sense.

Perhaps it‚Äôs because I only stayed for three sessions, but I did not find anything helpful from this service. Aside from being $400 a month, my counselor was always late for our sessions and kept pushing me to look for work outside of my skill set, even though my reasons for counseling had nothing to do with my employment. It was very odd, like she was a school counselor wanting to focus on my work and never giving me the chance to go into detail on my actual problems. I definitely do not recommend. If you only have minor anxieties then this may be for you, but I feel I‚Äôve been scammed. Please seek actual counseling if you need help, because this service is not it.

I‚Äôve been having problems since I first tried using BetterHelp last month. I went through 4 counselors. One of them did not respond to me my messages after a few days. The next one told me she straight up could not help me with my specific issue. The third one actually seemed promising‚Ä¶and then BetterHelp randomly switched me to a fourth counselor, who immediately tried pressuring me into continuing services. This all took place within a week. I canceled services after and got a refund.

Just yesterday, I wanted to perhaps talk to someone on the customer support, because I could not find another similar service and I get some extra information. Upon logging in on the app, I was charged immediately for a month of service, when I didn‚Äôt even select anything.

Customer support is also awful. Contacting them through the app will only get you a generic bot response. 

Luckily I got a refund (second time.) Perhaps this was just a random occurrence that rarely happens, but it was terrible.

What you get with BetterHelp is different than the App. I signed up a week ago and had a bumpy start getting matched with a therapist who met the criteria I requested. In fact, several criteria were ignored.  Wasted a week of the service I paid for. Strike  one. 

Then I got matched with  someone who met one of the criteria but not others. I go to open the app to send them a message and it just doesn‚Äôt work. Says I‚Äôm not connected. I update. I close and reopen. I do all the things. 

The app is trash. Hopefully the service gets better. For $250/month I certainly expect better. Cheaper than an in-person therapist but possibly not worth the headache.

I was having trouble finding a therapist in my area, so I turned to BetterHelp. The first therapist I had said the word ‚Äúdefinitely‚Äù 57 times in our first session. Yes, I counted. 

The second therapist seemed alright for a little, until I cried during our fourth session and he absolutely could not handle it. He shuffled through his notes to find me a ‚Äúresource‚Äù, and then SAID HE HAD TO GO EARLY AND HUNG UP. You could probably find someone who‚Äôs decent if you spend a long time looking and switching, but it will cost you. It was over $600 for me to be matched with two absolutely terrible practitioners.  Never again.

Nice idea, awful execution.  You‚Äôre forced to pony up ‚Äî even though financial aid is available ‚Äî before you will even be allowed to talk to a counselor, which is a really bad idea because serious counselors will offer a free consult to see if you are a fit first.  To make matters worse, using a link from the website of one of the therapists to get access to BetterHelp does not guarantee you will get that specific therapist, which means you‚Äôre not allowed to choose who you get to work with.  Both are major no-nos.

Try it if you‚Äôre desperate, but be forewarned: All they really want is your money and you will be disappointed by how impersonal the selection process is.

I would give this another try but it‚Äôs way too expensive. $230 a month and it takes at least 2 weeks to figure out if you‚Äôre compatible with a therapists. It takes about 2 days to find a new therapist then it takes anywhere from a 1-2 weeks to get a session with that therapist. So in 2 months all I did was change therapist, wait for an opening in their schedule and then realize we weren‚Äôt going to work. Which is fine if I‚Äôm not paying so much money trying to find the right person. I‚Äôve paid nearly $500 and only had 2 30 min sessions and 1 cut short because we both agreed it wasn‚Äôt going to work out.

I like the option to talk to my therapist without going anywhere. It‚Äôs helped immensely. 

However, I think BetterHelp needs to fix their payment options to prevent therapy from being a privilege. The lowest option is $35/week, but you have to pay that all at once, which is ridiculous. It‚Äôs one of the most affordable options, but it‚Äôs so difficult for people to meet. 

BetterHelp, do BETTER. Give an option to actually pay the $35/week instead of all at once so people have access to mental health. Are you actually trying to HELP people, or are you just in it for the capital??

I am so disappointed with BetterHelp. This company NEVER assigned me with a therapist after 5 days & deleted my account after contacting support about a refund. Tried this out for a month and it seemed elementary. This app is really just paying for a quick friend to listen to you. If that‚Äôs what you need, by all means go through with it. I wish you call BetterHelp to talk through issues with app or platform, but they are keeping costs down and only allowing you to email them.

In short, $288 for not even a full 30 minute session once a month and some text messages. You can get 2 one hours sessions a month with a lot of other therapists for that.
