I told them I checked and the lists of states that don‚Äôt allow care/prescriptions online did not include my state. I was told it wasn‚Äôt for ADHD, it was for bipolar. They cancelled my subscription but won‚Äôt refund me for a service I couldn‚Äôt use. When I was finally responded to about it, they told me they‚Äôd refund me $4 but I agreed to terms of the subscription whether the services were utilized or not. I wanted to utilize the service. I was told I couldn‚Äôt. And nowhere did they list they can‚Äôt help bipolar in PA. Rip-off. Cruel to take advantage of someone who read great reviews and wanted to finally get help when everywhere in my area will take months. Guess it‚Äôs better to wait than trust a sketchy app.

Only way I have been able to create/login/access my cerebral account is by using a web browser session.  

The app never has worked, from day one.  I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app countless times.  Have tried many different days and times of day over a roughly 3-week period.  The app will always initially open up to the login screen.  I always enter my correct credentials and then no matter what, the app always just goes to a solid white screen and stays there indefinitely.  It‚Äôs like it is trying to process the login request or something and it just gets stuck there.  

I am incredibly surprised to see such a promising service offer such a horrible and malfunctioning app on the Apple App Store.  Especially considering the amount of money this company has spent on its marketing efforts.  I saw this companies adds many, many times over the last 4-6 months on a variety of platforms ranging from social media, to music streaming services, to video streaming services.  Really would have expected it to at least have its app fully functional before it went so hard to the market trying to acquire clients.

The service is trash and not worth the money. The appointments are rushed and counselors and prescribers all seemed bored and annoyed when I asked questions or spoke at all. My counselor only responded to message every other day and because of this when she sent my medication to the wrong place 4 times in a row the delay time to actually receive it took over 2 weeks because of the slow communication. I was prescribed 3 medications and was charged extra for the medication which I thought was included in the price. I know other members of cerebral with the same medications and no health insurance just like me but they didn‚Äôt have to ever pay extra so I‚Äôm not sure why I did every month. And when I asked these questions went unanswered as did most of my questions about the service. Also you only get monthly meetings with are about 15 minutes with a counselor which is ridiculous and you can only meet with your prescriber every 3 months so why is every month charged the same when all of the services are not available every month. I was a member for 5 months just to give some clarity. I tried to give them a chance.

I was marketed to Cerebral because they ‚Äúhelp with adhd.‚Äù I have struggled my whole life with severe symptoms. All assessments rank the symptoms high for me. They made me feel misunderstood. Put me on Zoloft which made symptoms worse for adhd. Was told to set alarms and get a planner. I signed up for meds in the mail and they didn‚Äôt deliver them on time so I went off cold Turkey for two days. My second counseling appointment was a no show to ‚Äútechnical issues‚Äù of which I had no communication from anyone on my ‚Äúcare team‚Äù about so I cancelled. It took them over 24 hours to get my meds ordered when I told them I had never received them. So the chat anytime feature, takes them a long time to reply. Having anxiety and being stressed about an appointment only to sit in the video room and your therapist never shows up‚Ä¶ on top of paying a lot of money, just made my mental health worse. Top it off, they won‚Äôt refund me because my care appointment was the day before my billing cycle. I never got the appointment and I have to throw away $85 for a service I won‚Äôt be using. Clearly mental health isn‚Äôt on their priority list as much as taking your money is. Nice!

I do not feel the prescribers on this app are equipped to prescribe for anything other than generalized depression. I am bipolar and deal with PTSD and my experience with cerebral has been very poor. I understand this app is NOT a replacement for an actual psych but I‚Äôve been taking the same medication for 10+ years, how hard can it be to get refills? It seems like every 6 months, my medicine is not correctly sent to the pharmacy or there‚Äôs some kind of miscommunication it isn‚Äôt even sent! Rule number one for anti depressants is NEVER stop them cold turkey. Well, I‚Äôve had to twice now because of lack of communication between cerebral and multiple pharmacies. You cannot actually speak to your prescriber when an error like this occurs so your ‚Äúcare counselor‚Äù has to report to them which can take days! And even then, even if they get through to them, you get a ‚Äúthey‚Äôll get back to you‚Äù. This app, in theory, sounds great but in my opinion, it falls shorts and when dealing with medication, you cannot afford to fall short.

I truly do not understand how this app is running honestly. Nothing presented is true. I had met with a prescriber and during that conversation she said she would prescribe me with Prozac and it would be there in a couple days, all this good stuff. A couple days later I went into my portal and I could not see the prescriber on my account anymore nor did I have any medications prescribed to me. A couple days after that I had a meeting with a therapist, she basically took the entire 30 minutes reassuring me the medication is coming and then said I was prescribed Zoloft. I found that extremely odd. A couple more days pass and I still have nothing so I sent a message through the chat and the only response I got was asking if I wanted it mailed or pick it up at the pharmacy. Now a week later, still no actual response, I ended my services. I don‚Äôt have any time to waste when it comes to my mental health and this app is absolutely disgusting for doing this to anybody. It is extremely traumatic to have a ‚Äútherapist ‚Äú let alone an entire team of them use you and make promises they never keep. I would never recommend this app to anybody.

This program left my mental health worse than when I began. I could never connect with a therapist. When I reached out to support for help finding someone that may be able to work with my schedule, support informed me that no one in my area had hours that would work. Next the prescriber I met with refused to fill the medication I have been currently taking because ‚Äúwe were not meeting in person‚Äù and cut my dosing in half despite me expressing how deeply I have been struggling. She informed me to go to the hospital if it was really as bad as I was claiming. If Cerebral is marketed as an easy virtual mental health  program then why would the prescribers working for Cerebral penalize patients care because of meeting virtually? It‚Äôs not a great sign for a mental health company when talking to their prescriber causes a panic attack. Severely disappointed with Cerebral would be putting it nicely. It was a complete waste of my money since support gave up responding to my requests and I was never able to schedule with a therapist. Sad when you are feeling desperate for help and only get taken advantage of.

I decided to try Cerebral after struggling to find an available therapist in my area. The care counselor I ended up with was sitting on a living room couch talking to someone else in the room in the middle of our first appointment. An office or quiet room without other people/disturbances would be a nice level of professionalism to uphold. The UI for this app is a joke. One single message thread for contacting all of your providers. I was told to contact my prescriber and they were not even shown as part of the message conversation, so I had no way of contacting them. I was told to schedule my next appointment before availability fills up and there was no way to do so within the app. Apparently you are able to schedule only when it prompts you to do so. How, as a telehealth app, can you not have appointment scheduling as a functioning feature? You had one job. After a week or so going back and forth with support they offered to schedule an appointment for me. At this point I cancelled and asked for a refund for the month which I could not even schedule using their app. This service is complete garbage.

When I went to sign up for Cerebral, there was a technical error with the app. After that was dealt with, there was a technical issue with the calendar in the app. It wasn‚Äôt allowing me to schedule anything with a prescriber. Then, there was another technical issue that prevented me from scheduling with a care coordinator. My prescriber was wonderful to talk to but then prescribed my medication in a way that my insurance didn‚Äôt accept. I tried to contact him immediately to let him know, but there‚Äôs no way to send a note to your prescriber that you need a prescription update. I tried to send a message to my care coordinator but the messaging system inside the app is also broken. 

Absolutely nothing in this app has functioned correctly for me since the moment I started. It‚Äôs been a very frustrating experience. When I told them about the technical issue, they told me to clear my cache, update my phone, or change browsers, so they have no idea what‚Äôs wrong with the app. 

If things get resolved quickly I might change my review but so far this has been a very poor experience overall.

There‚Äôs so many issues not only with the app but with the team of ‚Äúexperts‚Äù. I had originally switched from my original mental health provider to save time and money, however it is not worthy it. You get what you pay for, it‚Äôs cheap because you get cheap customer service. My emotional support team was not supportive at all instead they were condescending towards me reaching out regarding issues about my prescription and made it seem like I was trying to get extra medication‚Ä¶ my prescription was lost by FedEx (highly recommend not using the prescription delivery service as well, the do not actually require or show you a signature so when it says ‚Äúdelivered‚Äù there‚Äôs no telling if it was or not). So getting extra medication was definitely not the case. Receiving a response from your prescriber is extremely slow and frustrating because they are not responsive. All of this is horrible when you are going through personal struggles and struggles at work because your lack of medication is affecting your performance. Please, read the reviews and save yourself some frusteation.

I reached out to cerebral during a crisis of trying to mentally recover from a domestic violence situation that was ongoing, and quickly escalating. I chose therapy and medication because I felt that I needed both. My counselor was great, I would have loved to have stayed with her. My prescriber was scheduled to have a visit with me for the first time and just out of the blue cancelled it. I called and explained to them how bad I needed this and begging for her to give me my appointment back. Only to find out, she‚Äôd already given it to someone else. I guess their money spends better than mine. Rescheduled the appt with JACKIE DIXON, and she called me by different patients name throughout the video visit that wasn‚Äôt working. This was odd because my visit with my counselor worked great. We continued the session over the phone, she said she was prescribing 2 medications and I begged for weeks for answers as to where my prescriptions were. I was never prescribed anything. My domestic violence escalated to my fianc√© committing suicide, and I had to go elsewhere to find treatment to keep myself from going off the deep end. Waste of money, waste of time.

Update 2: I never received any services for my 2nd month, cancelled and asked for a refund, but Cerebral support‚Äôs Angelo D. rejected it. This is a subscription model, so even if they don‚Äôt give you any services, you will still be charged. Biggest waste of money ever!

 Update 1: This is my update after about a month. I was excited to find an online service to get my medication. And I enjoyed talking with my care providers for the initial sessions, but it‚Äôs been downhill from there. My providers don‚Äôt seem to listen to my needs as they‚Äôve sent out way more medication than I said I needed. At least I got it in a timely fashion. I just don‚Äôt feel listened to and my care provider even canceled my second session last minute. Which is fine, stuff happens. However, the next available appointment is more than a month from now. With the prescriber, 2 months. Talking with your health professionals this infrequently with a monthly subscription service isn‚Äôt right. The app is almost unusable as well. Can‚Äôt book appointments or complete your tasks. Not worth the 85 a month in my opinion. I‚Äôm ending my subscription.

I got this app because I don‚Äôt have insurance and desperately need care for my mental health. At first everything seemed to be going great, I was easily going to get my medication and therapy at an affordable rate. My prescriber said she‚Äôd have my pills delivered probably by midweek the next week and when they didn‚Äôt come i reached out to my care team. They tried to send them to a pharmacy (which would have been great had I actually had insurance) since I couldn‚Äôt afford them I asked to expedite them they said they‚Äôd reach out to my prescriber and get back to me. Two days later no response. I contact them again and this time alert them I am completely out of medication and they say the same thing. I just received a message two days after that last contact saying my prescriber can‚Äôt actually prescribe my medication because SHES NOT EVEN LICENSED IN MY STATE. They recommend people when you join and recommended me someone who cannot even prescribe me medication. Im going to unfortunately have to stick with this app for a while until I get insurance. I do not feel cared for or respected by any degree.

My plan was covered under insurance. I inquired about changing plans and was told by the Cerebral care coordinator that the cost was the same; no additional charges. She walked me through how to change my plan then, boom, nearly $400 in charges. 

For several days I messaged the care coordinator to ask what was going on. I screenshot the chat thread and showed her what she originally said. I called and left voice messages. I emailed as well. I finally received a response but it did not acknowledge or correct the error. A care coordinator finally told me that my insurance wasn‚Äôt applied to the transaction. 

It wasn‚Äôt until I asked to cancel my plan that they were willing to admit the error and agree to process the $400 refund. I decided to  go through with canceling my plan because of the mixup. It took two weeks to go through the many hoops to cancel my plan, and just as long if not longer to receive an actual refund of the $400 mishap. I never received a refund for the original service fee. It was clunky, not well integrated, very stressful. Just all the things you DONT want from a mental health care app.

I started at cerebral because I thought if I was in network it would only cost 30/month but it‚Äôs actually just an convoluted as using insurance for any mental health care. 

Cerebral is only required to send bills to your insurance every three months (trust me I called a million times and tried getting them to send them earlier but they were no help). After they finally submitted I had already seen my provider four times and am now responsible for four appointment costs which will vary for everyone. I have UHC and the contracted rate was 140/appt. So in total it is 170/appt‚Ä¶ same as all the other places. 

Cost asside - super hard to talk with your doctor because you have a ‚Äúcoordinator‚Äù who may or may not be able to get ahold of your doctor. So many technical glitches with their system (b/c ‚Äúthey are a startup‚Äù?) that I received a couple of my months free because it was THAT bad. Was super understanding about all of this until I was gouged at the cost‚Ä¶ now I‚Äôm moving on and just disappointed in all of these good reviews because I don‚Äôt see how this set up works for anyone‚Ä¶.

UPDATE: this is a scam. I‚Äôve been fighting with reps to be refunded, as they never allowed access to the service I subscribed to. My provider no showed my appointment, and somehow I‚Äôm getting blamed for it. Talking to ‚Äúsupport‚Äù gets you nowhere. No resolved tickets. No actual access to mental health services. absolutely avoid this ‚Äúservice‚Äù

 It‚Äôs absolutely unethical to claim to provide access to mental health support and then steal our money.

 I‚Äôve been a member since January, have managed to get only 1 20 minute appointment. Their schedule system lists appointments as open when they aren‚Äôt and you have to guess your way through the calendar to find one that works. The message function has never worked for me and I keep getting messages to schedule an appointment with a care counselor but when I try to schedule the app says I haven‚Äôt been assigned one. Every time I use this app I have to put in a support ticket for its basic functions. I‚Äôve spent $200 on mental support that has been not only non existent, but is actively making things harder. You‚Äôre not saving money here.

I was extremely dissatisfied with the services I received from Cerebral. I did not feel cared for or monitored in the slightest. The provider barely spoke to me and just threw meds at me. The process after that was an unorganized disaster. I was experiencing nightly severe panic attacks that did not allow me to sleep for longer than 3-4 hours a night and had to wait over a month to receive my prescribed as needed anxiety meds. When I did receive them, they were not the correct medication. Cerebral then sent my prescription to my local pharmacy where I was told I would have to pay over $80 to pick them up. I did not feel as though I was in the hands of people who cared in the slightest for my well being. I had a meeting with a therapist who was lovely and very helpful, but other than that the service was basically a nightmare and honestly hindered my mental health more than helped it. The low quality of ‚Äútreatment‚Äù I received was quite frankly irresponsible. I would highly advise anybody considering this service to try to find ANY other way to receive mental health treatment.

It‚Äôs already difficult finding medical care providers in-person as a new patient. I was pretty excited at first‚Ä¶.however my experiences had not been the best with Cerebral. Please note, this is my first time ever writing a review. 

The Care Coordinators don‚Äôt respond until like 3-4 days late. Not easily accessible. It was great when they were able to switch me with a better prescriber, but then they canceled on me telling me that the ONLY prescriber who can help me in my network is no longer available. This is Pennsylvania we‚Äôre talking about‚Ä¶the ONLY one that could help according to my medication needs in my network has been changed to another department - Marisa Savic. This is so disappointing as I feel like I wasted money for no service at all. It feels like a scam. I‚Äôm just gonna keep doing my research and find an actual in-person medical provider. This is the second remote medical app I‚Äôve attempted to get help from and it both failed me. Folks, you‚Äôre better off asking your insurance to help you find a mental health specialist. Hope everyone continue or start to heal with their mental health.

I purchased the promo $27 package. I was at a moment that I can use someone to speak to. The same day within 30minutes or purchasing the app I opted in for the support and paid the $114 additional. I booked my appointment and the therapist was a no show. Call the support lines and nothing. At this point I felt that this app was not worth the money I had just spent $141 for an app I read off ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù tips from? Yeah I have google for that. I called to cancel I submitted my cancellations forms etc all with the same day. Moments of purchasing actually. All they cared was to keep my money and not offer support. They cancelled my membership and stated they can not refund me because ‚Äúwe have to pay everyone that was available to support you while you had the membership. I had the ‚Äúmembership‚Äù or package whatever for only a few hours. The therapist was a no show and no one ever got back to me about support or to help me through fixing the issue. So who really was available? You only care about the money. I paid $140 to have an app for a few hours. Nice.

I was given a charge for medication of 30 dollars, two months before I was due for medication. I contacted support immediately and requested they CANCEL the order but they didn‚Äôt. They did an investigation that lasted a week, and did not cancel medication. They said the pharmacy switched to a 90 day because of insurance purposes. They told me I couldn‚Äôt receive a refund or return the medication even though it was THEIR MISTAKE! If they had listened to me and cancelled the order like I had asked to it wouldn‚Äôt have been shipped to me.  I‚Äôm extremely upset about this because I‚Äôve been purposefully trying to save money, I‚Äôm obviously struggling with my mental health and the fact they didn‚Äôt listen to me and took so long to confirm the information I had given them (I had even provided them with pictures of the prescription labels and they still had to call the pharmacy). It was a complete hassle and completely unnecessary on their part. And you can‚Äôt cancel instantly you have to //email them to cancel//, and I have done so. I wish I could get all the money I spent back.

Without the therapy option, you are paying $85 a month just for prescription services which are slightly more convenient but way more expensive than just seeing a traditional doctor or psychologist occasionally to get the medication you need. What makes me dislike this company the most is the difficulty it takes to cancel your subscription. You cannot cancel online or in the app, you have to email them and wait for them to get back to you. This to me is an unethical practice that takes advantage of people who are already struggling with mental health and may avoid or forget to go through these extra steps and waste a bunch of money on this service even if it is not helping them. There is no reason they cannot allow you to cancel more easily, they just make it more difficult on purpose so they can make money off of people who fail to cancel when they otherwise would like to. For this reason I would never trust this company or use them again and I would not recommend it.

Unless you have money to burn, this service is a GAMBLE: They do not offer refunds under any circumstances. Is your situation asking for a refund a special circumstance? Did you not use their service yet before cancelling? Too bad, because after they have told you there are no refunds, they will BLOCK your email from further support tickets so you can‚Äôt say anything else.
For mental health, money is important. You NEED money for mental health services and medication. Not only is it bad business practice not to give refunds, it‚Äôs dangerous to do this as a mental health service. This is money that could have been used to help in another way and that is taken away if Cerebral doesn‚Äôt help or it is not as expected. If this were a good service, they would not have to give so many refunds, and it seems like they already have their protocol down with blocking my email from further discussion about it, which also tells me it must happen a lot. Instead of playing with your mental health, just find something you are confident will work for you.

This app is cheap and not worth it. They never stated during the sign up process that payment without insurance would accumulate to 325 DOLLARS A MONTH. Well I guess shame on me for not fully reading their ‚Äúterms and conditions‚Äù while suffering and struggling to find help while in the midst of a mental health crisis. I only had two therapy sessions, pointless ones at that. And had one refill of medication adding up to 25 dollars. When I realized 325 dollars had been snuck out of my account, mind you I only work part time and I‚Äôm 21 years old (325 dollars is a big chunk out of my income) if I KNEW I would be paying this much I would have NEVER signed up for this piece of crap scam of a therapy service. I called, trying to get an understanding of how my minimal services added up to such an amount when I‚Äôd only used it for two weeks. They refused to give me a refund after two days of going back and forth and being told to wait. I canceled my subscription and was left in even more distress than when I started using it. So frankly, screw you cerebral!

So this was my first time seeking help and, wow, no wonder people have trouble reaching out. I was hoping to get help with anxiety/depression and to get tested for ADHD. My provider seemed to think I was only interested in getting adderall or another stimulant, even though I stated I wasn‚Äôt sure about even wanting medication if I did have adhd. According to her adhd is only diagnosed in childhood and if I did have it I would‚Äôve been diagnosed by now. I simply wanted to start the process of getting some help with these things because it‚Äôs affecting my daily life and felt completely dismissed by her. She brushed aside my feelings about struggling with daily tasks and said it was ‚Äúnormal‚Äù. She also stated that my difficulty with focusing on school and school work was ‚Äúa lack of motivation‚Äù. She then proceeded to tell me that if I tried to go to another provider that they would obviously drug test me and I would have to do further testing for adhd (which would be fine); loved being lectured for 30 minutes like I was just drug seeking. She didn‚Äôt even talk to me about my anxiety or depression‚Ä¶üôÉ

The only reason I still use this service is because I‚Äôve built a relationship with my therapist. The app itself lacks functionality and the care coordinators who work essentially as customer service reps, have never once been helpful. There was one instance when I couldn‚Äôt get an appointment for 2 months with my prescriber and I told the care coordinator, who did nothing to help me schedule an appointment sooner (this happened while I was having a bad reaction to a medication and NEEDED a meeting with them to get it resolved). The app itself also lacks functionality. Lastly, cerebral has recently changed payment processors, and sent only one email notification for this with no deadline for when my payment information needed to be updated, and I found out that my account had been suspended due to this. I am super frustrated but feel stuck using this service because of the knowledge and background that my therapist has. It is unfortunate.

I was hopeful about this service given the wait for most providers. For full transparency, I don‚Äôt know what care looks like because I never received it. I had two different clinicians reschedule last minute and one no showed. I had also waited an hour right after sign up to meet with someone but no luck. Things happen and it‚Äôs totally reasonable to expect rescheduling, however given I was waiting for an initial meeting with a prescriber there was no effort made to see whether delaying my appointment would also mean I would run out of my medication from a prior provider. Had I known the expected wait to see a provider was 1-2 months, I could plan accordingly. This was not the case. As a clinical psychologist, I am very familiar with what standard care looks like and I 
can say what I experienced was NOT that. I hope that others have a better experience for the sake of their care. Although it‚Äôs a pain, I suggest going through your insurance or looking at private practice therapists if you have anything beyond mild symptoms.

I‚Äôve used Cerebral for a few months now. At first it was great because I was able to speak to a provider fast about medications. Now it is entirely disappointing and the app is practically useless. Every time I've reached out to get refills of my prescriptions I cannot reach the provider directly and the care team constantly says all my medications were sent to my pharmacy when in reality only one or two were and so it takes days to get a response and to get my medications refilled. Same with if I have a question for my provider regarding side effects or changes, I cannot speak to them directly and it has to go through the care team and takes forever to get a response, and sometimes I have not gotten any clear response at all. The app is useless in these regards, it‚Äôs just a messaging system at this point. Ive also had my appointments with care team members rescheduled so many times now it‚Äôs hard to keep track. I am so frustrated with this service it‚Äôs pushed me to now switch services.

I started cerebral a couple months ago because I have issues with severe anxiety and depression and was quite sure I am adhd. At first it was helpful. I met with a provider and a care counselor within a couple days of signing up and I was started on medication. Then I had issues getting my care Counselor to join the video calls but I was getting notified that I was missing my appointments even though I signed on and waited in the waiting room for no one to show up. I notified cerebral and they apologized and offered to assign me a new counselor and asked me some questions about what I was looking for in a counselor, then never proceeded to assign a new one. So I‚Äôve wasted payments because I‚Äôm not even getting what I paid for which honestly DOES NOT help anxiety and depression because I know feel horrible guilty because I‚Äôm a stay at home mom so that money could have gone towards something else that would have been beneficial to my family. Don‚Äôt  use cerebral, they‚Äôll just take advantage of you and take your money.

From beginning to end this experience was terrible. The prescriber I was matched with was extremely rude and dismissive. She was visibly rolling her eyes and sighing at me when she got annoyed with my responses to her questions. When my chosen pharmacy ran out of my meds I messaged my care team for 2 weeks in the chat and received little to no response. I emailed, I called numbers and no one would/could help me get my script changed to a different pharmacy or change dosages. When I finally got someone to respond to me after literally begging someone to answer me in the chat they lied and told me my pharmacist said they were out of the smaller dosage (I had been communicating w/ my pharmacist almost daily & she said that never happened & was holding the meds for me all I needed was the ok from the prescriber). 
I felt helpless, I literally cried I was so frustrated. I can only say thank gd my diagnosed issue wasn‚Äôt depression because I was without meds for 2 weeks because my ‚Äúcare team‚Äù was ignoring me. 
Save yourself some stress and go elsewhere for help.

Kudos to this company for trying to provide much needed assistance in the mental health space. I think this start up has potential, but I experienced too many inconsistencies and issues for me to justify staying with Cerebral. Unfortunately I‚Äôd rather make the 45 minute drive to my primary care; something I was hoping to eliminate after subscribing to Cerebral. For example, it took 7-10 days to get a response from my prescriber via my Care Coordinator. In my opinion, response time to a medication question should never be 7-10 days. In addition, getting an appointment with a prescriber can take weeks so if for some reason you have to cancel and reschedule, expect to wait weeks for your next appointment. Don‚Äôt expect to have direct contact with your prescriber should you have a question or concern. You will have to go through a Care Coordinator, and from my experience it seems as though the Care Coordinators are unable to handle the volume of members/subscribers.

My first prescriber put me on some meds and I had questions after I started them and wrote in for help to never hear back on two separate issues. Switched prescribers, broke out from a Wellbutrin rash that turned into a severe allergic reaction causing hives all over my body and my lips and eyes swole. Wrote in for advice, never heard back. Had to go to the ER. Wrote in for help again. No one could get ahold of my prescriber. I was instructed by the ER to stop taking the meds. Now 2 days without any meds for my mental health issues and the prescriber has yet to been reached. I don‚Äôt know why they can‚Äôt forward me to a new prescriber? It‚Äôs an absolute joke. Seems to me that it‚Äôs professionals using this as easy money on the side because there is no urgency. I do not feel like a priority and for a service that is supposed to be a resource for people with mental health issues this should have a better system in place. Absolutely appalled at how much they neglected me in less than 2 months of this service. Unacceptable.

I am actually going into professional forensic counseling so I know what I want when I‚Äôm looking for a counselor/ psychiatrist. The amount of times I was unable to get my medication or join a meeting based on the COMPANIES mistake is unbelievable. This is usually followed with some gaslighting and no apology. For example: my psychiatrist wrote my prescription wrong.. this prescription is very important to take daily for the side affects are less than pleasant. When I desperately tried to contact anyone at cerebral to fix this.. it took them SEVERAL DAYS. They did not apologize instead they told me it was my fault for not reaching out earlier. As if I was supposed to know my script would be messed up. This is just one of many many mistakes. I do not recommend this service to anyone. Seems like they just want the money. The care is pretty crappy too. You get to see a counselor MAYBE once a month because they usually have NO availability. Not worth what you‚Äôre paying for. I left with more anxiety then I came in with.

Cerebral is decently affordable and when I signed up, was able to schedule an appointment with the prescriber the next day. The appointment went well, and I was prescribed my medications and was assured they were being delivered as soon as possible. 

Two days later, I had not been billed for the medication, never received a tracking number, email confirmation, etc. So I reached out to my care coordinator and they contacted me the following day. They assured me they would reach out to whomever needed to be talked to and would relay info to me as soon as they received it. 
Days passed and I heard nothing, so two days ago I reached out again to the coordinator and they have not responded. 

It has been over a week since I saw my prescriber and have received nothing for it. I reach out and am essentially told to wait. I have now gone without my medication because of this.

I have asked to cancel my subscription and have been informed it will take 1-2 days before they reach out to me to actually cancel. I can‚Äôt help but not have any faith that they will actually contact me.

I am also trying to receive a refund since I have not received any services, but once again I am told to wait for someone to get back to me. Something which I have little hope for.

I see the potential in cerebrals model, but it really feels as if they took my money and ran. They did just enough to get me to put in my card information and then fulfilled none of their promises.

I joined cerebral in hopes to get back on track with my adhd meds. The supposed place to go for your adhd needs. The prescriber tried to tell me I need to be a test dummy and take bipolar meds before she would perscribe me what I have been on the most of my life , Adderall . It‚Äôs what works for me . I‚Äôm sick of these people with the power to write scripts telling me take this , or this , or this , and this . Quit allowing people to destroy your lives with a bunch of antipsychotic meds when you know yourself well enough to know what works . I am not bipolar, I am adhd. I was a test dummy for these clinical idiots for over ten years of my life . Misdiagnosed and still to this day these idiots want to try to say I don‚Äôt recognize my own self and the behaviors of adhd. Which are constantly mistaken in several woman by the way . She is on her period she is bipolar. It took 3 weeks to get in to see a psychiatrist with cerebral . I already see a therapist and a psychiatrist and don‚Äôt waste your time or ur money on these ridiculous people

I made an attempt to use this service since I was in desperate need for mental health help because my anxiety had worsened and was at an all time low and my depression was plummeting faster and faster by the day. I was given medication I told my provider I had taken before and of course, it didn‚Äôt help me but I tried it anyways with no results of course and yes, I gave it the minimum time to look for results before I started TRYING to cancel my subscription. They offered me a discount since I was still seeing no results, so I gave it some more time until I was really ready to be done with the app and try moving on the an actual Mental Health doctor in a physical office I could go to. I canceled and filled out the cancellation paperwork and continued to get billed repeatedly. They ended up taking well over 100$ from me and didn‚Äôt offer any type of resolution, a refund of any form or even an apology. I will not recommend this app to anybody I know or care about because of the issues I had that were never solved.

Like many years, it took me literally years to seek therapy.  They make you pre-pay, so I paid for the medication and therapy option - which costs most more than they advertise.  When I met with the medication provider, it turns out they couldn‚Äôt even prescribe in my state.  Seems like a problem the app should have been weed out since they ask for your state.  Then, when my first therapy appointment came, I got stood up.  Therapist never showed.  I emailed support TWICE.  No response.  3 days later I get a barrage of auto-generated emails telling me that I missed my appointment, even tho I was on waiting.  Then they rescheduled me, without my knowledge, and sent me appointments that i did not choose with DIFFERENT providers during my work hours.  It says to click to reschedule, so I did.  Neither of the providers had even one available appointment going all the way into 2022.  I got ripped off during one of the most emotional and vulnerable points in my life.  Cerebral is just collecting money off people and failing to provide what they promise.

I signed up for weekly therapy through Cerebral. They charged my monthly fee day 1, but there weren‚Äôt any appointments available until 2 weeks later. At the start of the year, I entered my new insurance information, and without explanation of the changes, my plan was changed to medication management (I don‚Äôt currently take medication), cutting off my connection to my therapist and canceling my upcoming appointment. I was unable to reach customer service for assistance. As you may be able to imagine, I was extremely anxious. I changed my plan back to the previous plan hoping to re-connect to my therapist and was charged for another month of service and offered different therapists. When I finally reached customer service the next day, they offered a 30% refund on the erroneous billing. I was finally able to get a refund for the erroneous charges and cancel the service, but I ended up paying a 1 month subscription for 1 appointment and need therapy more than ever. I absolutely do not recommend!!

This service is a scam and an easy way to spend several hundred dollars and end up feeling worse off than you started. My counselor didn't show up to appointments for two weeks then I was informed that she left Cerebral and my new counselor was a random man. When I signed up, I chose to have a counselor that was a woman of color - only when I paid did I find out only white women were available, so I settled. So to be assigned a random man to speak to about DV and SA felt horrible, and so abrupt with no closure with my previous counselor who I had slowly been opening up to after months. Cerebral customer service will not refund me for the month when I had no counselor, no communication, and 4 appointments where my counselor or provider didn't show up. They send template responses citing their policy as a way of deflecting and not addressing the harm they've caused. I don't understand how they can treat people seeking help with depression and anxiety in such an uncaring way. It's dehumanizing. You're really just an ATM to them.

I would give zero stars if I could. This appears the one that could get me in the soonest, I paid $30 for my first month, was unable to meet with my first prescribed because I was matched to someone not in my state. I had to reschedule for 2 weeks out. I was then locked out of my account that same day. I reached out to support that gave me some troubleshooting tips which none worked. I was then more stressed out and could not wait any longer and trying to fix the issues was even more stress I didn‚Äôt need. I then have tried to cancel my subscription and get a refund for weeks now. I was just informed I am getting refunded $9.00. I literally just handed them money to do absolutely nothing since I have been locked out of the account and I am unable to use their ‚Äúsubscription‚Äù. I am beyond upset with this result. But to be honest this is more trouble than it‚Äôs worth and as someone who was having trouble reaching out for help I am clearly not going to feel better about asking for help in the future.

There‚Äôs never been a time that I had to go out of my way for a bad review ever, however I‚Äôll explain to the best of my abilities. I had one of the worst weeks that I‚Äôve ever lived through while using this app and I desperately needed help. Less than 24 hours before my appointment it gets cancelled due to a family emergency. It was something I excused, but I waited awhile for a reply on the date and nothing. The week got worse and I didn‚Äôt get a callback or anything. I had a meltdown and called to cancel my account, before I noticed that they charged me. Mind you: we were still starting, so NO REAL THERAPY HAD ACTUALLY TAKEN PLACE. After an extremely heated voicemail I demanded reimbursement because I didn‚Äôt get any service.

I was told they would oblige and it would be honored however due to their billing policy I would get NOTHING. The one ray of hope I had peeled away because of bureaucratic policies. I hate this app and will never forgive the people who run this company nor the company.

The beginning of my first month with cerebral was fine. I met with my prescriber and had two appointments with my therapist. Both providers were kind and competent and listened. Just before my third appointment I realized I had been locked out of my account although I had been billed. They refunded me, said it was a billing issue they were working to resolve. I was billed again and still did not have access to my account. I reached out and got a second refund and decided to cancel my subscription. I filled out the cancellation form and received confirmation of my cancellation and was billed again the next month. I reached out and once again had to get a refund, but my account was overdrafted because I was jot expecting to be billed for a service that I had cancelled. They refused to also refund me for my first month although I had dealt with continuous billing issues, and my month was cut short due to a "billing issue" on their part. Terrible support. Would not recommend.

I created an account on Cerebral website about 3 hours ago. During the onboarding, they asked for my credit card info before they acquire my insurance info, and immediately, unwittingly charged me.

Only after taking my card info and personal data did they notify me that my insurance wasn‚Äôt accepted,so I decided to quit the onboarding session, checked my phone, and found out they charged me $99.

I tried to call them, emailed them, what I was told: they can‚Äôt issue me the refund. 

I kept saying that I had no idea you don‚Äôt take my insurance, and you didn‚Äôt make it clear at all that you would charge me before even I find a therapist. 

I didn‚Äôt make any appointment, didn‚Äôt receive any service from them, and yet I‚Äôm out 100 bucks.

Besides this sleight of hand during the onboarding, what really upset me was they do not care about you. Their customer service kept saying a bunch of irrelevant things and trying not to take any responsibility for this situation. 

Be careful if you need help and you want to try Cerebral, you may will end up like me, spend $99 to have someone tell you that it‚Äôs your problem that your insurance is not on our list and we cannot issue the refund because we did absolutely nothing for you and this is the cost for giving us all your information without receiving any service. 

I really do not want to believe that this is how a mental health care service works. Beyond disappointed.

I wish I could say I had a positive experience with this service but it only worsened my mental health. I signed up during a time of incredible stress and was repeatedly assigned to providers in the wrong state or who did not have my availability, despite speaking with NUMEROUS coordinators about the problem over the course of a full month. We messages back and forth on the app, through multiple support emails, and phone calls to customer service. I paid for five sessions and received zero despite spending more time than the sessions would have taken trying to correct the errors they made. When I communicated this for the last time I was told that what I paid was for the membership, not the services (which is absurd for a membership you HAVE TO MAKE WITH THE SOLE PURPOSE OF RECEIVING SERVICES) so I was not eligible to be refunded for what I spent. This feels like a manipulative and disrespectful policy that overall introduced new financial stress and added stress from all the effort I put forward.

I am in transition from one state to another and was looking for an emergency refill on my antidepressants as I only had insurance in the state I was leaving. 

This seemed like a great way to eliminate that need all together, so I downloaded and paid for my prescription. 

I spoke with someone about pricing and was advised of the monthly cost, which I was given the impression INCLUDED the cost of medication. I was advised it did not, and began to fear I wouldn‚Äôt be able to keep up with the expedited pricing but assessed I would keep it until I could no longer afford it. 

I had my first visit with the NP and she advised the cost of my medication was $29 (this was when I found out the cost of medication was not included in the price) and that it would continue at $29 for the next three months. (She only advised for $90 days and actually looked the information up).

Upon paying for my first prescription month, I received an email advising the refill price was $69. I immediately reached out to support as I had been advised otherwise. Support informed me that indeed the price ‚Äúhad gone up‚Äù and then tried to talk me into keeping it as that was ‚Äúless than most copays‚Äù I don‚Äôt know what copays y‚Äôall dealing with. But the most I‚Äôve ever had as a copay was $20 and my medication was never more than $20 

I advise you to save you money and look into insurance as most states that I‚Äôm aware of, offer free mental healthcare and medications.

Hello, the only reason I‚Äôm rating it 1/5 is because cerebral doesn‚Äôt accept my insurance, and it felt like it was more of a money grab thing then actual help. I shouldn‚Äôt have to give 200$ a month for a doctor to tell me, ‚Äúwe need to wait a month+ then talk to your primary care doctor before we can even actually discuss meds that will work.‚Äù If I come to you for help and I pay you for said help, I shouldn‚Äôt be told hey we need to wait 3 months at a rate of 200+ before I can actually give you the medication meant for someone with ADHD, after you‚Äôve already been diagnosed with ADHD. I was put on the same medication my primary doctor gave me, then told I had to wait a month+ before we could discuss anything else even when the medication wasn‚Äôt working. Plus, I don‚Äôt think I should pay for a service where you can‚Äôt have a meeting with a doctor in a month‚Äôs time, you are booked from October to December basically all the way through, so no doctors to prescribe or even listen to your words.

This is basically an $85/mo subscription to having a 5 minute prescription appointment every two months. These are not psychiatrists, but nurse practitioners. 

I cancelled a few days ago, and expected to be able to enjoy the rest of my subscription. I have a week left on my subscription at the time of writing this review. They apparently contacted my pharmacy this morning and changed my refill from costing its usual $15 to $130, despite the subscription supposedly still being active (never had insurance so no change there). They also removed my eligibility for future refills I was previously approved for. Luckily, my pharmacy was appalled and was able to discount it heavily this once. 

While I‚Äôm sure at least the refill part may be under some sort of policy, it seems very spiteful that they update the script into being nearly 9x the price the minute you cancel, making it effectively cheaper to trap you into keeping the service. 

Additionally, rather than being able to schedule your own appointments, you need to essentially ask permission from a third party or ‚Äúcare coordinator‚Äù, making it easy to delay or forget about scheduling. The ‚Äúcounseling‚Äù aspect is a joke. 

You are better off scheduling a telehealth visit every 3 months for your refills. If it‚Äôs cheaper than $250 a visit, you‚Äôre saving money. Or better yet, a real psychiatrist may even be cheaper. 

Not cool, cerebral.

The NP I scheduled time with to prescribe medication was wonderful. However, it was difficult to find a therapist to fit what I needed, on a schedule that worked for me. Once I did find a match, the therapist was 15 minutes late to our appointment without an apology. She did not wear headphones, which created an echo during our session. As a person with sensory issues, this was an issue for me and I did not want to pay for a service that was not helpful. The therapist was not kind and showed no desire to be helpful in any way. I reached out to cerebral to share my frustration and I‚Äôve not heard a response. I cancelled my service nearly immediately because the overall experience was frustrating and unprofessional. When canceling, you lose all access to the portal. So even though I paid for the month, I was then unable to secure access to any other sessions for that month. I reached out for help and a refund, without any response. I do not recommend this service or this company.

The first appointment I had such high hopes. I was very disappointed after. I was told prescriptions were $10. I was charged $20 for both. Which still isn‚Äôt terrible but not what I was told. Then when it came to get my refill. The medication I canceled a week prior was still filled and I was charged for. The mg for my second prescription was incorrect. When I tried to reach out no one answered my messages. When I called and actually got a team member, she got silent when she realized I was right. She couldn‚Äôt get off the phone fast enough. This was around 3:00pm. I then called back the next day around 1:00pm because still no one had reached out to me. This was completely unprofessional and I am currently trying to cancel and get my money back for the prescription that should have never been filled. Truly sad that people who are genuinely seeking help have to deal with issues such as these. I was looking for help, for assistance and support. I got none of that and wasted my money.

The weight loss division of this company is very new - staff turns over a lot and the company is disorganized. The customer service rep i spoke to said she is only allowed to point someone back to the app to post a question there, they don‚Äôt help anyone by phone with technical issues, billing issues, etc. The newest app version doesn‚Äôt work on an iPad. The app has MANY issues that the tech people can‚Äôt seem to fix. They emailed me to ask for help in reporting if problems continued. I don‚Äôt get paid to help them! Figure it out yourself. The lower paid staff is forced to deal with all issues and keep customers away from anyone of power, yet given no ability to fix anything - and it is all done by chat that takes 24-72 hours to return any message. They often procrastinate by dodging questions or complaints. The nurse practitioner and dieticians I‚Äôve had are amazing. This company has MANY areas to improve upon if this is going to work long term.

This is the first review I have ever left in 15 years of iPhone ownership. The application itself is excellent. The service, however, is not. I have had three unspecific cancellations and had to reschedule several weeks from the original appointment dates. And now, due to policy changes, prescribers are no longer able to prescribe effective medications. While I understand this change likely had to due with Federal law, this has been a completely unacceptable way of handling clients who have been with Cerebral prior to this change. I have had not one, but three cancellations that would have landed me far before the May 9th date of this policy change. It is unfair treatment and frankly unprofessional the way this was handled from the very beginning with the first cancellation that left me questioning Cerebral‚Äôs reliability. I was first left in the dark as to why the appointments were manually being overridden and cancelled and here today I am now suffering from this negligence. Stay away.

How in the world does this app have this many high reviews? This apps functionality is TERRIBLE. 

 Not only did I just get an email that my next medication has been ordered after only 2 weeks, (which, I told my care counselor that I wanted to talk to my prescriber), I can't even book a call with my prescriber. My next billing date isn‚Äôt even for another 1.5 weeks!!! And besides I should be checking in with my prescriber beforehand. There‚Äôs 0 follow up here, it‚Äôs only you yourself that has to book everything and even then, there‚Äôs no links to schedule! The app is completely useless to schedule anything and the person that messaged me told me to use your website instead which also doesn't work either. 

On top of that, there is no information regarding how or when I will get information about my insurance reimbursement. Your website states I'll get a check in the mail or something but somehow I highly doubt this will happen. Your system is absolutely broken. I also have no way to contact my prescriber, who is also not even part of the messaging system. 

Also why is there no option to cancel within the portal? You make it hard to not only schedule calls but also don't make anything else easy.

Don‚Äôt sign up for this. They do not care about you and as lovely as my counselor was, it‚Äôs clear she‚Äôs just following a script.

This is just a ridiculous scam to charge your credit card every chance they get. I‚Äôve had the provider not show to 2 appointments and they charged me for No Show $29 reschedule fee each time. WHAT?? I was there! I recorded it on my phone! I have actually time-stamped proof that I was waiting. Then I emailed support and got back several ridiculous roboresponses. ‚ÄúSorry you missed your appointment‚Äù I DIDN‚ÄôT!  I said I would like to change my provider. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre sorry you are cancelling your service‚Äù. WHAT? I said I wanted to YOU TO CHANGE THE PROVIDER. 
Then my providers are like in a strange dark closet or I‚Äôm looking at the top of their heads like I‚Äôm FaceTiming my grandpa. And to put the icing on this cake- my card was JUST charged for ‚Äúservices from 2021‚Äù! 3 different charges! HUH??? UM- SCAM MUCH?? That was it for me! Maybe they need to understand that they are dealing with people that have mental illnesses and actually consider how difficult seeking help actually is for us and maybe care like they claim. Such a disappointment.

I was assigned a prescriber who I haven‚Äôt been able to book an appointment with for 6 months, all of course while they continued to charge me monthly, so I‚Äôve paid for 6 months of service I haven‚Äôt received, and on top of that the customer service I‚Äôve received in regards to this has been horrific, they‚Äôve taken zero responsibility and operate without any ethics or accountability. Top of that off, when I needed sign off to begin another treatment because of the lack of treatment from Cerebral, my provider (who I‚Äôve never spoken to because he doesn‚Äôt have ANY availability, confirmed by my care coordinator who checked and then did not attempt to provide me with a new prescriber) refuses to sign off on the new treatment, so my care is basically being held hostage by a prescriber I‚Äôve never met, and who knows essentially nothing about me, and he refuses to provide a reason for not signing off on the new treatment. On paper this is a fantastic service, in practice, it‚Äôs horrific.

The psychiatrist that I met with was rude and short with me and made me cry both times I had an appointment with her. She dismissed all of my concerns, diagnosed me as ADHD and then acted like there was something wrong with me when I didn‚Äôt wanna take the same medication that I had been given before that did not work for me. She made it seem like I should be grateful that she had even prescribed strattera which gave me hives and I had an allergic reaction to. She then wanted to diagnose something else in the same family of medicines. All the while I‚Äôm paying out of pocket for these trial and error medication and they are unable to prescribe anything else aside from Strattera and Wellbutrin. The ads on Facebook made it sound like you could in fact get other medication if you were diagnosed as having ADHD and that in fact they could even come to your door. This could not be further from the truth. Do not waste your time or money and now I‚Äôm having a difficult time canceling the subscription.

Make sure you‚Äôve reviewed all plans prior to purchasing. Otherwise any promotional pricing is invalid. In my first intake appointment my care provider told me to switch my account, and the plan change is considered an ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù and is no longer available to receive the promotional pricing‚Ä¶ even though I just purchased the app plan only days prior and didn‚Äôt receive any counseling. It is truly a corporate disservice to any first time user in the cerebral app. If the first selected plan is not fitting for the patient, you will then be charged two and a half times the advertised rate on top of being charged for the first month. All while having received no mental health aide, as requested i.e. I paid $30 ‚Äúfor one month‚Äù and after one day I am told that in order to receive any service I now have to pay an additional $259. Great app concept. Flawed and dishonest payment system.

I had the service for a month. I was charged $325 but only saw a therapist twice. Not worth it at all but Okay whatever, I let them keep the money. I first called about canceling my service and was told they do not do that over the phone. So I sent an email, they replied with an automated message that said I needed to fill out a cancellation form. I have now sent multiple emails and filled out multiple forms but cerebral will not stop attempting to take another $325 from my card. My card has been locked for weeks and it‚Äôs causing a great inconvenience for me as I have other things on automatic payment and the due dates are approaching. I called my credit card company and they are unable to block the charges. Stay away from this company, they have horrible customer service and will not stop trying to steal from you if you ask to have your service discontinued. I have been more than patient. Reporting them to the BBB after this review.

I was with this company for over a year and had nothing but constant issues. 

I was assigned a new provider and I spoke with her twice telling her that my current medication was working well and I didn‚Äôt want to adjust it. 2 months later she decided to drastically drop the dosage of my medication without speaking with some or even notifying me!! The only reason I sound out is because I running low on the meds and looked at the bottle to see it was a drastically different prescription. 2 weeks of trying to get the issue resolved I get told that she did that on purpose and wanted to speak with me. Ummm no! I will not speak with someone who is rude, unprofessional and negligent at best. And they told me ‚Äú sorry for any miscommunication we can set you up with a different provider‚Äù That‚Äôs a no. My issues was downplayed and not resolved. I will find a company that think ‚Äú I‚Äôm sorry‚Äù is an appropriate resolution to a major issue and who actually cares. 

Screw this man. Not worth it.

I signed up for the talk therapy package which was $99 a month. The app kept having bugs where it would not except my insurance card or my ID or my facial recognition. Blue Cross Blue Shield was listed in the insurance accepted but after I purchased my plan they told me to scan in my insurance card, however the scanner didn‚Äôt work so I emailed it to them and then they told me they don‚Äôt accept it. Because I couldn‚Äôt get the app to work properly and because all of a sudden they didn‚Äôt take my insurance I went to cancel. They quickly told me they will not refund my money even though I did not use any services. The app pretends you can select the type of counselor you want but they only gave me one choice no matter what options I chose. They overpromise and under deliver and have their contracts wired tight to keep your money. The irony is this is an app that supposed to make you less stressed but it added to my stress. Do not waste your money do not fall for their tricks.

First of all every single package is over priced, i did the $85 a month package & basically all that includes is a physician to prescribe you medication, you also have someone called a ‚Äúcare counselor‚Äù which basically asks you how you‚Äôre doing on your medicine & that is it. You‚Äôre paying $85 a month for someone to give you medicine which the monthly payment does not include your medicine nor do they warn you how much your medicine is before they take it out of your account. Lastly it took them almost a whole month to simply cancel my subscription & delete my account & I was assured that I would not be charged again, they FINALLY cancelled my account & then charged me 2 days after for the full $85, after I reached out to them to express how I was told I wouldn‚Äôt be charged and needed a refund they said it would take 1-2 business days until I got that refund & its 5 business days later & I still haven‚Äôt received that refund, not worth it to even try.

I signed up because their website said they accepted my insurance. Except they don‚Äôt allow users to check insurance before charging them. After I paid then I am informed that they don‚Äôt take my insurance. But I decided to give it a try anyway. So I set my appointment. I found someone to watch my kids, rearranged my schedule, and logged in 5 min early as instructed. I waited until 12 min after my appointment time before finally leaving the call because the clinician never logged in. 

I tried to contact support and I received a form email of ‚ÄúI'm sorry to hear that you've decided to discontinue receiving mental health services from Cerebral.‚Äù I can‚Äôt discontinue a service that was never provided in the first place. All in all it has been a poor experience and I just would like my money back so that I can find a provider that will help me. But I‚Äôm sure I will have to fight to get my money back. 

This company doesn‚Äôt care about mental health they only care about money.

I am very dissatisfied with the level of care I have received from Cerebral. I came to Cerebral because I need help with my ADHD that is severally impacting my life and I have not been able to receive my medication because I cannot get the doctor to move my prescription to another pharmacy. This should be an easy fix, yet time and time again I cannot get in touch with the provider to make this change. It has been months now and it is extremely frustrating and debilitating when taking the first step just to make this appointment was extremely difficult for me. If Cerebral is unable to provide a decent level of care they should not be working in the mental health care space.  I am requesting immediate assistance or at the very least a refund for the months I have been paying without receiving help. 

If not I will be force to take legal action because to me honest, dealing with this whole ordeal has been mentally traumatic for me and a great waste of time and resources.

I‚Äôve been stuck behind ID verification for months and cannot access the portal to cancel. Cerebral has continued to charge me. When reaching out to customer support, they offer me a discount for future services, and say they can give me $100 in refund (out of $420+) ‚Äúas an exception‚Äù. They claim because they‚Äôre a subscription service, I had access and therefore cannot get a refund. They claim ‚Äúmental healthcare tends to go at a different pace for everyone as some clients use our services daily while others choose to use them more sparingly‚Äù. I never had access to any services, and I definitely had no ‚Äúchoice‚Äù to use it sparingly. 

I‚Äôve tried multiple venues of customer service to no avail. They are making me work very hard and this is definitely not fit for someone with ADHD, and is preying off of ‚Äúclients‚Äù. 

If someone on the cerebral team is reading this, please help me resolve this.

I really loved this program. But the moment I switched to a different provider that was covered by my insurance I stopped my service. When I needed to tell my new doctor the medication that I was prescribed by the provider on here all my information is gone. I am being asked questions like how many milligrams exct.. I was taking and I could not give an answer! Mind you I was prescribed meds that can not just be stopped or I will experience severe withdrawal symptoms! I couldn‚Äôt even find the providers name anymore! I looked completely delusional!  I reached out to customer service and have not heard anything back I am absolutely disgusted not only for the unprofessional actions but for the facts they made me look an absolute fool! I promise this is the review that should really make you think is the price for this horrible service worth it? Do they care about your well-being or your money? You can find better and more effective services else where!!!

TLDR: they make cancelling impossible and won‚Äôt answer the phone and then won‚Äôt give a full refund. Call your bank and block them as soon as you cancel. 

I tried this app out mostly because they did a great job marketing and my ADHD doesn‚Äôt do well with focusing enough to find someone on my own. The monthly subscription doesn‚Äôt actually cover anything but their service of connecting to someone which ended up being more than I was willing to pay in the long run. Cancelling is next to impossible though. I went through the process but it took them months to stop pulling money from my account. I finally had to call my bank and block their withdrawal. When I called to get the months back that I had cancelled, they tried to give me a 30% refund instead of a full refund. Honestly the app isn‚Äôt a bad idea overall but the company is scummy, especially considering their trying to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù the mental health community.

This app is great if you are struggling and need medication quick. The providers and care professionals are great at listening. The customer service through the app is absolutely horrible. You can only communicate through messaging there is no number to call. The person responsible for responding to messages only responds once a day so it‚Äôs difficult to get help if there is an issue with medication or your plan. Im happy I downloaded it to get me on medication I desperately needed, but i will be canceling and going to an actual doctor because this app is HORRIBLE. UPDATED : To say YOU CANNOT CANCEL YOUR SUBSCRIPTION. Every single time you click ‚Äúchange membership plan‚Äù it says ‚Äúan unforseen error has occurred ‚Äú i have been trying to change my plan for months. There is no ‚Äú unforseen error‚Äù THATS JUST WHAT CEREBRAL WANTS YOU TO THINK. The only way you can change your plan is by messaging them and getting the round about why you shouldnt. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE APP RUN!!!!

Cerebral was too good to be true when it came around and it took me a while to realize how it was another money making scam. The physicians cancel appts at the last minute , without offering any new appt dates in sight. The whole health model is planned and executed so poorly, a lot is left to be desired. You ll be left stranded for a month or two with no medication refills . Also there is no physician patient relationship , the care team is very helpless in conveying problems to physician and coming up with solutions . You ll be paying out of your pocket month after month for no services at all. And if you cancel , they immediately stop all access but will still find reasons to charge for the upcoming month without letting you use any service. Most of the physicians I have seen have left cerebral , and it is evident that this whole image they have created is flawed on so many levels . It‚Äôs a big money making scam.

I really wanted to love Cerebral. I got a feeling when it wouldn‚Äôt tell me if insurance covered the service until I paid, but continued on. Met with a prescriber who confirmed all of my symptoms. Didn‚Äôt really give and danced around a diagnosis. I was prescribed psychiatric meds and told to give it a month. That‚Äôs fine. Then I met with a care counselor. Both of them assured me the other could fill out some paperwork needed for my job to allow me to stay working from home. I sent the forms over and almost a week later got the response that the prescriber doesn‚Äôt have the necessary ‚Äúexpertise‚Äù to fill out said paperwork and I should seek in person treatment. If they don‚Äôt have enough expertise to sign a form confirming what I filled out, do they have the expertise to prescribe drugs that could cause me to become suicidal? I‚Äôm not sure. I have taken my care coordinators suggestion and switch my appointments to in person treatment with an actual psychologist.

Overall very disappointed with this service . I was really upset that no one bothered to tell me I would be charged for the medication they sent, I thought it was included in plan until I noticed a random charge from this app. I felt like the medication appointment was strange and my counselor had no idea what I was taking when I met with her. I was more asked what do I want instead of determined what I need. 

When I got to my first appointment with the counselor she called me instead of doing a video call. This was incredibly uncomfortable and I felt I in no way could find connection like this with the counselor. The meeting in general felt stale and scripted like she was reading off one question after the other. 

Come to cancelling.. what a PROCESS 
You have to email them for one guy to email you to send a link to a form asking why you‚Äôre cancelling in different ways, then you email him back to wait for someone else to get back to you and try to convince you not to cancel for a discount ( instead of offering discounts automatically maybe you should determine why people are cancelling so much that you have to offer them!), 
I am still waiting for that response, what a stressful process.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the nurse and counselor were both very nice but the structure makes you feel like a number and not like they truly care about your mental health.

My experience with cerebral has only been infuriating. The provider I had rescheduled my initial appointment twice, without notification. Then she called me an hour before my scheduled appointment wanting to see me then. I was at work and couldn‚Äôt just drop everything in that moment. Absolutely no consideration for my time. So time for my appointment, I click on the link for our video appointment. She doesn‚Äôt answer. Instead she calls me again. Whatever. Her kids are SCREAMING in the background. She talks over me, very condescendingly, and doesn‚Äôt listen to a word I say until I yell at her to shut up and listen to me. Then to top things off her fire alarm goes off. Who knows why. So I end up finding a provider in my area. I cancelled my subscription last month only to find they have charged me again yesterday. When I contact support, they send me the form to cancel again. I ALREADY CANCELED!!! Stop taking my money! Stay away, folks! Not worth the hassle.

I was at first incredibly surprised  at how quickly I received assistance and a prescription for my severe anxiety. Then, after almost a month, I attempted to contact them again because I needed a refill. I was told that because I had failed to enter in payment information that I could not receive a refill and that I needed to update it. Unfortunately, there is no where for a person to enter payment information on either the site or the app. And now I‚Äôm 3 days overdue for a refill and no one has helped at all. All I get is responses back saying that the issue is ‚Äúbeing worked on‚Äù but there‚Äôs clearly zero accountability or concern about the Wheatley and we‚Äôll being of patients placed on SSRIs and then suddenly being forced to stop due to this company‚Äôs complete lack of adherence understanding OR any real customer assistance. You are screwing with people‚Äôs mental health, stability and, frankly, their lives. 
I‚Äôm so furious that I cannot think straight.

I don‚Äôt trust this company at all. They offered a special for the first month in their own website for $7/week for the first month. When you go to check out, they charge you $30. When I called and questioned the fact that $7 * 4 weeks in a month is $28, they first replied that they were aware of the error and ‚Äúreached out‚Äù to have it fixed as though it was another company‚Äôs website that had an error. In addition, after not signing up, I have gotten over a dozen emails and texts within 2 days still offering the same $7/week. At one point while contacting them, they tried to explain it away by saying that some months have more than 4 weeks. Honestly, if they can‚Äôt do simple math and quickly fix pricing errors on their own website and various other communications and make up fake reasons to justify their errors, I would not trust them to not overbill your criedit/debit card or your insurance.

Therapy only plan: therapist was good. The app and ‚Äòexercises‚Äô in the app are very inadequate for actual self-help. There are books out there that do a much better job. Talk to therapist in real time 45 minutes once a week. Care coordinator the rest of the time. Must give 24 hours to respond so no real-time help. If you say negative about them on Facebook, they will block you even if honest review. My experience would be to find a better, more in-depth service to help with therapy needs. 

App has about three sections total: care-coordinator chat, plan information (scheduling therapy and stuff) and exercises. They text you and call a lot telling you to make an appointment even if you have a standing one. Their program cancelled my appointment once and was told it was an insurance issue-I was self paying so not sure what was going on with that. 

Don‚Äôt expect a lot of resourced with this company.

I had some issues during Covid and needed to talk to someone in a timely fashion so I downloaded this app, it was great, except the focus was on medication and not therapy. I had one therapist appointment a month and could not increase them even if I wanted to Pay the extra to increase. So when therapy opened up in my area I switched over. I attempted to cancel, I did everything as instructed, after multiple phone calls I still have not been canceled. I first called and was instructed that I had to send an email, I sent said email I am still waiting for cancellation. In the meantime I‚Äôve been charged every month for three months following, and have received medication that I am not taking due to the side effects. Because of this I am extremely disappointed. You shouldn‚Äôt have to jump through hoops to cancel. If I wanna cancel just freaking cancel it! Stop playing games it‚Äôs not a good look!

i did therapy & medication for about a month then stopped back in march because i could not afford it. nothing against the care team i loved them all but simply couldn't afford it. i just checked my bank account because i was trying to pay my car payment and had worked extremely long hours to be able to afford it. i had gotten charged $325 and it took the money i was going to use to pay my payment out after not being active for 2 months. i tried canceling and was not able to 2 MONTHS ago. now i'm here extremely upset because i can't pay my car payment and they put me in such a bad situation. i called to try to talk to someone but their hours are a completely different time zone. i repeat i have not done any therapy or have been able to pick up medication as it was too expensive. i've tried to wait for medicare to come in so i can be able to use it but then this happened.

This is my second try with Cerebral and it was just as disappointing as the first. Upon reactivating my account and providing my payment information it would not let me proceed with any scheduling, said to contact support. 
After contacting support they gave generic tips, the only one that worked was opening the webpage in incognito mode browser on a PC, the app was not functional. I was able to schedule 1 of 2 appointments but it still gave me an error scheduling a care counselor. 
I reached out to support again and they assigned me a counselor of their choosing and booked me a 7am weekday appointment. I reached back out and requested that I be able to choose my own provider and appointment time but they advised that was not an option. 
This has been a complete waste of time. I should have gone with my gut and avoided them after my first sub par experience, my mistake. I would not recommend this app or this company to anyone struggling with mental illness.

Cerebral is a huge scam. I paid $85 a month every month for 4 months waiting for an appointment to be available. Once I finally got the appointment and received a diagnosis (which was completely different than the diagnosis I received by a professional I was meeting with in person) I was told medication was called into my local pharmacy and went there twice only to be told they had nothing for me, that nothing had ever been submitted. This went on for an additional 3 months.
