Once I finally had enough and I sent an email requesting my account be canceled, it took days to get a response and they make you jump through hoops to cancel. Once I finally received a response I was told I still owed $85 for my last month‚Äôs service and was told if I did not pay they would send me to collections. This is a scam and they should be ashamed of taking advantage of people looking for help with their mental health. Save your money and go somewhere else.

I was prescribed adhd meds which were very new to me, yet they saw no reason to meet to renew the meds with me or go over how the meds were working/not working. I requested a new provider since my provider wanted to meet 2 months later and i had to go through cerebral to get them to remind her to refill my prescription.  I requested a new provider to which they scheduled another appointment that i didnt even confirm. 4 months into this, i tried to ask for at least a 2 month refund, since that is when the service that i was paying for actually stopped being given to me, and they allowed me to cancel but didnt even refund me. So i paid for 2 months without anything to show for it. Terrible medical help, i would not recommend this app! My relationship suffered so much because of the meds and i didn‚Äôt even get a provider to help mw figure out different meds. *****DONT USE CEREBRAL.*****

I started cerebral a few months ago after a traumatic event. At first, it seemed simple enough and I felt like I was getting a lot of care. As months went on, I‚Äôve had to deal with several app and server issues. I was locked out of my account, all my prescriber + counseling appointments were wiped from the schedule, my prescription was never sent, my care coordinator has been MIA for weeks, etc. It sounds like they‚Äôre still working on backend issues both technologically and operationally. It‚Äôs too much to deal with unstable mental health care, when I am TRYING to get stable. I called Cerebral for a 1-month refund when I was locked out of my account for a month and didn‚Äôt receive services; I had to fight to get a refund for care I never received! I‚Äôve never missed a payment and all of my info is up to date. My iOS + app are also all up to date, so this was all entirely on Cerebral. Not a fan, no longer a patient.

I was very interested in this service as I am very busy but struggle with anxiety and depression. They charged $99 for the first month(which I thought was good for an app)... I had one 45 minute conversation after 2 weeks with zero goals set or anything. I scheduled another appointment and in the mean time was charged another $197. I informed them that I thought the service was $99 and I was no longer interested, they cancelled my membership but refused to issue a refund and cancelled all my scheduled appointments but informed me I could still use their platform. Why would you charge me $197, cancel my appointments but then tell me I can use the app for the rest of the month? Doesn't make sense and for being concerned about mental health they certainly have no issues charging money  for doing literally NOTHING, and then subsequently refusing refunds (within 24 hours of charge). This app is lame and their customer service is poor at best.

Please, please save yourself, your time, and your mental health and use Circle Medical or something. I can guarantee that most positive reviews of this website is fake. 

They charge an exorbinant fee (hundreds of dollars EVERY MONTH),and most likely don't accept your insurance (but won't tell you that until you've entered the contract). Oh, you say, but if I just do medication management, that's only $80 a month? You will never see that medication, my friend. ADHD, Depression, Anxiety, whatever. You will never see it, or it'll take two months to process through your insurance (oh, it usually takes two weeks! They say, although most providers commonly only take 48 hours). 

The care team is unhelpful and condescending, customer support is the same, and the doctors are nice but you won't be able to get an appointment more than once or twice every few months. This website just wants your money. Run. There is no sticking it out.

I was advised by a counselor with Cerebral to look into speaking with a therapist through their services. when I did as was recommended I saw a list of the different plans they offered with no prices listed and end up getting charged $175 without ever confirming a purchase when I was just trying to look up the information. I overdrafted in my bank account which now as a result of that has added an additional $72 in fees, won‚Äôt have the money for gas to get to work, and currently have no food whatsoever. That money was for groceries. I‚Äôm trying to fight the fraudulent charges through my bank but won‚Äôt have any money for 6 days at the earliest. Because of Cerebral I now won‚Äôt be able to eat for 6-8 days!!! I won‚Äôt be able to get to work for a week and probably will lose my job! All because I was trying to get help with mental health. Thanks Cerebral, you guys have really helped me a lot!!!

This experience with cerebral only elevated my anxiety. First off, my care provider prescribed the incorrect dose of my prescription. After my first month, I received an email that my prescription was no longer available for home delivery. Fine. But then I could not get in touch with my care provider for weeks after this notification to move my prescription to a pharmacy. When I finally got in touch with my care team, they cryptically assigned another provider and offered a ‚Äúsmall discount‚Äù for the invoice. Ok. But then my new provider informed me that she could not prescribe me the correct dose despite the original provider having the correct dose in her notes, and on top of that she informed me that the pharmacy I chose might not be able to fill my prescription without offering alternatives. Long story short I received one month of care despite paying for 4 months of this service and I am infuriated.

This program is spammy. You are not made aware what comes with the package you are buying until after you have been charged. When you agree to their terms and conditions you are apparently also agreeing to zero refunds but they may be willing to give you a whopping $7.50 back instead of the $25 they charge you and that‚Äôs if you cancel within hours of being signed up! The only way I could get logged in to be found to cancel was to finish setting up the account. Once you are cancelled, they immediately cancel all appointments you have, that by the way, have basically no availability for a month, out meaning you get absolutely nothing for the ‚Äúservice‚Äù but more headache that the process is worth. To be clear, I reached out to them and expressed this to them before I wrote this review. Thanks for making seeking mental health more stressful Cerebral!

Paid for a therapy plan then got switched to a different plan when I added my insurance. It wasn‚Äôt clear that my plan would be changed by just adding my insurance. After that, they canceled my therapy session and booked me a prescriber that didn‚Äôt really do anything other than ask me the same questions in the original questionnaire. So I was charged for a month even though I got literally nothing out of it and can‚Äôt even get into the system to at least use for the month I already paid for.

This app was a horrible experience for me. I am at a real breaking point with my mental health and needed to get on medication. First of all the app is super glitchy and does not work half the time, I have no problems with any other app on my phone. Secondly they are horrible at communication. I set up my first prescriber appointment and they did not show up. I finally got an appointment where they actually showed up on the video call and I was told that she basically wasn‚Äôt qualified to prescribe the medication I needed and that she would set me up an appointment with a new prescriber who could. She said it would be within  48 hrs and I went a week without hearing anything. Still haven‚Äôt heard anything. I keep messaging my care counselor and don‚Äôt hear anything back. I ended up cancelling my subscription today and thankfully I only spent 30 dollars since I never was really able to get the process started.

I had one meeting where they told me their care works best when you‚Äôre medicated. I don‚Äôt prefer that. They wouldn‚Äôt sign a paper for my school indicating I have ADD but they wanted to prescribe me. Once I said no, she told me she didn‚Äôt feel comfortable signing the paper‚Ä¶. Odd. You don‚Äôt want to indicate I have ADD but you‚Äôll give me meds for it? Seemed like she didn‚Äôt want me to get what I came for and was scared I‚Äôd want to cancel afterwards. Instead, I tried to cancel because they had unethical practices and then after I emailed their cancellation email, TWICE they still charged me $83 the next month. I paid $30 + $83 for ONE session. And nope, NO REFUNDS DESPITE IF YOU USE THE SERVICES OR NOT. Still dealing with cancellation. I am a college student who‚Äôs suffering financially. I chose cerebral because they were ‚Äúaffordable‚Äù but now it‚Äôs just a nightmare I keep having to deal with. 
All I wanted was a refund after that experience.

Cerebral honestly sucked after my provider was removed. It hurt me more than it helped. I came to the app when it was new, with the help of my mom. There weren‚Äôt many ways to contact anyone for help and my provider was switched without my knowledge. When I sent an email for help, I got little to none and I couldn‚Äôt switch my provider back to who I felt comfortable with. In my email, I stated I wouldn‚Äôt be using the app and wanted to cancel. My mom has been paying $86 for about a year and was told we didn‚Äôt try to cancel prior to to receive payment for the months I did not use this app. Although I did and have the email to prove it, I‚Äôve decided to leave this review to help those who may be skeptical on using the app. I say, if you like surprises on your account/plan, or surprises taken out your account after asking for cancelation then absolutely.

They are predatory. They make it extremely difficult to cancel your account. They need to ‚Äúapprove‚Äù your cancellation. Until some random staff member approves it (which could take forever), they will continue to charge you. If this happens to you, make a complaint with the BBB and contact your attorney generals office. Take screenshots of all communications with this company so you can dispute the charges with your credit card company if they continue to charge you. So far, I‚Äôve been told they have ‚Äúreceived my cancellation form‚Äù but it must be reviewed. Until that happens, my account is active. They do this purposely to try to scam as many people out of every last dollar that they can. There are dozens and dozens of horrible reviews about this company‚Äôs awful tactics. Numerous news outlets have already run stories about their deceptive practices as well. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT SIGN UP. Save yourself the headache.

The idea behind this is brilliant.  I was very optimistic and anxious to try this.  After my first appointment with a subscriber they told me I would need to go to someone else.  So I basically wasted 30 minutes with this person.  They told me they would send a link to make an appointment ASAP with my new person.  They never sent the link.  So I had to reach out and of course no responses in my app messages.  I finally got a hold of someone and they emailed me a link to pick a date.  He‚Äôs booked through November!  Yet they charge monthly!  This means I‚Äôm paying monthly but don‚Äôt even get to talk to anyone for 2 months.  This is unacceptable.  I have sent an email to cancel and I‚Äôm sure that will take days to get a response.  Very disappointing.  Buyers be aware. It‚Äôs obvious they were doing things right before and they outsourced which is what good companies always do to save money once they gain a great reputation and clientele.

I decided to try this app because therapy is expensive and this seemed like a good option to try. All is good at first unless you want to make any changes at all. My therapist option isn‚Äôt a good fit for me because I‚Äôm a female and was hoping for a female therapist.  Are there other options? No?!  I‚Äôve emailed to change my therapist and/ or ask for a refund since I haven‚Äôt used their services yet but no response yet. Oh and canceling your account? Well, you have to send an email and then they send you a form and then they have to approve your request. This is infuriating. Bye-bye almost $500 for nothing. seriously just run and don‚Äôt try this app. The creators of this app saw an opportunity to make money and are taking advantage of people who need help. This app should not be available here and this company is a scam. 

I‚Äôll update this after I actually get help.

So I joined a day ago and I can‚Äôt even navigate the app? There no way to go back to providers schedules to change an appointment or provider. you end up contacting support who just makes you an appointment weeks out with no regard to if it works for your schedule?! Then they address me in emails by my maiden name with  is odd since I never even gave them that information? I‚Äôm also supposed to get charged a fee of $7 per week for the first month yet they charged me $30 .and I can‚Äôt even get an appointment for 2 weeks!? That means I pay $60 for nothing since I can‚Äôt even see a prescriber. 

Not impressed. I just emailed them on how to cancel my subscription and get a refund. Now I wait to see how hard this will be? The funny thing is they ask about your anxiety level in the app. Well thanks to this program my anxiety is at an all time high!

Everyone seems to have great reviews so I tried Cerebral actually in recommendation of a doctor in my town.  First really easy to sign up‚Ä¶ then he‚Äôll for me.  I had to schedule one appointment first then answer questions about everything then had me schedule appointment again cancelling the other.  Then started to receive emails stating I cancelled last appointment and needed to reschedule.  So I attempted to call in to fix it since the system wouldn‚Äôt recognize my insurance.  Call in and get an automated system telling me to email support with card.  Emailed support no answer for three days finally called again on the day I was supposed to be scheduled for my appointment and cancelled finding out they don‚Äôt take insurance in my state even thought states they can do controlled substances with insurance.  Then get billed the next day for a completed session that never happened and refused to refund me‚Ä¶

Both my wife and I have been using Cerebral for about 6 months now, and getting our prescribed medications from them is ALWAYS a nightmare. First, we are bounced around between therapists and psychiatrists because they are constantly leaving the service. When that happens, you are scheduled for another appointment 1-2 weeks out. This process repeats weekly and sometimes even every few days, to the point where both my wife and I have gone unmedicated for a month now, because we keep getting rescheduled. If you DO manage to get your prescription, they automatically enroll you to have them shipped to you from a pharmacy in New York, and you have to speak to your psychiatrist directly to request a refill. An extremely inconvenient service that frankly feels like a weird scam, and treats people with mental challenges as less than human. Basically cattle.

If everything remains steady, Cerebral‚Äôs OK.  If you change anything, it all falls apart and no one will help.  After moving to a new state, Cerebral changed me to a provider with no availability for over a month.  Messages to my care coordinator took nearly a week to get a response, and the response was giving me the same provider with the same lack of availability.  Calls to customer service weren‚Äôt answered.  If they won‚Äôt even respond to you and can‚Äôt give you an available provider, what are you paying for? Not worth it.

UPDATE:
As requested in a response to this review from Molly V., ‚ÄúCerebral Coordinator‚Äù, I called Cerebral to speak with her at 11:30 am PT on a Tuesday. After waiting on hold for 12 minutes, I was not able to get through to ANYONE (let alone Molly V.) and was told to leave a message that they would get back to within 24 hours, longer over weekends. See my point, Molly?

Cerebral is trash psychology. Once they have your credit card number they make it impossible to cancel your account. 

In fact, canceling your account is not even an option on their app or website. When I asked my psychologist & customer service how to cancel they ignored my messages & never replied. I had to google how to cancel it.

Cerebral never helped me with my insomnia. One psychologist made a bunch of promises & I never heard from him again. Another psychologist would speak to me for barely 15 minutes everytime & he kept pushing pills. When I kept refusing his pills, he would get upset, and would be very rude to me. 

Psychology should find solutions to issues someone is having not push pills just to numb a person and give them side effects. I was suffering insomnia, they blamed stress, & it wasn‚Äôt stress at all. My hormones were out of balance 

I canceled my account. They wrote back ‚Äúsorry to see you go.‚Äù 2 weeks later they charged my account again & kept my account active. I‚Äôm now canceling a 2nd time & they wrote back ‚ÄúOh we‚Äôre sorry, we do have you on record for canceling but we may not give you a refund.

Don‚Äôt worry you crooks, I‚Äôve already contacted my credit card, thus will be disputed, & I will get a refund!

I had the medication and care counseling package. I was supposed to meet with both my care counselor and psychologist at least once a month. I only met my counselor once total throughout my entire time as a member which lasted a few months. My psychologist was good, she was patient and gentle in providing care. Lastly, I cancelled my subscription and didn't use any services in the last month of service and I was denied a refund. They said it was because of the policy but it's flawed, I shouldn't have to pay for something I didn't use. The app itself works great, it's efficient  and easy to use. Overall this service isn't as good as advertised. While it is affordable, the quality of service still isn't worth the price.

I created an account for cerebral because I has suffering from anxiety and depression and no real therapists or psychologists were taking any patients near me. I‚Äôve been a member since September 2021. I‚Äôve had one appointment with the nurse and counselor and I am unable to get a follow up appointment because there is no availability and I can‚Äôt get a refill for my medicine. I tried contacting cerebral by the chat feature which is useless because all my messages are ignored, email, and calling the number which is also useless because no one answers the phone. Cerebral has made my condition worse by treating me this way and I still pay $85 a month for them to ignore me. The only instance where someone reached out to me is because my card didn‚Äôt go through one month. They only care about you for your money. These people are sick. It‚Äôs no wonder they have an F rating on Better Business Bureau.

I had a great first visit with my provider and had high hopes. She even called me back to suggest a different medication than she had originally suggested. I was so impressed! She said the medicine I needed to feel
Better would be to my door in 3-5 days. 

One week later it still hadn‚Äôt shipped. I emailed my coordinator and had to write a couple times to get an answer. They had a computer issue and my order was never placed. After losing a week I was frustrated. They reordered my meds and left one off so I had to email again. 

Once the order was set she said I should have it in 5-7 days. What happened to 3-5? 5 days later there was STILL no tracking. I messaged again. They had no idea what happened. I asked if we could have it sent it my local Cvs. And they finally  did that. It cost $10 for two prescriptions from CVS and I was already charged $30 from Cerebral. 

I emailed the cancel account email and communications dropped off Friday afternoon and I haven‚Äôt heard back since they asked me to just chose a different provider. I still don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm getting my refund of If  I‚Äôm being charged for this month. This experience has been laughably horrible. Just call someone local. This service has more kinks than someone with anxiety can stomach.

This company doesn‚Äôt do anything to make mental health better. In fact, all they‚Äôve done is make things worse. I‚Äôve tried for weeks to get a hold of somebody and have gotten nothing but the run around. I can‚Äôt get onto the app or the website and all o keep getting told us to send an email or call a number. When you call the number, you be told to‚Ä¶.you guessed it,‚Ä¶SEND AN EMAIL! What a joke. Even the person on here will probably tell me the same thing. How sorry they are, here‚Äôs my generic number that you‚Äôve probably already called ten times, where you‚Äôll be directed to send an email that will get you nowhere. At this point these people have my debit card number and I have no way I getting to it to remove it, and I have no way of canceling. I have emailed their cancellation email too like they‚Äôve suggested. So now they are stealing my money. This is FRAUD! And they need to be reported.

WORST customer service ever. When searching for mental health services you don‚Äôt want the provider adding to the anxiety. That being said, I joined & made an appt & took time off from work, only to have Cerebral cancel my appt due to ‚Äòunforeseeable circumstances‚Äô that started a chain of mishaps as I couldn‚Äôt reach anyone by phone (the outgoing message just kept looping and replaying) I messaged my care coordinator and it took hrs and days to hear back. It‚Äôs like no one took the time to read my concerns and it felt like i was getting automated responses. All my contact was thru their messaging, not getting a live person to speak to.  Such a disappointment, I would NEVER recommend this service, or actually lack of service and really poor customer service. The whole point of Cerebral is to assist with mental health, they made it worse by the  lackadaisical attitude. Do not waste your money.  
 Natasha

I‚Äôve had pretty big issues with no being able to schedule my appointments on the app due to not seeing any availability for my provider. This means I have to call in to set appointments and if that was all I wouldn‚Äôt mind but the customer service is pretty bad for a 85 dollar a month subscription. I have had my prescriptions just not sent in and contacted my care coordinator, emailed, and called and have had no response other than ‚Äúwe will work on it‚Äù for a few days. I have had appointments cancelled pretty last minute and reminder notifications not sent. Other than that the whole process of getting prescribed is easy and convenient but if you have any issues after it is difficult to get a response.

I was so excited for this app. I‚Äôve needed help for some time now and haven‚Äôt been able to find an affordable, accessible option. With the discounted first month, I thought I‚Äôd give it a try! However, they make you pay before anything else. So I wasn‚Äôt able to see that their next available appointments aren‚Äôt for over a month. By the time I get to speak with a real person, I‚Äôll have paid over $120 out of pocket. The first month discount is a complete SCAM. 

I tried reaching out to customer service, looking for some guidance or a refund in the least, but no response. I tried to cancel my plan for next month, but there‚Äôs no way to do so. I feel so frustrated and upset. I‚Äôm using this app because I don‚Äôt have the money to spare in the first place. I just want my money back..

I never write reviews, but people who need therapy don‚Äôt deserve to go through this additional stress.

I enjoyed my time with this company and did help me with the right steps until I wanted to cancel my service. When I decided to switch to my primary provider and cancel this service. It took about almost TWO MONTHS! Just to cancel. Not to mention I kept getting attempt charges on my server even though customer service keeps saying ‚Äúit‚Äôs scheduled to cancel‚Äù. The amount of spam emails you get saying your service is scheduled to cancel is absolutely ridiculous. When you email them, they give you steps on how to cancel in your account profile. However, when you attempt to do it yourself that ‚Äúcancel button‚Äù doesn‚Äôt appear. To this point I haven‚Äôt even received a cancellation confirmation and needed to change my card information just so I won‚Äôt keep getting charged. I would NOT recommend this to anyone at all‚Ä¶

I really hate leaving bad reviews but I have to do it for this.
At first, this app was amazing. I felt like I was finally being heard and helped. But after my first couple appointments, I heard nothing. For 3 months I wasn‚Äôt spoke to or reached out to. I emailed support and asked and they said it‚Äôs my job to reach out. I‚Äôm paying $85 but it‚Äôs my job? I get setting my own appointments but I didn‚Äôt hear anything about needing to do the monthly appointments, as my mental health isn‚Äôt great, it‚Äôs hard to.
The prescription is great and helped so much and I‚Äôm scared to lose it and go back downhill again but it‚Äôs frustrating to be paying $85 for just a prescription.
I got this app to get help because my own doctor didn‚Äôt listen to me but at this point, I don‚Äôt know what to do but get my money back to use it somewhere else.

Don‚Äôt subscribe. Do yourself a favor and find a more transparent service. Concerns you should listen to:

1. Payments/charges are not transparent. I feel like they are charging my card left and right with no consistent amounts, and now I question what all I‚Äôm even being charged for. The cost for their services is not fully transparent. You will spend FAR more money using this service than going to a local doctor‚Äôs office. 

2. Can never get an appointment. Each month I‚Äôm told I need to schedule my next appointment, only to pull up the calendar and the next available one is 5+ weeks out. Appointments are mandatory and with them being so far out, it truly effects the level of care you‚Äôre being provided. 

3. I‚Äôve been a member since mid-October and already twice there was a lapse in time where I was without medications. You‚Äôll receive an email that your meds have been shipped and when you try to click the link to track it, it doesn‚Äôt work. Your body will go through withdrawals and this is a consistent thing this company continues to do. 

4. Went to cancel my subscription and you can‚Äôt do it through the app or even talk to a live person on the phone, you have to send them an email. Sketch is all I have to say.

I signed up for the basic plan in a state of distress and feeling hopeless looking for something to help me get back on my feet. They make it sound like you‚Äôll get to talk to someone throughout the month if needed but really all they were offering was to provide me a prescription and a basic once a month visit for 30 minutes with an unlicensed counselor. When I realized I didn‚Äôt want or need what they were offering I reached out to cancel my subscription and get a refund (they charge you before really telling you what they give you). I didn‚Äôt utilize any of their services but was still denied a refund ‚Äúper the billing policy‚Äù (10 page fine print nobody actually reads). Overall just be aware they don‚Äôt offer real help at a reasonable price, are deceptive about how they take your money and what they offer, and will take advantage of vulnerable people.

I had trouble scheduling a psychiatric consultation with a Cerebral provider. The app will show you available calendar dates and time slots that are, in fact, unavailable (as admitted by the customer service team). However, while on the phone with customer service, I was reassured multiple times that they secured me with an appointment when they had not. The day of the appointment passed with no correspondence from my provider; the app reflected that I never had an appointment. Fine. I reached out to customer service again and received their voicemail. I tried explaining my problem to the Cerebral team on Instagram and they deleted my critical comment so it wouldn‚Äôt tarnish their social media presence. I later received a message admitting that there was a bug in the app and the phone agent made a mistake with my appointment. Avoid Cerebral at all costs.

Originally I signed up with them. I was paying about 89 dollars a month. Then they started charging me 85 dollars and then charging medication charges multiple times on my card, even though on several occasions they forgot to send my medication out, and I ended up having to get an emergency supply at cvs until they responded two days later. For example for September I have a 85 dollar charge, and four 10 dollar charges for medication, when I only am prescribed two medications and I only received one. Also they never let me know of they changed. And when I brought up being charged they told me, well we notified you that you‚Äôd be paying less, so that‚Äôs why the charges are there. So now at over 105 dollars without even therapy. It‚Äôs cheaper to just see a family doctor on something virtual, and letting insurance pay for it.

The app seems faulty and customer service doesn‚Äôt seem to know what‚Äôs going on. 

I got the services I needed in January but after a few months decided to get off my medication and pause my account. However, I decided to go back on my meds after a bit and got back on the app to restart the services but this time with Medication + Therapy. I clicked on the services I wanted but  the app charged my account twice (I have bank statements to prove it) and I never got the therapy services I requested. When I reached out to their customer service department they say they have no account of these transactions and that my account is still paused. I even met with a provider through their app who prescribed me a different medication but customer service says they don‚Äôt see that information on their end.

I had high hopes for this considering it was pretty low pay but I didn‚Äôt like that all they wanted to do was prescribe me medication. If that‚Äôs what you need then sure. But it was a little sketchy considering you could barely read the information on the bottles and it took almost a week for them to come in when the lady said it should have only taken 2-3 days‚Ä¶ I was also looking for actual help on how to pinpoint what causes my anxiety but they told me to just do exercises and journaling and then left me alone for a month. Depending on the plan you choose to take you only get to speak to a counsellor once a month. Again I personally didn‚Äôt enjoy that and not being able to get an immediate response when it said it was an open chat. There was three different people I had to speak to (not great for my anxiety) and super confusing to say the least.

UPDATE: Go take a look at Cerebral on BBB. They‚Äôre not accredited and have a 1.16/5 rating by customers. Also to those who have lost money to this scam please go to your bank and file a dispute, also change your card information to avoid being wrongfully charged. This was the only way I got my money back and stopped being charged for services despite filling out their cancellation form. 

Working with Cerebral has been absolutely terrible. I had my appointment cancelled, and ended up having to go through my bank to get my money back. I sent in a form to have my membership cancelled weeks ago and i‚Äôm still receiving emails about my upcoming appointment which was cancelled also weeks ago. Kind of shocking they have 4.7 stars, i‚Äôm legitimately surprised. As a soon to be PsyD student I would never recommend this company to anyone.

I joined about 5 weeks ago. Set my appointment as soon as they were available. The earliest availability was in two weeks. One day before the appointment, they cancel. They rescheduled and the next appointment was more than a month and a half away. So I wrote to them and they rescheduled for an earlier date about a week out. One day before that appointment again they cancelled it. Now they want to reschedule again and the next availability is two months out. Obviously, unacceptable. Have tried numerous times to reach someone and no one has gotten back to me. I find it ironic, that a service for mental health to treat anxiety, depression and other mental issues can actually be the cause of the same issues you are trying to treat. If you need help, get professional help from somewhere else, but not this app.

BEWARE: they charge you regardless of if you have made an appointment or not, and they provide people struggling with self harm issues an absurd amount of medication at once, as well as not accepting state/federal insurance for medication (despite the medication in question being covered in general)
They do not offer refunds for anything, even if you are charged for an appointment that did not exist. I am very disappointed. The therapist/counselors were very nice, my issues are solely with the app itself. I believe it is preying on mentally ill people and the financially struggling. They even acknowledge that the "subscription" type of payment has upset many people in their FAQ , and have done nothing to change it. Charge for appointments when they happen so that people who only need medication management aren't also charged for appointments that never happened or were scheduled.

I had previously met with doctors virtually and assumed this service would be an equivalent after moving out of state but I was very wrong. It's not possible to check if your insurance will cover your care until you have already payed and on top of that you cannot schedule appointments until you've already payed. The earliest I could meet with a prescriber was three months out which makes no sense for a monthly subscription. When it finally came time for my meeting I was told that my mental health history immediately disqualified me from being treated and they couldn't do anything to help me. Afterwards there was no follow up or resources provided as an alternative and the support team did nothing to resolve the matter. These people are not professional, helpful, or caring, just concerned about making money off of people in need and stealing your information.

The service states that if you want to cancel your account, you must submit a request by 9pm the day before your next billing cycle. Knowing this, i submitted my request a couple days even earlier just to be safe. A few days later i was billed again. After reaching out to customer support and emailing back and forth over the span of a week, all they‚Äôve been able to offer me was half of what i was billed. I‚Äôve tried explaining that I cancelled with more than enough time, but keep getting the generic response saying something like, ‚ÄúWe try to make sure our customers understand the policy beforehand‚Äù and then they explain again that you must request before 9pm the prior day, and then again say they are giving me a partial refund. What is the point in the cancellation policy if the company doesn‚Äôt even need to stand by it?

I used this app to get treatment for depression and ADHD. I wished to return to some safe antidepressants I used to take that worked well but was given strong antipsychotics with no psychotic symptoms. When I told the practitioner they made me feel worse, the doctor was insistent on increasing the dosage until it was at the absolute maximum. I became more depressed and attempted suicide. 

When I saw a different doctor in my inpatient. he told me he could not explain how a practitioner would give me what she did, as it made no sense to him and likely worsened my mental state. I felt incredibly better after slowly weening off these medications, and even better after getting the right ones.

A trusted family member is an attorney for the medical field and has dealt with multiple lawsuits with app-based medical treatments as these placed tend to hire the doctors that cannot find work elsewhere.

I went through the whole intake process including payment for this service. Everytime I try to log into my account or do anything it says I have not completed my intake and I need to set up an appointment. When I click to schedule appointment, it says there is not appointment availability and they will contact me through email within 48 hours. I get the email that says I haven‚Äôt completed my intake and I need to do that, I follow all the linkage just for the same problem to occur. I have been dealing with this for over a week now. I have reached out to customer service but they didn‚Äôt answer my question properly and when I said that it wasn‚Äôt satisfactory I have not heard back. I am tired of going in these loops so now I have to figure out how to cancel this subscription. Disappointing, I was really excited for this.

It took MONTHS to cancel a service, where no service had ever been accessed AT ALL. What is being advertised as convenient mental health care access, is in reality a predatory ruse that preys on those who are already vulnerable. One would hope that customer service would be caring and attentive, but instead further worsen the situation by being evasive and just plain rude. To put it simply, the legality of the cancellation policy is borderline at best. If anything, Cerebral is undermining any good that may have come from online mental health care. The last thing anyone struggling with mental health needs, is to be ensnared by a company, and then blamed for having hope in the first place. I guarantee I am not the first ‚Äúcustomer‚Äù to have this experience, and it is only a matter of time before a class action lawsuit takes place. Was it worth ripping me off for 9 months?

This is a scam.  Followed up on a refund and this is what they told me:

When you register with us, you agree to your payment method being billed beginning on the date of registration and subsequently on a monthly basis while the account is active, even if you have yet to complete the registration, have a visit with a provider, or start taking any medications. Please refer to our Recurring Billing Policy and Terms and Conditions, which you have agreed on when you signed up.

DO NOT SIGN UP OR THEY WILL CHARGE YOU EVEN IF YOU CAN‚ÄôT USE THE SERVICE.

Signed up, paid fee (must do before anything), found out they don‚Äôt accept my insurance so tried to cancel immediately, process has been a b*tch. They canceled the subscription and they won‚Äôt refund the fee even though I asked to cancel right after signing up and never used any of their services. Since they weren‚Äôt giving me a refund I thought maybe I‚Äôll try it out but then I found out you immediately lose access (unlike many subscriptions where you still get access until the end of the subscription period). So basically I paid their fee just to find out I can‚Äôt use their service. Frustrating and has been giving me more anxiety. Pretty funny for a mental health app.

Cerebral is a scam. Do not use it. The contract you sign essentially makes it clear that cerebral is NOT a service but a platform for clinicians to offer their services, which is the same as the majority of platforms. This isn‚Äôt inherently an issue, except that cerebral tricks consumers into thinking that you are paying them for comprehensive mental health services. You don‚Äôt get the medication prescribed to you? Not their problem. The therapist that they set you up with has a massive criminal record of selling illegal drugs? Not their problem. You realized this service is anything but a service and want your money back so that you can actually go get the help you need? Ha! Good luck with that. I am a physician and hate that so many patients who desperately need help are getting scammed here and receiving care that is so beyond sub par for their conditions. Save your money.

Sounds good but limitations abound.

1. Super slow response times from coordinators and prescribers. If you have an issue expect 24 hours minimum for a ‚Äúresolution.‚Äù

2. Cerebral cannot subscribe controlled medications and therefore cannot treat all the conditions, or symptoms of a condition effectively, or thoroughly, even though they advertise that they can treat these conditions with medication.

3. To keep you paying them monthly your prescriptions are only month to month, no more than 30 days of medication provided at a time. Expect a delay if you need an urgent refill.

4. Customer service responses are canned, vague, and unhelpful resulting in unnecessary back and forth to get the information that could‚Äôve been provided initially. 

5. Doxy, the video appointment platform underperforms. Everytime I had an appointment there were issues connecting and with the connect once established even when you are off Wi-Fi and hardwired. 

6. Cerebral cannot prescribe medication outside of the state you live in. If you‚Äôre traveling, etc, they can‚Äôt send your meds to a different pharmacy like a doctor could. 

Having said all that, I did really like my prescriber. She was great! And the reason for 2 stars.

My first time booking was perfect, they called immediately and gave me a prescription. (Note that they do not provide controlled substances). Since then: app glitches on scheduling, and I‚Äôm unable to schedule on the latest iOS. Whole schedule just shows gray. Meds didn‚Äôt work‚Ä¶and I have not been able to get help since. I‚Äôve been writing in for 4 days now and getting a run-around. I also don‚Äôt have any evidence that they actually submitted to insurance, as I haven‚Äôt gotten a check (my insurance covers it) and in the app it‚Äôs saying that it failed to be submitted.

Good idea in theory, but my impression is that it‚Äôs poorly run with a high turnover of ‚Äúcare counselors‚Äù since ive been on for 2 weeks and am already on my 3rd. I wouldn‚Äôt waste the time or money. Go to a psychiatrist office.

I upgraded my subscription to include video services after my first month. I upgraded on January 6th, the day of my renewal, as to not be charged for the previous month. On this day two charges came from my account in the amount of $240 and $315. I was informed that the first charge was for December, and the second for January. I explained that I had upgraded my subscription in my renewal date and was told the best they could do was to refund 30% or my next month for free. Bold of them to assume I would continue service after the issue. This company is taking advantage of its clients and you are better off waiting to see a doctor in your community. I will say my prescriber and care coordinator were excellent. Shame to see that the company doesn‚Äôt value their clients but that‚Äôs what happens in a for profit medical company in America I guess.

Signed up on a Thursday paid upfront made my appointment for Monday morning. All weekend I was anticipating the appointment and was really looking forward to it. 

Monday appointment time comes the email said to log in 5 minutes before I log in and the therapist doesn‚Äôt show up.

I reach out to support like it says in the instructions no response. I decide to reach out to the therapist in the chat and then comes a barrage of nonsense that sent my anxiety through the roof. 

She barely mentions that she blew off our session and makes no effort to make me feel better about that but instead starts asking me about the difference between my shipping address and my living address and asking for other forms of ID; it‚Äôs been ridiculous. 

All of these questions should have been sorted out before allowing me to pay for a service, charging me and allowing me to make an appointment creating the false hope that I would get some help.

I‚Äôm extremely disappointed and it kind of sent me in a tailspin of anxiety which is exactly what I was trying to avoid by seeking help.

You guys need to do better at this point I think I deserve a refund because the therapist is saying she cannot provide care because of my address and ID.

I‚Äôm giving two stars because the prescriber I met with was great. However, the company is quick to get you in for an intake, and then, despite the fact that you‚Äôre paying monthly and your prescriber requests to see you monthly, you don‚Äôt get an option to meet with them for several months. When you ask for help, they just keep implying that you‚Äôre trying to get additional services beyond what you‚Äôre paying for and don‚Äôt actually help you get access to the services you are paying for. It‚Äôs total bait-and-switch and very, very unethical (I say this as a healthcare professional). It‚Äôs unconscionable that they would request you pay for healthcare services that you can‚Äôt actually access.

I signed up for cerebral in response to an ad for treatment of adult adhd. Unfortunately, the assessments offered were for depression, anxiety and sleep. When I had the appointment with the provider she had no assessment for my adhd symptoms and treated me for depression. I don‚Äôt want treatment for depression. I never wanted treatment for depression. It never works and is a complete waste of time and money for me. But no one listened. I was told that I would need to request the adhd assessment and only after the depression medication was allowed 8 weeks to build a therapeutic dose, (longer of therapeutic effect wasn‚Äôt reached), would I be assessed for ADHD. I‚Äôm 50 years old. I think I know myself better than you do. And all for the bargain price of $80 a month??? $80 a month to have my concerns ignored and be treated for something I don‚Äôt want treatment for? No. Don‚Äôt waste your time.

The people on cerebral have no training or options to deal with people who have severe reactions to medications. They prescribe extremely
Serious medication for things that can be treated with something less extreme. They are very nonchalant about prescribing medications that are known to cause extreme side effects in many people, some of these meds even require a dr to monitor your kidneys and liver, but they won‚Äôt tell you that. They take an age to answer, and it‚Äôs clear it‚Äôs just a money grab. Go to a real doctor, this service is dangerous. They completely disregard the risks of the medications they are prescribing, and you can‚Äôt reach someone quickly if something does happen to you. 2/10. Medications for mental health are not to be taken lightly. Go to a doctor if you need help, or seek a counselor, don‚Äôt sign up for this.

I was warned to not join this company because they take advantage of you and just want your money, but I decided to try it out because I didn‚Äôt know where else to find help. The interface is extremely buggy, I didn‚Äôt even get past the on boarding phase. I was stuck trying to schedule my prescriber appointment and care counselor appointment, even though i already scheduled them, but it never let me move on from that point and I wasn‚Äôt able to see my dashboard. They have a lot of issues with their site, and their customer service is slow to respond. I had already heard terrible things about people being ripped off, so I decided to cancel my services with them immediately and will not be returning to Cerebral and will be encouraging others to do the same.

I was told per my prescriber I didn‚Äôt need another monthly appointment and that my medication would be filled. They never refilled my medication (which can cause withdrawal symptoms if suddenly stopped), I messaged them several times with no response, I called the number on their site for assistance, it prompts you to select an option for medication refills which then tells you to message your care team, messaged again and no response, the pharmacy tried contacting them and after several days they never responded. I ended up having to go to a local clinic and have my prescription refilled. I paid $85/month to essentially be ghosted by my care team when I needed them. I ended up cancelling my subscription‚Ä¶ a tedious process which asks over and over if you really want to cancel‚Ä¶ the entire thing is a scam.

They will charge you money that they can‚Äôt explain and they will not help you resolve the problem. I was signed up for the $85/month plan, but I kept getting charged $145/month in addition to the $85/month. So they were actually getting $230/month!!! When I called them out on it, they refused to help me. They claimed there‚Äôs no record of these extra charges on their end. They said I would have to go through my bank to get help with this. When I went to my bank for help, they also refused to help me because they have been charging me this amount regularly so they don‚Äôt believe me when I say this is unauthorized. So I‚Äôm just out all that money. This company really messes with your head, they‚Äôre supposed to be there to help people with their mental health issues, but all they do is make it worse.

Took me 3+ months to get my prescription. I was already in medication before I started using cerebral so all I needed were refills and prescription adjustments. After attempting to tell them 3 or 4 times that my pharmacy doesn‚Äôt carry my prescription in tablets and that they needed to prescribe 2 different milligrams in the capsules, we are back to square one again with them trying to prescribe tablets. I am currently supposed to be weaning off of it but now I am going off of it cold turkey because I‚Äôm still unable to get this medication. The staff are nice but this is ridiculous. 
Recently I was told that I needed to find a new prescriber somewhere else because they are no longer prescribing controlled substances. I was going to be looking for a new prescriber anyway. I do not recommend cerebral unless you just need counseling.

This app is a nightmare. It took a month from signing up just to get an appointment with a prescriber, then once I finally was able to see him he told me he couldn‚Äôt prescribe me my adderall and Ativan that I‚Äôve been on for two years because of ‚Äúlimitations in the app‚Äù. I said fine and told him where I wanted my prescriptions sent and even confirmed with him the name of the pharmacy and address. He said they‚Äôd be there the next day, that was two weeks ago and still nothing. Apparently he tried to send them to me directly which then charged my bank account the full amount of the prescription which would‚Äôve cost me nothing if I could‚Äôve used my insurance at my pharmacy. And now I‚Äôm stuck messaging my ‚Äúcare coordinator‚Äù who only replies once a day. This app is a nightmare, do yourself a favor and avoid at all costs.

I started cerebral on September 24 of 2021. From then I had two appointments with a care counselor in the 6 months I had the app. When you‚Äôre trying to better yourself and you barely get to talk to someone it‚Äôs hard to work through your problems ESPECIALLY when you don‚Äôt even get to talk about them when you‚Äôre in a meeting. The only thing I got to talk about was my medication. The only thing I got out of the meetings were articles to read about my mental illness. I‚Äôve been paying out of pocket for this app for 6 months and haven‚Äôt gotten any better even in the slightest. I don‚Äôt take this lightly and I will be telling other people to find a different app to use. Cerebral is a scam. Spend your money elsewhere for the help you deserve.

What started out great 15 months ago quickly turned into a nightmare. Initially, my provider and care team were professional, prompt and committed. Within months, I lost both my provider and care counselor. My providers changed more times than I can count. There was no continuity of care, gone were my treatment goals, check ins and supplemental interventions. They were replaced by rushed or canceled visits. Every month I had to ask for my refills, I was constantly scrambling for my, meds. I was dealing with providers who didn‚Äôt know, or maybe weren‚Äôt interested in, me, my history or my needs. I paid $85 a month to chase down my prescription (which barely changed in that 15 months) and navigate my anxiety without the support of my ‚Äúcare‚Äù team. My experience with Cerebral was awful.

I signed up and paid for the service and promptly scheduled the necessary appointments with a Prescriber and a Counsellor. On the date of my first appointment, the Prescriber stood me up without notice. 

After contacting customer service, they told me to reschedule in the app, however, there was no option to do so (which I sent them screenshots confirming). Due to the hassle, I requested that they cancel my account and refund me. Instead of doing that, they just picked a random date and time to reschedule me for that same provider that stood me up. I reached out and again told them that I‚Äôd rather cancel and have a refund. 

They then told me I have to cancel my account in the app and asked me if they should cancel my appointment, and they still gave no confirmation that they would refund me. After canceling my account in the app, I reiterated for the third time that yes they should cancel everything and that I want a refund. 

I should not have to ask 3 times to cancel and get a refund and still be unclear if they are doing so. Perhaps the care provided is good if your provider shows up, but based on the customer service I‚Äôve encountered I would be hesitant to recommend this to anyone.

i dont know where to begin. terrible experience over and over. 
at first the app wouldnt work, contacted support multiple times and it took way too long to fix. 
then my provider told me i can up my dosage and take two. ok thats fine but now i am paying double for my meds. 
a few days before i was going to run out of my medication i contacted support and told them i was going to run out and i still havent received my refill. days go by and im told to send them the address of my nearest pharmacy so i can pick it up myself. i do so and again, a delay in getting back to me. finally they say someone will be in contact with me. its been about three weeks since that and i still havent heard anything. stopping meds cold turkey is very dangerous and is not something i would do on my own. i was forced to do so because of the horrible support. now i feel worse than ever and it seems like they just dont care. this is the worst experience with anything i have ever had. as someone who doesnt usually leave negative reviews, believe that my experience was so bad that i felt the need to leave a review. this is outright dangerous and i am extremely disappointed and angry.

I payed for Cerebal hoping I could make things better since locally it‚Äôs hard to even get in with somebody. They even offered a discount that made it $25! Great right? No.. they scheduled all my appointments a month and a few days later (Stupid right? Someone with mental health problems will just sit around for a month before they can even talk to somebody.) and for 2 they charge $85 the next month. My guess is they‚Äôre making it look like you‚Äôre getting a deal for the first month when really they want you to pay the $85 next month. I don‚Äôt have time to wait, and I surely don‚Äôt want to rely on an business that functions like this.

Sorry, but this will need a lot of work before it‚Äôs ready.

Here‚Äôs a update: 
They rescheduled it closer (great!) but when I talked to my provider and told her my problems she said ‚ÄúIf you think you‚Äôre going to get controlled meds, you‚Äôre wrong‚Äù... I wanted help not to be portrayed as a pill head.. I don‚Äôt understand how this app works. But if you want help, go to someone in person. The counselors are rude, was in her pajamas in her room and hung up on me. I paid to be disrespected and to not get any help. I requested a full refund and I‚Äôll update when I hear back from support.

I wish I could attach a screenshot of the extremely rude and unprofessional response from one of my ‚Äúcare coordinators‚Äù my pharmacist was unable to reach the provider after several attempts to refill my medication. I contacted my care coordinators and did not receive a response for more than 40 hours. I called the contact number and the automated message said to message in the app .. very frustrating. I emailed the customer support and also did not get a response back for a day and a half. The response I got back on the app from ‚ÄòBri L‚Äô reminding me that responses can take up to 24 hours‚Ä¶ keep in mind theirs was 40 hours later. She then said please don‚Äôt send multiple messages. The app was convenient at first but if you have any issues good luck getting in touch with someone.

I cancelled my subscription after getting a random diagnosis after a 10 minute conversation which did not entail any of my medical history and i was sent drugs to combat seizures when i don‚Äôt have epilepsy nor have i ever had a seizure and when i told them my prescription doesn‚Äôt look right they said ‚Äúwe will look into it‚Äù ‚Ä¶. nothing happened. so i cancel my subs.
and what do you know 3 weeks later im getting another 120$ charge from them. i‚Äôve tried to call i‚Äôve tried to email they don‚Äôt respond no one on the phone will talk to me about it because ‚Äúcancellation questions have to be emailed‚Äù so they are just taking me for my money and now the only way i can make this stop is to cancel my bank account and create a new one. scamming ppl seeking mental help is the lowest of the low ü§¨

I would give them zero stars if I could. They charged me for services that they didn‚Äôt no provide. They‚Äôre have a horrible habit of responding late to any messages. The clinician assigned to my case was MIA after our first and only 30 minute session. I wasn‚Äôt able to get the medication I needed after she has ‚Äúsubmitted‚Äù the prescription. They take advantage of the fact that people come to they with medical needs in hopes of have access to affordable medication, and they take the money without rendering any services. When I requested a refund for the payments they took, I was informed that I wouldn‚Äôt get a refund because they‚Äôre clinician have to get paid. However, they never even took into consideration the fact that they in a total of 3 months all they provided me was with 1 intake session.

I used cerebral for a few months, trying to figure out if ADHD was a thing for me or if it was maybe something else and in those few months I was on more meds than anyone should be on, I was put on meds that made me more aggressive, suicidal, just downright done with the world and no one can figure out why they just slap a new medication on you. Forget about having a constant medication person too, I had a new one pretty much every month I was there and my care coordinator had no clue what they were doing. They also charged me for March when I cancelled well before their site says you need to. You also have no way of contacting anyone higher up there, go look at the app it leads to a dead link and their website has no way to talk to someone about everything they do that‚Äôs bad.

I truly wish I could leave zero stars. I signed up last week, the ads were misleading and I thought my insurance would definitely be covered since I have a PPO with BCBS. There was an ‚Äòerror‚Äô when I submitted my insurance info and I was instructed to contact support. The paywall was right after that and I proceeded, well it turns out they don‚Äôt accept my insurance, so I cancelled after 24 hours ‚Äî I never even had an appointment. My initial ask for a refund was ignored, and when I followed up I was told I could only get $30/$99 refunded ‚Äî what exactly did I get charged for? To waste my time getting caught in your tech support cycle? The support agent has gone silent after I asked to escalate my request, and I‚Äôm hoping this will help get some resolution here.

This app is currently a scam. First it said they could not process my BCBS insurance card. They said once I had my initial consultation appointment I could get the insurance worked out that way but first I had to pay the initial fee out of pocket. It has now been over 20 days and I still cannot get in to an initial consultation. I contacted support and they said there was nothing they could do, but they would give me 30% off for the next three months of service. Why would I pay to continue not seeing a health professional out of pocket? Finally, I asked to be reimbursed. But they said they would not reimburse me unless I cancel my account, thus taking me out of the line to eventually get an appointment with a health care provider. Since I am not made of money, I went ahead and cancelled.

I‚Äôve only been with cerebral for a few months and I‚Äôve been more frustrated with this service than actual physical meetings with psychs. In the few months I have been with them, i‚Äôve gone through 3 different prescribers, one of which I had seen twice before leaving. Same story with the next. I hate leaving negative reviews but this company will refuse to refund me. I purchased the wrong package and never ended up making an appointment, never got past the ‚Äúintake‚Äù section and when I emailed their support no one there could help or they said it was too late. 

I‚Äôm not interested in even attempting to use the package initially set out to buy after dealing with such a bad customer service team. You guys send out countless text messages to people daily regarding your big discounts but you fail to specify which ones in the texts. 

I‚Äôm not saying the service itself doesn‚Äôt work or the quality of their services are not being met, I‚Äôm saying the customer service and policies they have are comical. I lost money and didn‚Äôt even get to use their services whatsoever. Shame on you.

The concept was great and I was able to get diagnosed and given a prescription but since then its been nothing but problems. 100% do not recommend. It‚Äôs very hard to even find appointments. Appointments are only 30 minutes, so it‚Äôs also very hard to get anywhere or make any progress. Not this sham.

I haven‚Äôt been able to log on/open the app for over a month. I‚Äôve updated my app, my phone, uninstalled and reinstalled the app- nothing. But, I am still getting charged. I don‚Äôt even know where to start. I‚Äôm more disappointed than mad. I suffer from severe anxiety and going out to meet a therapist is extremely difficult for me. I‚Äôve been paying for Cerebral for a week, but haven‚Äôt been able to access information, talk to a specialist, or even move past onboarding. They immediately begin trying to shove medication down your throat from a 10 minute conversation, it is impossible to get in contact with customer service, and you cannot make an appointment until the next month to get in contact with the care counselor. There is absolutely no urgency or communication amongst coordinators and providers and the amount of pure negligence is astounding. I didn‚Äôt realize this app is primarily for pharmaceutical solutions and that psychotherapy isn‚Äôt part of the primary package. I was seeking treatment for ADHD. I had a 2 minute phone call with a care counselor who explained the services, and I decided it was not for me. I had already paid for the month, but whatever I knew the risk.

Because I struggle with ADHD I have a hard time remembering anything at all. I forgot to cancel the subscription. I was charged $85 for the second month. The same day I was charged, I immediately canceled and called to inquire about a refund. I was told I would get an email about any refund. 

I had to call the following week again because I received no email. I was then told that I could not receive a refund because I canceled after I was charged. 

I‚Äôve had other subscriptions refund me in instances like this. Yes is my fault I forgot to cancel, but what continues to bother me is that Cerebral doesn‚Äôt actually seem to be interested in someone‚Äôs mental health as a mental health service. The only positive part of my experience with cerebral was the nurse practitioner who did my initial visit. She was understanding and compassionate.

The customer service and pharmacy are ridiculously slow. It took 2.5 weeks for my first prescription to arrive. Therapy is supposed to be included, I had one 15 min session with someone who told me to do a worksheet. That was 3 months ago. No follow up. No other appointments scheduled by them.  There‚Äôs no scheduling option in the app. So I guess you are supposed to contact them to schedule appointments? But again the customer service is lack luster so I‚Äôm not even sure how scheduling works. 

This service is lacking a lot!  Overall, this service is not worth it.

Signed up and started my intake form. I had one therapist for my whole state to choose from. I could not for various reasons, related to my MENTAL HEALTH, schedule a visit with this person. I gave this app the benefit of the doubt and thought I‚Äôd not listen to the reviews. I should have listened. I paid $30 for the first month which included care counseling and medication. This company does not care about your mental health!!! I reached out to their care team over and over again to request a new prescriber and was told I‚Äôm not allowed to choose a new prescriber after the initial setup.

Upon signing up for service there is microscopic writing saying basically just by inquiring about Cerebral you consent to them stealing $85 a month AFTER a $30 fee for ‚Äúactivation‚Äù from you.. even if you NEVER talk to a therapist (which there‚Äôs an additional charge to talk to a licensed therapist.)   There is not confirmation page or email receipt. They are internally tricking people into paying for services they don‚Äôt realize they are.  They also won‚Äôt provide any refunds. Real terrible coming from a company that is supposed to be caring for your mental health.  They also have verbally abused customers for calling out them on their shady actions by telling them to keep their comments to themselves. I‚Äôll be turning them into the better business bureau.

Pros:

- Initial process, first visit, and prescription handling were straightforward

Cons:

- Within a week of onboarding, both the prescriber and the care coordinator dropped from the platform - leaving me in a state of limbo. This is a major issue for a platform developing around mental health.

- Canceling a plan is a hassle. They require submission of an email form, and actual cancelation may cause you to be charged erroneously. Adding friction to cancelation is a cheap trick used by subscription services to ‚Äúreduce churn‚Äù. It often backfires in the long run.

- It‚Äôs not possible to view providers without changing to a plan that supports the type of provider you‚Äôre trying to find. For example, you‚Äôd need a plan including Therapy to search for therapists. If you can‚Äôt find a good match, you have to submit a refund request given they already charged you.

Overall, I cannot recommend this product for anyone seeking mental health services. My experience is anecdotal, but two providers dropping as soon as I began using the service doesn‚Äôt seem like a positive indicator. Furthermore, withdrawing from the platform is currently a hassle.

They have taken two months of my money and I‚Äôve gotten nothing but more aggravation and stress.  Of the 5 sessions I should have received so far I had one new patient meeting and one no show.  That therapist told me to find someone else! Then a new person who I saw once for new patient meeting and then once again to tell me he‚Äôs leaving.  I have received zero actual therapy.  There have been two no show/cancellations out of the 4 appointments I made. 

I have literally spent all day and can‚Äôt get them to set the app so I can choose a new therapist so I can hope someone new can help me and show up dependably.  They have my money, I wish I could get the promised therapy instead of more problems. 

There‚Äôs no way to reach anyone but messages and the replies are selective- I can‚Äôt get any answers about how they plan to make this right.  How to get a new therapist. I swear it‚Äôs like a robot answers my messages with the crazy answers I get. 

It‚Äôs criminal that they‚Äôve taken my money and worsened my mental health.  go anywhere else, they took my money and have totally failed to live up to even half of their promises.

It‚Äôs been a while since I have used cerebral. I thought it was going to be a great app because I needed some help and why not use an app on a device I use constantly?

No refund. No meds. Nothing. Just money out the door and hey, gotta do what you gotta do. At this point, it‚Äôs blatantly obvious that the company does not care for mentally I‚Äôll people, which is a shame because this was the recommended app for me. 

Maybe communication amongst your subscribers would be best. At this point I can‚Äôt say how much I spent that I didn‚Äôt get back because it‚Äôs been a hot minute since using cerebral. Not a day goes by that I don‚Äôt miss it.

I have been a member 6 months and talked to a subscriber a few times and after twisting arms finally got one counseling session. I pay so much money and there isn‚Äôt really a treatment plan. This service is just as bad as circle medical. It‚Äôs not easy or straightforward to get in touch with your prescriber. In 4 months, I‚Äôve been assigned 3 prescribers total. I wonder how these people became nurses or doctors because essentially they can‚Äôt help people. They turn away people. They lack professionalism. I saw a psychiatrist who was nurse practitioner so low in IQ she didn‚Äôt know how to work the video chat, DOXYME so it got cut to a phone call. Now customer service is ignoring me. WHY? Hi friends! I don‚Äôt post reviews that often, but I am very passionate about mental health care. I wanted to take a quick second to warn you about Cerebral. Cerebral is an website that offers ‚ÄúOnline prescriber visits, care counseling, and prescriptions delivered to your door.‚Äù What they don‚Äôt tell you is that you will never be able to connect with your care team, your psychiatrist, or their support team. You will pay money to be ignored, particularly when you need help with med management and crisis. You will not get a refund. Please do not fall into their trap. If you need help finding resources please do not go with Cerebral. Stay healthy, stay aware. This has been a public service announcement. Please learn from my mistakes. üòÖ

This program seemed great initially, but has turned out to be a scam. The Cerebral prescriber would not prescribe for me and suggested I find a local in-person provider instead. In the beginning the app was great. Scheduling and meeting with both prescriber and counselor were very simple and easy. It was way too good to be true. They now seem severely understaffed. I‚Äôm always being tossed around to different prescribers and counselors and scheduling appointments is impossible. They make you reschedule but don‚Äôt provide any dates and they take forever now to reply. Nothing is consistent. They just want to take peoples money without giving them the proper care they actually need. They act like they will schedule you an appointment but cancel the appointment last minute. It‚Äôs really annoying. This is people‚Äôs mental health they‚Äôre messing with. By being unresponsive, they can potentially harm a lot of people.

I had so many issues with this membership, from app glitches, to nonexistent communication. 
For starters, I only used this membership for about 3 months. The first month, my prescriber changed on me, then my coordinator switched as well. Second month in, my coordinator switched yet again, and my counselor bailed on me the day before my appointment. 
Third month in, my coordinator was constantly switching up because the one I had wasn‚Äôt available nearly every week. And yet again, my counselor canceled my appointment the night before. 

What was my last straw, was that my prescriber left me in the back burner and quite literally left me without medication. 

I read all of these reviews in the beginning and thought, ‚Äúmaybe I‚Äôm being too critical and just need to try this for myself.‚Äù 
No, I was listening to my gut and chose not to follow it and this is where it landed me. 
I now use Dr. On demand, and it‚Äôs 10x better, they even gave me a 3 month prescription of my medications AND it‚Äôs cheaper and offers more/better services. 

Please listen to me and avoid this app/company as best as possible.

Used this service for a whole month and never saw anyone due to the sessions getting cancelled repeatedly by the counselor. Response times were horrific. (I sent this as a message through the app and will update if I hear back and get a resolution)

This company is a fraud and scam, I signed up they charged my card. Had 1 appointment and they offered prescription. I CONSTANTLY got emails and texts from them to fill out a medical history form, when I already had done so. I would then go to the app or online to do it again and it wouldn‚Äôt be there. Developers said to just ignore it. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO, just fix it!

At the end of the day, this company (or app) is a business. They will prioritize making money over your mental health. This company refuses to give me a refund after I canceled my account. Stay away from these folks. Cerebral does not hand insurance claims well, and when they mess up, they shift blame to the customer and their billing policy. They will not refund money, but they will surprise charge you with hundreds of dollars in bad insurance claims. They only file claims every few months, so you won‚Äôt notice until after a few months have passed that claims were filed wrong. Unlike BetterHelp they will absolutely not give you a refund whether you use their service or not. They don‚Äôt clearly don‚Äôt care. I never used the service, but made the mistake of linking it to an account so it received payment information. Waited a month to talk to someone only for them to be dismissive and not listen, at one point she told me I ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt giving her any information‚Äù despite me sitting there with a written list my therapist and I had worked on to explain where I‚Äôm at and why I feel I need medication. I had high hopes for this one.

Absolute mess. I rarely review things. This was nothing but problematic. 

1.  Gave me meds.  I tried and kept literally passing out.  When I wasn‚Äôt, I would fall asleep sitting, driving, I couldn‚Äôt function. I told them multiple times. 1. They charge you upfront for accessing the service. Then, you have an appointment and the doctor prescribes the medication. It‚Äôs been 72 hours and I have spoken to 4 different people who can‚Äôt chase down where my medication even is.

 I made it to the next one and told her I was waiting for a dr appointment (since I was sitting in my car. Didn‚Äôt want her to think I was driving) and she refused to talk to me. Thinking we wouldn‚Äôt have time to talk when I said we would (I was early for my appointment)

I went to cancel and asked for a refund since I had a bad experience getting in and treated me like I didn‚Äôt matter. I shouldn‚Äôt pay for services I did not receive. I‚Äôm very prone to self harm and it was hard for me to find help and be treated that way.

All the best on your journeys to better mental health, I hope that my experience is a one off but in case it isn‚Äôt thought I‚Äôd shoot y‚Äôall a heads up.

signed up from tiktok and they have u pay IMMEDIATELY, then you find out theres 1+ month long wait times for a 30 minute session, you're paying $30 to be ignored for 4+ weeks. supposedly theres a no refund policy, we'll see about that. i've had the app for 30 minutes and already had problems scheduling with a provider. i reached out to the "care team" and there was no answer. save your money and find an in person service. this is giving scammer vibes, imagine downloading an app to FINALLY get help for your mental issues and feeling instantly worse bc you feel like your money was stolen üòç that's this app in a nutshell

I wanted to love cerebral. It started off great. But it started getting fishy when I couldn‚Äôt make appointments until I had paid again. Which caused me to have long waits in between appointments. Don‚Äôt use this app if you are not financially stable, I had to cancel and mind you I have not use any of their services was too busy dealing with other things and they charge me 85 again when I cancel and wanted a refund they say they can‚Äôt issue it because of their policy‚Ä¶ and billing cycle. Just like everyone else with the one star reviews- they talk to you and everything is great for the first month and then your meds aren‚Äôt refilled and surprise - no one can do anything about it. How can this app be rated so high? All of the five star reviews are fake, they don‚Äôt even sound real. This is the biggest joke I‚Äôve ever wasted my

Don‚Äôt waste your money, time, and mental health on this company. i have been paying 85$ a month for no reason. there‚Äôs never appointments available, no one ever messages me back and i am losing it. I have been double charged numerous times. And I‚Äôve even sent statements and screenshots of the charges as proof and have been called a liar. Be aware this company has questionable business practices that are not geared toward customer health or wellbeing. Despite the number of positive reviews Cerebral has received, note that the negative reviews are consistently about serious billing practices: paying for services not rendered.

It seems to be a gamble to get started with Cerebral: maybe you‚Äôll find support and service, or maybe you‚Äôll be burdened with a financial nightmare on top of what you‚Äôre already going through.

Honestly I have tried a lot of online therapy platforms before, but Cerebral has been the worst. 
YOU CANNOT CONTROL YOUR OWN CANCELLATION TO THEIR SUBSCRIPTION.
Also, they‚Äôll allow you to pay for and sign up for services that ‚Äúaren‚Äôt available in your area‚Äù. I spent $100 for medication and therapy sessions. When I went to do my therapy session I couldn‚Äôt complete it without headphones that had a mic, which I didn‚Äôt have.
I waited over a month for my medication appointment and a week before my provider quit. Instead of prioritizing me or having that providers caseload covered, I was forced to book another appointment. Two months out.

It is such a shame that this platform wasn‚Äôt executed better. I‚Äôd vote not stars if possible, I was charged almost $200 in total and received zero treatment. Good luck if they don‚Äôt accept your health insurance AND IF YOUR PARENTS HAVE CERTAIN PRE EXISTING CONDITIONS‚Ä¶.also when I called to speak to someone about canceling I still had to fill out a form and official REQUEST A REFUND VIA EMAIL‚Ä¶ RIDICULOUS

In the event that the service becomes too expensive and you wish to cancel though - it‚Äôs a nightmare. For 2 consecutive months I tried to cancel my membership with both months charging me anyway.
