So I was charged twice for a service I didn‚Äôt use because I was trying to cancel, and for this they refunded me a whole $20 for just taking my money without providing me a service. Thanks Cerebral...

So yeah - make sure you‚Äôre prepared to use this service religiously to get your money‚Äôs worth.

Literally a scam taking advantage of individuals who truly need help. 

I only had the app for a few hours on Friday and requested to cancel right away since there was a 3-5 week wait to see a prescriber and counselor.

I will write a 100 reviews if I have to if it means it‚Äôll save someone from getting scammed and losing money like i did. Horrible customer service. Literally the worst I‚Äôve ever received. The company is organized very poorly. For our second attempt, there was no link to join the meeting within my appointments tab. Naturally, so late in the evening support was closed for the rest of the day.

I‚Äôve heard good things about Cerebral from friends, but this much effort to simply have others be unaccountable is NOT worth the service. I‚Äôm going to downgrade my plan and have reached out to support via email.

Do not use this company. I started off liking this app, even though it‚Äôs a tad more expensive then others if they don‚Äôt take your insurance. And now they have canceled my appointment after waiting weeks for it. I would take your business elsewhere as I‚Äôm about to.

For a mental health/care app and business, the process of leaving them is nearly akin to abuse. You try to leave, they won‚Äôt let you do it easy. In fact, I‚Äôm still attempting to stop being charged for a service that I only attempted to use and found out that they did not offer what I needed. 

I have followed the steps that have been listed and have got nowhere. 

I called and was placed on hold, which they claimed was a queue. After about 15 minutes, I was given an automated message and asked to leave a detailed message. It gave me enough time to state my name before it hung up on me. 

This is ridiculous. Please just let me leave and cancel this. I can not afford 85/month in charges and even more so since I‚Äôm not using it. 

I cannot, for the life of me, recommend this app to anyone and I‚Äôm even starting to wonder if the reviews are being faked to lure in OBVIOUS vulnerable people. 

Let me leave, please.

Worst customer service I‚Äôve ever experienced. I tried to cancel my subscription multiple times and filled out the form but have still been getting charged on an account that I no longer have access to since NOVEMBER 2021. It‚Äôs March 2022. I have called, contacted everyone, and cannot get them to stop taking my money. This is a scam. They deactivated my account so I can‚Äôt even change my credit card for them to stop taking the money. Don‚Äôt even bother trying to cancel because they‚Äôll just keep taking your money.

i downloaded this app and made an account but after seeing it was 85$ a month i deleted it because i couldn‚Äôt afford that. Somehow they got my card info and charged me anyways! Love the treatment and people I met, but haven‚Äôt been able to access my account for over a week. I really hope this is resolved soon, Cerebral is good but I think they‚Äôre still working kinks out. App is glitchy. Consistently lost my prior session records, consistently lost my insurance card even though I uploaded it multiple times, consistently couldn‚Äôt be bothered to send refills through the app. My prescriber was nice but then just didn‚Äôt show up for my session one day. The ‚Äúprescriber‚Äù promised she would send my medication to my local pharmacy that uses GoodRx for lower prescription prices. That route would‚Äôve cost me $30 which was worth it. I have filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau after many failed attempts at contacting support and my ‚Äúcare coordinators‚Äù. Hoping the BBB can see right through this company. I paid for a month of the counseling and medication, I liked it. Towards the end of the month I was looking at plans and considering upgrading, a pop up window gave me an offer of 70% off ($99 cost) to upgrade for 30 days. I got Cerebral and had one appointment with a provider. She was nice but I didn‚Äôt feel like the platform worked for me and in-person was the care I needed. I sent out an email to Cerebral explaining this and saying I‚Äôd like to cancel afterwards. (you have to email them to cancel your account). Almost two 2 months after this, Cerebral took $85 out of my account. Apparently you have a to fill out a follow up form after saying you‚Äôd like to cancel, or else your account isn‚Äôt actually cancelled. I missed this, which is my fault. Immediately after seeing the charge I emailed Cerebral and explained the situation, and while understand this was an error on my end, I told them that that money was supposed to be for bills and I really needed it. I asked if they could at least give me a partial refund since I only used one service months ago and haven‚Äôt used anything since. They basically said ‚Äúnope sorry we have it now!‚Äù And that‚Äôs the problem with these companies. While I‚Äôm sure Cerebral employs some wonderful providers that will help you, Cerebral itself is still a company and their care for your mental health ends where their wallet begins. I‚Äôm sure being late on my bills will do wonders for my mental health. If you‚Äôre worried about money at all, I would highly recommend just getting in touch with some local providers. Most therapists do telehealth visits now and are willing to work with you on copays and payment plans. They certainly won‚Äôt charge you almost $100 two months after you stop seeing them and say ‚Äúsorry, my money now!‚Äù When you‚Äôre dealing with Cerebral, you‚Äôre dealing with a business who‚Äôs bottom line is to make money, not care about your mental health. Just keep that in mind!

My care counselor was really nice. That is the end of anything positive I have to say. I spent 4 months with Cerebral and that is as many months as I now behind in getting treatment. After joining, it was almost a month until I could meet with a prescriber. (You know the whole thing they advertise against.) During my first session, my prescriber spoke with me for 15 minutes and prescribed a generic catch-all medication. Admittedly, I was actually alarmed by how much of a standard thing that seemed. There was no consideration of my medical history or my individual symptoms. After 6 weeks without improvement, my second appointment was a 10 minute follow up, where just as quickly, that medication was dropped and a new one was prescribed. I was told if that didn‚Äôt work, we would try a more traditional ADHD treatment. A follow up was set for 4 weeks. Within the first, I became depressive and borderline suicidal. I have never suffered from depression until that medication. When I finally got my follow up and informed him of my response to the medication I was told sorry, and that there was ‚Äúnothing more they could do for me.‚Äù After nearly 4 months, I was right back to where I had started. For counseling, I was allowed one 30 minute session each month. While not entirely unhelpful (my counselor is the only reason for a second star), 30 minutes a month is simply not ample to actually address serious issues. I have wasted time, wasted money, and wasted potential opportunities for growth. Cerebral is nothing more than a quick-cash pyramid scheme. There is just something not quite right under the exterior, and I would imagine the current DOJ and DEA investigations will not be the last into Cerebral. Please learn from my mistake. The wait for a real mental health professional is well, well worth it.

This app is absolutely horrendous. The sign up was easy enough. You send them your insurance info and the app will say if you‚Äôre covered or not. Mine said I was covered, so needless to say I signed up. 3 months into the treatment, absolutely zero improvement. They gave me a month worth of subscription pills that‚Äôs more suitable for depression or cigarettes addiction, than ADHD. You have to wait a whole month before you can change your drugs. After signing up, you would have to wait until whenever the prescriber is ready in order to make an appointment with them, so you basically paid $30 while not getting the service you paid for for at least 4 days to a week. I got so done with this service so I cancelled. Unfortunately, the horrible experience only starts here. When I cancelled, the customer rep said my account is terminated. But I can still sign in. I didn‚Äôt take notice of this, until my on file card got charged $19 3 times out of no where. Called them and they said it‚Äôs a system error, so they refunded me. No biggie. Then a few weeks later, they suddenly charge me again for $30? I called them and they said my account is still in service because the termination process got messed up by an error, so they refunded me and said my card was removed from their system so I won‚Äôt get charged again. That‚Äôs was a few months ago. Today, they sent me an email I‚Äôll be charged money for deductibles fees, while they have not disclose this at all during sign up, nor did they even mention it when they check my insurance info. Needless to say, I will not return to this app, nor will I recommend it. Heck, I‚Äôd recommend stay as far away from this app if you want your mental health to be better. 

TL;DR: horrible app, horrible experience.

My experience with Cerebral was great, until it wasn‚Äôt. I was making good progress until I was abruptly reassigned to a new provider. I started over with them, and things went well, until once again, I was inexplicably reassigned. I only had one appointment with this new provider before I was once AGAIN reassigned. I‚Äôm sick of having to go over everything with a new person every single time, just to get a refill for a medication I‚Äôve been successfully on for the past four+ years now. Also, keep in mind that when you tell them you want to cancel your plan, they immediately suspend any refills for your medication. Meaning, even if you have 1 or 2 refills left that you could otherwise get from the pharmacy, they essentially revoke authorization so you‚Äôre unable to get your meds. Absolutely irresponsible and a sorry excuse for ‚Äúhealthcare‚Äù. I‚Äôve had to pay for an extra month I didn‚Äôt want with this service just to allow myself time to find another provider without lapsing on my meds. Going off of psychiatric medication cold turkey is, at best, extremely unpleasant, not to mention dangerous! For a service that claims to care about its patients, you sure do abandon that quickly once they decide to stop paying you. I wouldn‚Äôt wish medication withdrawal on my worst enemy, and you should be ashamed that you essentially hold this over people‚Äôs heads just to get them to stay with your service. No wonder so many providers are ‚Äúmoving on from Cerebral‚Äù. Also, why even offer an option for insurance if you‚Äôre not even going to take it? I had two different insurance plans while I was with Cerebral, and neither one was accepted despite being large, nationwide companies. The tens of dollars a month I might be saving versus my copay for an in-person appointment is nowhere near the headache and frustration this service has put me through. Plenty of doctors are offering telemedicine services; see someone locally instead. It might cost a little more, but you‚Äôll at least have a better idea of what you‚Äôre getting yourself into.

If you have finally mustered up the courage to seek help for your depression and anxiety, then you'll be happy to know that Cerebral is incredibly good at making everything worse!  I've struggled for years, and I was really proud of signing up for Cerebral, because I thought it was a big step for me, but I might as well have just flushed the money down the toilet.  Their system doesn't work, their prescriber and "care" team certainly doesn't care, they have non-existent support, they literally leave you to do and figure everything out for yourself.  Right out of the gate I had an issue with my prescriptions, and I couldn't get in contact with a single person for HOURS.  The first response I get is how they have up to 24 hours to respond to requests - right, that's my bad, I'll try to not have issues getting my anti-anxiety and depression medication filled for the very first time.  The cherry on top is that I tried to cancel the first time, and they said I had to email a cancel line (this is a stupid and predatory customer solutions tactic) and I didn't get a response.  Then when they finally added the functionality to their TERRIBLE app, I cancelled on the app (after they charged me that $85 bucks they certainly love) - the only problem is, right after I cancelled (after already paying) they cut off my access to my account AND to the app.  I couldn't access anything at all, and I had JUST paid for a new month just 3 days prior (confirmed to me by their idiotic support line).  Please do yourself a favor and find help from a source that actually wants to help you - I wish I had a better experience seeking help for the first time.  I literally wrote this to hopefully catch someone's eye when they need it, and you reading this, yeah you - go get help from someone not on the internet.  Call a doctor's office tomorrow and say that you are looking for resources for people to talk to about anxiety and depression.  There are people who WANT to help you.  Cerebral, you're awful - I cannot wait to see you crumble.

üö®üö®üö®üëéüëéüëéCerebral did more harm than good to my mental health. They actually didn‚Äôt do any good. They will do the same to your mental health. This is a company that is selling mental wellness as a lifestyle, this is not a company trying to benefit your mental health. üö® Major red flagsüö®: You can NOT cancel your paid membership on your own. You need to email them and wait 24-48 hours for a reply telling you to wait for confirmation that they received your request‚Ä¶ yes, it‚Äôs that bad. While waiting for that confirmation they will begin spamming your inbox with requests for feedback. Feedback? You have literally done nothing except charge me. After you receive the coveted confirmation email they will say to wait for 24-48 for your membership to be cancelled. At some point they will cancel it. You might be charged for another month while waiting for the cancellation. It did not happen to me but a quick internet search will provide reviews from people who did suffer in that way. üö®üö® After all is said and done they will not delete your information and it will sit in their system for 6 years(for them to sell). They did nothing for me except charge my credit card and refused to delete my personal information. They will attempt to tell you they don‚Äôt sell your information but I have started receiving emails for other mental health services. Coincidence? Absolutely not. Stay away from Cerebral if you value your mental health. See a real professional in person. It might cost more but you will be better off for it.

I have been dealing with severe depression and anxiety for quite a while now and part of this issue with my anxiety was that I could not get myself to go to a doctor‚Äôs office so I found Cerebral and thought it would help. I was very wrong. I gave it a shot for a long time but I should have given up a long time ago. No one on their staff communicates with each other and if you need anything to be done quickly such as speaking to your prescriber due to a bad reaction to a medication or an issue with an appointment or an issue with being charged twice the amount you should be for medication, you will not receive any help. And if they do respond, it will be 5 different people who clearly haven‚Äôt spoken to anyone else. I now just tried to cancel my membership before it was renewed since my prescriber appointment was canceled by Cerebral 2 weeks in a row making a lapse in my medication. Instead of canceling my membership when I asked them to, they charged me for a full month for my renewal and then deactivated my account the day after. I spent all day trying to speak with someone from support to get a refund and the only option they gave me was to void the cancellation and stick it out for the month I already paid for. I finally gave in and let them do this, making an appointment with a new prescriber I have never seen before just so I could get medication refilled since I was ignored by the other prescriber. Now a day later I got a new email from a different person from support who canceled my membership AGAIN and I have now lost the new appointment as well. 

So please, save your money and try to find someone in person to help you because you will get no relief from anxiety from cerebral. All you will get is increased anxiety and have your money taken from you to not be able to do anything on their app.

My experience with Cerebral was OK but ended with what I deem unethical business. * The service is pretty easy to use for the most part although there really isn't much to it. * I signed up with a heavily discounted promo with no problem. They do not work with my insurance so I have to self claim. I first met with a prescriber who informed me they are not allowed to go above my current level of meds so prescribed me one to work with what I already take. I was to meet with her again in a month to determine if I need to keep it or try something different. I had already decided it wasn't for me. * Cerebral says you can text with your therapist. Not exactly. You are assigned case workers. You message them and they pass your message on to your counselor. So don't tell them anything too confidential. * I informed them I wished to cancel my service before the first month ended for reasons not pertaining to Cerebral. They recommend making such requests a week before month's end to ensure you don't get charged for the next month. * An hour before my last appointment with my councilor I received several emails. They sent me another prescription and charged me $20, canceled my service immediately and canceled my last appointment with my therapist. * So much for our wrap up session. **UPDATE** Cerebral refunded the $20. A week later they withdrew $325 from my bank! Mind you, my account is deactivated. I emailed them and received a confusing run-around type apology. Still waiting for THAT refund.

If I could give this 0 stars, I would. I had one appointment with my ‚Äúcare‚Äù provider, and it was the most uncomfortable experience I‚Äôve ever had with a doctor. She was slouched back, with RBF on the whole time. She seemed annoyed and angry. She also didn‚Äôt look at me once. I started using this program so I wouldn‚Äôt have to pay $200 a visit to see a local doctor, it had 5 stars‚Ä¶. So I thought I‚Äôd give it a try. I regret it. I have crippling anxiety, and this appointment gave me nothing but that. And I was forced to sit through it for an hour. I explained to her that my current treatment of almost 2 years was keeping me out of the hospital. And she told me she didn‚Äôt think it was working (though I haven‚Äôt found myself in a hospital gown since starting) she stated she would prescribe my current medication as a courtesy. I asked her twice to contact my prior provider so she can get some background as to where I was prior to treatment, and where I am now. She declined. That night I had my first panic attack in weeks. And one of the worst ones I‚Äôve had in awhile. I took my last emergency medication, as she said she sent over the other prescription. The next day it wasn‚Äôt there, the day after that was thanksgiving, and yesterday they had gotten it‚Ä¶.but no usage. So, it couldn‚Äôt be filled. 10 phone calls from me, a few from my pharmacy, and two emails later and I finally got a response via email, that they sent my request to another team member and it could take 24 hours, and to give it more time as it‚Äôs the weekend‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. I‚Äôve been taking melatonin to help me sleep through the non stop panic attacks for 3 days now‚Ä¶literally doing whatever I can to not go to the ER because of Covid. I think I‚Äôd rather pay $200 per visit for a doctor who will care, listen, and is reachable. Don‚Äôt come here if you have crippling mental health issues that prevent you from having a life.
Just don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs all about money and so surface level.

ü•∞To be clear, the doctors and customer service is amazing! ü•∞
But the app is a confusing mess. My problem is with the links at the bottom of the page. The first link messages takes you to a screen with a typing box. It has no way of choosing who on your ‚Äúccc‚Äù team you message. Also, it‚Äôs incredibly difficult to figure out who is who. They have made up 2 titles for the people on my team. Cerebral Care Counselor and Cerebral Care Coordinator. Someone has a thing for alliteration, but these titles aren‚Äôt established anywhere else and seem randomly designated. The Counselor is the person you talk to about meds. The Coordinator is person who literally counsels you. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è To top it off, the titles are so long that on the only screen you can type on you only see the first 6 example letters of each doctors name ‚ÄúRichar‚Ä¶‚Äù with ‚ÄúCerebral C‚Ä¶‚Äù to distinguish who is who. Unacceptable. Then there‚Äôs the Appointment‚Äôs link. At the top of the page says in faded letters ‚ÄúSchedule Appointments‚Äù but it‚Äôs not a link it‚Äôs just literally faded letters on a screen. Below that is ‚ÄúComplete Monthly Self-Assessment‚Äù with a start button. Which takes you to a 33 question test. Each question is on a separate screen. Each time you answer a question it takes you to the next screen, but you have to manually scroll up every page to see the question being asked. It‚Äôs cumbersome, and needlessly time consuming. Ironically, you‚Äôre being asked about how hard it is for you to finish repetitive tasks. It also looks like if you answer all these repetitive question (33!!!) you might be taken to a screen where you can schedule an appointment. Imagine the frustration of taking a 33 question self assessment when all you want to do is schedule your next appointment only to find that the assessment has nothing to do with making an appointment. To be fair, I am autistic with PTSD and ADHD. But to be BLUNT AS FOOK, I am exactly the type of person this program was made for. The accompanying app should be more sensitive to its clientele. It should have the most intuitive interface possible. It should be designed to be navigable when under extreme stress or when having a bad reaction to new medication. As it is, they have a panic button, but it doesn‚Äôt explain what that means. I was afraid it would alert authorities which is the worst thing to do in most situations if you are Atypical and a minority. However, I did just use it now to see what it was, sure that I was calm enough to handle police if it comes to that. But it turns out it‚Äôs just a series of overly long typed out calming tasks. Who can read paragraphs when having a panic attack? It‚Äôs useless. At the least they should have a Siri type talk you through it. Gods, even banks let you feel like you‚Äôre talking to a person when trying to reach a human. To be clear, I love my doctors. But if I could access them in any other way, I would drop this app in a heartbeat. I‚Äôm looking into Hims. Though as a queer man, I‚Äôd prefer not to go somewhere so male oriented.
Prove you have people certified

First of all, these people handout ADHD diagnoses like it‚Äôs nothing and ask almost no questions, with no true evaluation to assure the ADHD diagnosis before prescribing medications. This is so harmful and dangerous, especially when it comes to stimulants, which are known to be abused. People with addiction issues can be prescribed medications on here with no hesitation from the provider and people could also potentially be on here to get drugs to sell. I personally have been to a real psychiatrist since I was in elementary school and have been through thorough testing to know I do have ADHD and I already know the medication that works for me, so I wasn‚Äôt harmed by their practice as much, but I was SHOCKED after my first appointment at how incredibly easy it was for me to get prescribed medication from here with no questions, my provider told me and I quote ‚Äúoh you are in college, you definitely will need this‚Äù in reference to Vyvanse. He also was so inappropriate asking me if I was a daddy‚Äôs girl and joked about marrying me and ‚Äúbreaking up‚Äù with me whatever that meant‚Ä¶ but it wasn‚Äôt just him because this service will also switch your provider all the time without warning, I have had 4 prescribers in the span of 6 months‚Ä¶ also they cancel appointments frequently leaving you without medication for weeks at a time. With stimulants the pharmacy‚Äôs are very strict with the number of days between pick up, so obviously you can‚Äôt schedule appointments so early and you schedule them on the specific dates for a reason, but they will cancel without warning and not have another available appointment for MONTHS‚Ä¶ how in the world are you expecting me to just not have medication that I need for months‚Ä¶ the medication I take doesn‚Äôt need to be weened off of, so that‚Äôs not a problem, but with some antidepressants this would be a huge issue and could cause horrible withdrawal issues. For me the whole not having my meds has happened so many times and this time is happened during my midterm week‚Ä¶ awesome‚Ä¶. This is the worst prescription service in history, it‚Äôs also incredibly dangerous and does not take diagnosis and medication seriously at all. It scares me and this is supporting the misuse of ADHD medications for sure and it‚Äôs disgusting to see how careless they are. They should be ashamed.

I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed!! I‚Äôve been struggling mentally and I wanted to try something new. I signed up for the care counselor and medication. Our sessions were only 30min each. I do want to say that the care counselor was amazing and provided great info. But again 30min was just not enough! If you don‚Äôt have a mental disorder, you will after dealing with this company!! Horrible! I‚Äôm absolutely disgusted with this company. It‚Äôs a complete and total SCAM! I paid over $300 and talked to a prescriber on a Sunday that told me she couldn‚Äôt help me and that someone else would reach out to me within the next day or two. Three days go by and I reached out to Support‚Ä¶these are the emails that followed: Wednesday: Hello, I had a session with prescriber Michelle on Sunday and she said someone would be reaching out to me to schedule a follow up by Tuesday, but it‚Äôs Wednesday and I haven‚Äôt heard anything yet. Is it possible to schedule that here? Thanks, Justin S. Thursday: Hi Judith, (They couldn‚Äôt even get my name right from an email) Good day! You just had the visit 4 days ago. It usually takes 3 months before a client receives a notification for a follow up visit. Best, Julius D Thursday evening: Hi Julius, First, my name is Justin, not Judith. Secondly, the prescriber said she wanted a second opinion regarding bipolar disorder.   You‚Äôre telling me this second opinion takes 3 months and I‚Äôm to pay $900 in the meantime before even being prescribed medication? If that‚Äôs the case, where may I find information on cancelling your services? This has been a momentous waste of my time and money. I‚Äôm very happy to share my experience with other people as needed as well. Your asking me to pay nearly $1000 to wait for nothing, and it‚Äôs a scam. Finally, it doesn‚Äôt matter if I just had a visit 4 days ago or 4 minutes ago, you should at least take the time to look into my concern because I genuinely hope this is just an oversight due to laziness on your part to not just simply look into it. So, for the second time: I was supposed to receive a call Monday or Tuesday to schedule the visit with that second prescriber to discuss bipolar disorder and I haven‚Äôt been able to schedule it. Are you going to look into it and have them reach back out or give me the resources to get in touch with that person, or are you not? Michelle didn‚Äôt say 3 months, she said two days and I‚Äôm on day four now‚Ä¶ Thanks, Justin S Friday: Hi Justin, Good day! I do apologize. I'm terrible with names. I'm sorry to hear that you've decided to discontinue receiving mental health services from Cerebral. In order to move forward with the cancellation process, please fill out the following form. Once you have filled it out, kindly wait for the cancellation team to contact you regarding cancellation or any other requests. It is important to note that your subscription will remain active until this has been completed and a Coordinator confirms cancellation. Upon completion, you can expect a member of our Coordination team to be in touch with you regarding the status of your request. Once your cancellation has been processed, you will continue to have access to your records through Cerebral, but your treatment and medication plan will be suspended, and any upcoming appointments will be removed. We look forward to speaking with you soon. Best, Julius D Friday afternoon: Hi Julius, Looks like you opted to lose a customer instead of helping them. What a shame! I‚Äôll be sharing this experience, as well as these emails anywhere I‚Äôm able to review your company. People need help, and your company is preying and scamming on innocent people and if I can keep just one person from giving you a dime, I did them a better service than you or your company has ever dreamed of. Not sure how you can sleep at night‚Ä¶ Good luck, Justin S Employees for this ‚Äúmental health organization‚Äù have zero interest in assisting, listening, or supporting their patients and that‚Äôs all the wrong things to be when you‚Äôre supposedly in the business of ‚Äúhelping people‚Äù BUYER BEWARE!!! DO NOT GIVE YOUR MONEY OR PERSONAL INFORMATION TO THIS COMPANY!!! *Update* Immediately after the reviews were posted, Cerebral scrambled to ‚Äúfix‚Äù it and quiet me down. They offered discounts, refunds, etc; however I‚Äôm not looking for money, I‚Äôm looking to keep someone from making the same mistake I made. Cerebral has asked me to modify my review since this is an ‚Äúisolated incident‚Äù but I encourage you to read some of the countless other negative reviews which cite similar incidents as mine. I stand by my statement- BUYER BEWARE!! It shouldn‚Äôt take this much effort to be heard and understood by people claiming they listen and understand.

Be careful, they give you a very good cheap price for the FIRST PAYMENT but later on it goes UP TRIPLE THE PRICE. I told her I still believed it was adhd and she just brushed it off and said ‚Äúwell that‚Äôs something you need to speak to your counselor about‚Äù. Later on I went to a health clinic and got diagnosed with ADHD and Currently I am on Medication. After that I tried to delete my account and get a FULL REFUND, and it was a PAIN. DO NOT GIVE UP! CALL THEM AND EMAIL THEM! But most importantly when your on call tell them you want to speak to a MANAGER or someone that they can provide that is at there highest rank of customer service. And that your are NOT the only one that this has happened to, that you have seen videos, websites and reviews talking about the same thing. (Make sure to mention this cuz this seems to be the only way that they will give your a refund). Whoever your going to be on the phone with is going to give you all these excuses and explanations as in why they don‚Äôt give refunds and blah blah blah, DONT FALL FOR IT, PUT YOUR FOOT DOWN AND KEEP ASKING FOR YOUR REFUND! That you will not use the services no more! They might say the only thing we can do is give you a 30% refund, don‚Äôt accept it and tell them that you still want to talk to a manger and you still want your FULL refund regardless and that you want your account to be CANCELLED IMMEDIATELY. The thing that makes me want to give any stars at all is the care team, otherwise it‚Äôs just been worthy of no stars in my experience. 
I have been using cerebral for about three months and every month I have had an issue. 
The biggest thing is that I have never been able to schedule all of my appointments each month due to lack of availability on their end the fact that they can only schedule one appointment at a time. The first month I signed up out of desperation, I really needed some help, but when I signed up and paid I found out that the only available therapist wasn‚Äôt available until the next billing cycle. I asked customer service if I could just withhold payment until the next billing cycle so I could pay when services could be provided. The response was a simple ‚Äúno refunds‚Äù kind of response without offering any kind of productive help for the situation so I was rightfully angry and ready to cancel my credit card. Luckily I talked to another representative the next day who helped but was only able to find someone who was available halfway through the billing cycle so I paid full price for half the service but half service is better than no service and I really needed the help. And honestly, if you are struggling, there‚Äôs just no room left in your brain to deal with this kind of issue. Each month there has been an issue and I‚Äôm experiencing a similar issue upon cancelling the service now. 

So in summary:

This service is only good for the staff they have actually caring for you. To them, I‚Äôm very thankful. However, the company policies of offering zero flexibility financially when they themselves cannot provide their services to you seems highly parasitic and the lack of helpful trained customer service is staggering and will leave you wondering if they even listen. It‚Äôs not worth the hassle. The experience is worth it if you can get the service you need but you will not know what kind of availability there is until you‚Äôve already paid and everything is scheduled on a rolling schedule so there‚Äôs never a guarantee of service. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs not always like this but it seems fairly common from the reviews I‚Äôve read after the fact so if you decide to use this company, ask yourself if you are willing to handle this possibility first.

I worked in mental health for 3+ years, and the focus of my education was on mental healthcare. I‚Äôve received care for depression/anxiety for 5+ years, and never had such a horrifying experience. From browsing reviews, my experience is not unique. This operation is a complete scam, operated by predatory, incompetent people who will lie to you. As of this writing, I‚Äôm waiting to see when or if my account will be cancelled. This is a scam to entrap customers into continuing to pay for a ‚Äúsubscription service‚Äù that does not deliver on services promised, with the fallback being to point to very sketchy T&Cs. Cerebral is preying on a vulnerable population. There‚Äôs already a class action suit mounting, and there‚Äôs many posts about similar experiences to mine. Avoid this service at all costs. *************************************************** 3/4: Signed up and met with a prescriber to continue on medication. She rescheduled 3 times without warning. ********************************** ****************1st week************************** 3/7: Only one of two meds were showing in my account. Messaged coordinator. They asked if my prescriber had the pharmacy information for my medication, which didn‚Äôt make since because I was using TruePill. 3/8: Coordinator said they‚Äôd reach out to prescriber and I‚Äôd have an update in 24h. No update came. 3/10: Coordinator said prescriber ordered meds and they were on their way. Only one med was showing in my account, and he said it was ‚Äújust a simple delay.‚Äù ******************************* ****************2nd week************************** 3/14: Coordinator said they needed to send one of my meds to a local pharmacy, I gave the address. 3/17: I asked for an update. Coordinator said they were ‚Äúworking on getting things sent to the pharmacy.‚Äù At this point, it‚Äôs been 2 weeks since I met with prescriber and I have begun to withdraw off my medication. ******************************** ****************3rd week************************** 3/21: Called and spoke to someone who escalated the issue and said I‚Äôd receive a call back within 24h. No call came. 3/22: Got someone on the phone who set up a meeting for me with a new prescriber that evening. Met with new prescriber, it went well. Coordinator asked if I had appt that evening and I confirmed that I did, with new prescriber. 3/23: Coordinator messaged me, saying my appt ‚Äúwas with the same [old] prescriber‚Äù and accused me of missing it. Everything about that is incorrect. I emailed the cancellation email, but waited to fill out the form in the email until a day or two later to make sure my medication was filled. 3/26: New coordinator apologized for the previous coordinator‚Äôs error and confirmed I was correct. I said I wanted to cancel my account, and that I‚Äôd submitted the form but had not heard back. 3/27: Coordinator said they didn‚Äôt see a cancellation email from me and I needed to email and tell them everything again. The form specifically said that multiple submissions of the form would cause a delay in cancellation. I told new coordinator I‚Äôd already submitted it, and it was their job to resolve it.
The audacity of this company taking advantage of the people who need help.

There are a lot of bugs with this app and usability flaws. 

Particular ones that bug me include:

Going to look at settings will result in receiving two emails stating confirmation of setting changes (when no changes were made). 

When choosing a care counselor I clicked on a picture to see if I could learn more about them and it selected them as my counselor with no way to go back or change my selection. I emailed customer service and they said I should be able to change them but tried in browser and app and couldn‚Äôt and asked them to tell me how and they ended up just telling me to email them if I want to change my counselor. But how would I even know who I want to change to? 

Odd ones include email confirmations of invoice numbers that didn‚Äôt include the number.

My app also shows I was charged for an upgrade I cancelled but customer service says they show they don‚Äôt have that charge.

Also it has been almost 2 weeks since my prescriber appointment and it took almost a week of my app saying prescription approved before I reached out to ask for an ETA that the coordinator told me my prescription was rejected by insurance.  I decided to go out of pocket and they put in one prescription and forgot the other. Then that prescription got filled finally and the other one has been waiting for the prescriber to get back to the pharmacist for some sort of confirmation. 

Getting access to the app was easy and the communication with my prescriber was supportive but so far the actual service is proving to be frustrating and inefficient.

When I started Cerebral it was great. They put me on two medications that changed my quality of life drastically. My anxiety was severe and now it‚Äôs nearly nonexistent. 

However, the service and response time has gotten awful. When they changed my dose my medication price doubled without warning. I have OptumRx prescription insurance and have requested that they transfer my prescription since my medication would cost a third of what i‚Äôm currently
paying. It‚Äôs been nearly a month since my request. They responded saying they would get back to me. Exactly 10 days later I still hadn‚Äôt heard from them so I gave them a nudge. Same response, they‚Äôll get back to me. I told them i was nearly out of medication and asked that they refill my prescriptions once more while I wait for the transfer since I was almost out of pills. As of today I still have not gotten anywhere with this and I have less than two days of medication left. The refill hasn‚Äôt shipped nor has it even been processed. I am terrified of what will happen when I run out of medication. Withdrawals from a strong dose of antidepressants can be catastrophic. I rely heavily on the anxiety medication as well. At this point I don‚Äôt know what to do. Every time I ask for an update I get the same response: they‚Äôre looking into it and will get back to me.

The only reason I gave two stars is because they prescribed me medication that gave me my life back. Now i‚Äôm worried that i‚Äôll be worse off than before I started the medication when I start to go through withdrawals. 

If you are fine with subpar service, poor communication and having no choice but to get medication through them at their price,
go for it.
Terrible and misleading

This service has major potential.

The upside: 

1 - the prescribers are fantastic. They listen to you and work with you to develop a treatment plan for the short term along with long term goals and/or long term contingency plans. For the first time in my life I was treated with care and understanding for my conditions and issues. Those with mental health issues certainly know the treatment they receive when seeking help from typical medical professionals. 

2 - the ‚Äúidea‚Äù of this service is fantastic. The idea that you have a faster track to your prescribers and the fact that they are able to send medication directly to your home removes the extremely strenuous challenges that those attempting to obtain typical mental health medication experience. 

The downside: 

1 - the first contradicts my upside point #2. The problem is it is just that ‚Ä¶.an ‚Äúidea‚Äù. The execution of this idea is what is lacking. You have a dedicated customer service agent that provides direct fast access to your prescriber and is also responsible for ensure your prescriptions are filled and sent as well as billing and insurance questions. The issue is that the service you receive is fantastic, when you receive it. They ask that you use a messaging system to communicate with your rep. You will be lucky to get a response once per day. If they do not answer your questions in full, you will need to wait until the next day for clarification or another response. 

2 - the timeliness of delivering your medications. Those of you would need a treatment plan that includes a medication know how important consistency is when it comes to your mental health. They simply cannot figure out how avoid issues that interrupt your schedule with medications. It is almost normal practice that I am without my medication for 7-10 days each month. This is disappointing considering I pay a premium, out of pocket, to receive my medication directly from them (or their pharmacy, etc). On top of that, I have to be the one to proactively work to find out why my medication did not ship, when it will ship and to make matters worse there is zero increased urgency in this situations. 

So you will pay a premium for your prescriptions, they will be severely late to arrive and you will have to track all of this down on your own and you have to expect to do all this working off of maybe one response from your care rep each day. This is on top of the monthly fee you pay to have this service (besides the expensive cost of the medications).
Scam.

Cerebral is a fast growing company that is doomed to fall even quicker if it does not figure some key elements out.

First off the pros:

The Care Coordinators are responsive, however they dont know much, this is to be expected as they seem to not have access to much when it comes to the actual customer.

You can get medication quite easily. If you know what you need (previous diagnosis) they make it easy. 

Thats it.

Now the Cons:

Care Counselor conversations are incredibly transactional. This person is not someone that has an educational background in Psychology it seems, but more so a box checker- ‚ÄúDo you have feelings of ____ if so you can take ___‚Äù over 6 months I had a total of 30 minutes spent with my counselor.

Because of the lack of personalizations and frankly lack of true care I was experiencing, i decided to cancel my subscription. 

Now heres where it gets fun. The cancellation process is GRUELING. They truly are aiming at making you not cancel and it feels very gaslighty. The team is not very responsive at all. Oh and I cancelled March 10th and they charged me for my April ‚Äúsubscription‚Äù. 

Its very apparent that Cerebral is more focused on making their money than caring about their customer base. The company seems so promising until you experience the lack of care that should be present in a company that is dealing with people that need help and are looking for help.

If I was in dire need and this was my first experience trying to get help I would be concerned for myself. 

So much potential to change lives but the company seems focused on the numbers instead.
This app is a scam, don‚Äôt trust it. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY!!!

The service is a good means to an end, it offers access to treatments for a set of mental health conditions that make it particularly difficult to access care ‚Äî multi-month waits for appointments, the stress of in-person visits, etc. This eliminates a lot of the burden felt by those suffering from executive dysfunction.

Massive concerns almost everywhere else. I am currently on day 7 of what is looking to be 9 days total of clerical hassle trying to get my prescription to be affordable ‚Äî they first prescribed a brand name medication that my insurance would not cover, and also mishandled the prior authorization process so my insurer wasn‚Äôt properly contacted. 

Additionally, when prompted to schedule my next visit with my prescribing physician, I can see that she has zero availability for the next three months. From what i understand, I am to start a medication this month which requires more frequent visits than that in order to keep having access to. 

To make all of this worse, communication there is abysmal ‚Äî the responses via messages in the app are not as prompt as advertised. I have spoken to two people there on the phone (which is it‚Äôs own accomplishment ‚Äî the phone tree there makes this extremely difficult to access as it just tries to redirect you to use the app for all but one set of choices) and it is abundantly clear that you need a phone conversation to get quality correspondence out of them.

I think this all amounts to playing a dangerous game when they are prescribing medications that are habit-forming, like amphetamines, or which are outright dangerous to stop cold turkey, like many SSRIs. If they cannot provide reliable assistance for their patients it will lead to avoidable gaps in medication. This kind of sloppy, disorganized conduct will end up causing the very patients they set out to help to suffer unnecessary withdrawal symptoms.

I might still encourage people to use this as a way to kickstart their mental healthcare, but only as a stepping stone. My next priority is to transition my care into a local doctor‚Äôs office where I might actually feel like I have advocates. I would strongly recommend only using this service as that sort of stopgap, as there are some glaring red flags regarding communication and reliability that make it look like a bad long-term plan.

Cerebral makes claims they cannot meet. 

The first claim they did not meet is being affordable and accepting of my insurance. I submitted my insurance information and was only told the prices after insurance coverage. Turns out my insurance doesn‚Äôt work with cerebral so I was charged the full amount, $325, without being notified ahead of time. I do not think $325 monthly fee is affordable by any means. 

The second claim is that you would be able to speak with your therapist on a weekly basis. My first two sessions were about two weeks apart. Then after weeks of calendar confusion, on the therapists part, I finally got an appointment with my therapist who told me he is overwhelmed with the amount of patients he is getting on top of his private practice. He said it was unethical because he couldn‚Äôt effectively have therapeutic sessions and his wait time was a month and a half out! He wound up leaving cerebral after weeks of not being able to schedule him. 

The third claim is that you would be able to see a provider when ever you need. My provider would cancel on me four or more times regularly. I was prescribed a medication that needed a follow up and was not able to get that on time. My prescription was increased and I had very bad reactions to it, life altering reactions, but could not get an appointment with my provider so I stopped taking them cold turkey which is not recommended and was a horrible experience. 

The forth claim is that you could message your provider and therapist at any time. This is completely untrue. You have a team coordinator who can transfer the message over but doesn‚Äôt or maybe does but you never hear back from your therapist or provider.

I have contacted their support team 7 times asking for a refund for the last two months where I had zero services provided but charged a whopping $325 monthly!! Every time I get the same response about cancelling on the app. They completely disregard the content of my emails and send the exact same response. I should be refunded for my entire experience because I never received the services that were promised. I also had two months of horrible reactions to the medication I was given and horrible reactions getting off of the medication. I was unable to work or leave my house for almost two months! Save your time and money and find a therapist and provider in your area that will actually be able to see you effectively. 

It seems like cerebral bit off way more than they could chew and then ignore you when you‚Äôve had enough of them not fulfilling their promised obligations. They completely altered my life and were unresponsive and have the audacity to copy and paste a generic email response from their support team.
The worst team of doctors ever

just to start my care counselor missed our first appointment because she got the time zones confused. at the time i was a single mom working 2 jobs so it was really inconvenient for me to have to find another time. not to mention i had time set aside that was just wasted. apparently there‚Äôs no way for the care counselor to indicate she was the one who missed the appointment so ultimately it looked like i was the one who failed to be available. the sessions with my care counselor were not exactly impressive. i think i‚Äôve experienced more help from friends. i did not feel
like she cared or was really listening to me but more or less checking things off of a list. it actually seemed to me that she was doing a worksheet and just asking me for the answers. i gave it another chance and in the second appointment she didn‚Äôt even ask about the main topic of our previous appointment. i decided this wasn‚Äôt for me and did not make any further appointments. i began to receive emails almost every day about how if i didn‚Äôt schedule an appointment then care plan would expire and i thought great i don‚Äôt want to use this service anymore let it expire. i didn‚Äôt realize, and they weren‚Äôt exactly forthcoming with the info, that i would have to formally submit a written request to cancel my subscription. after i went digging i found this out and immediately sent in my request for cancellation. the next day i was charged twice for cerebral‚Äôs service even though it had been weeks since i had even used their service. this was extremely upsetting because now i couldn‚Äôt afford to pay my electricity bill. i am already under a ton of stress being a single mom and working, having to take days off when my son is exposed to covid, losing out on pay, and now
cerebral adds to it by taking $170 out of my account based on ‚Äúwell technically you owe it‚Äù
i understand that companies have policies in order for them to be profitable but i don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a good look to essentially scam those who are already vulnerable and seriously struggling with day to day life.

For months I have complained about how I can‚Äôt make appointments through the app and nothing happens. My team said they msged support, I sent emails to support, no response.

After a year being on the app I had to start relying in my care team to make my appointments. Sometimes random people would come into the chat to ‚Äòhelp me‚Äô only for the next random person to not read the chat and have to start conversations all over again. Sometimes this would go on for weeks and I‚Äôd pay for a month where I got no appointments.

The last straw was when my prescribed was promoted. I made an appointment with the new prescriber given to me and it was canclled 20 minutes before the appointment. Then I was told my new prescriber, the one just given to me that I needed to update my expiring prescription, was booked solid for 6 months. The random care team ‚Äòhelper‚Äô offered to help me find a new prescriber. When I said sure, the next two days had a new random team member, not reading what was previously said and telling me I needed to make an appointment. With a provider who didn‚Äôt have an availability for 6 months.

A real lack of communication and me paying all the while for no service or appointments. I unsubscribed from the service.

Since unsubscribing I have gotten the same ‚ÄúYou cancelled you service email, 20 times. Sometimes 3 or four in a 5 minute period. I tried to msg them about the issue, but only got an automated response.

I‚Äôve also been charged for my medication 3 times. On the 6th, 9th and 15th. When I finally got on the website to msg my care team, (because the app no longer works after you cancel) I was greeted by another random care team person, who told me to email an address I had been emailing for months about my appointment issue with no response.

Up front this app seems great. I had one year of happiness. But the management of clients and employees is horrible. Once one thing changes the whole system crumbles. In the end Cerebral caused me more stress than it was worth.

I‚Äôve been a member of cerebral for 3.5 months now. I was initially diagnosed with severe anxiety and moderate depression (which is accurate, as I was previously seeing a doctor with the same diagnosis). I like how convenient Cerebral is and both my prescriber & care counselor are very nice and supportive. It‚Äôs also very affordable for people who do not have insurance. 

However, there are two huge cons for me. The first major con being the lapse in medication. I have 2 medications; one I have to take consistently on a daily basis with no lapse between doses or withdrawal symptoms can occur, and the other medication is one I take as needed when my anxiety is especially high. Currently, my daily medication runs out in 2 days, yet my refill has not been mailed out yet. Every time I try contacting someone to see where my medication is, I get no response. I‚Äôm truly worried about having no medication in 2 days and worried about what withdrawal symptoms I may experience because of it. This is a huge problem. My medications have always shipped on the 9th of the month, but it‚Äôs now the 10th and no shipment. Very unprofessional and concerning. 

My second concern is the absolute lack of communication between the prescriber and care counselor. For example, my appointment with my prescriber 4 weeks ago, she informed me that both of my medications would now be mailed to me (previously only 1 was mailed and the other was sent to my local pharmacy) and she said my medications would ship early (July 28th instead of August 9th), because she increased the dose of one medication and wanted that to get to me asap. However, my care counselor wasn‚Äôt aware of any of this and told me my medication would not be shipped on the 28th and she didn‚Äôt see anything that noted my 2nd medication now being shipped. As a patient, this is very frustrating, especially since you can only communicate regularly with the care counselor, but not the prescriber. Also frustrating as I was told my medications would ship early on July 28th, yet here I am on August 10th and neither of my medications have shipped. Even communication between my care counselor and myself has seemed to decrease and I‚Äôm not sure why. 

Initially, this started out as a great way to seek help for anxiety and depression, but now it‚Äôs spiraling into a nightmare. I really hope they improve their consistency in shipping medications as well as their communication, because I believe this has the potential to be a terrific tool for people with mental health disorders, but for now, I‚Äôd say avoid Cerebral as it will only increase anxiety.

I purchased an entry level subscription to this service in hopes to getting back into therapy after taking a break.  I have experience with licensed therapists and have seen several in the past.  I saw an ad for this service and figured I would give it a go.

If you have gone to therapy before, you know that it can be an exhausting experience and one that you sometimes need to mentally prepare for.  My experience with this app left me feeling worse than I did when I tried getting back into my journey.  

At first, things seemed ok. You go through and come plate a profile that asks for personal information and even attempts to try and help to see if health insurance can help cover - which was appreciated.  However, once I input my information in I was only offered one care counselor to choose from.  I even attempted to go back and remove specific things I was struggling with in hopes of getting an array of counselors to try and see who I would connect best with.  After three attempts to shift my choices, I decided I would attempt a meeting with the one and only counselor I was presented with.  Based on only one option, the calendar was hard to schedule with and I had to pick a date two weeks in advance to get a time that matched with my schedule. I didn‚Äôt think too much into this and started to mentally prepare for the visit.  Once my visit came along, I was on my call five minutes in advance and prepared to try and connect with the counselor.  My counselor was late to the meeting and once connected, proceeded to tell me that she didn‚Äôt have access to my records and was not able to meet with me at that moment.  I was a little surprised as I did not have any warning or messaging that anything was awry.  I didn‚Äôt think too deeply into this and agreed to schedule another time once her follow up email was sent.  To my surprise, the counselor listed me as a ‚Äúno show‚Äù to the appointment (that I was present/early on) and I received an email stating that I missed the appointment and ‚Äúwe get it things happen‚Äù.

I honestly felt worse mentally after the attempt at the appointment and shocked at the counselor marking me as absent.  I cancelled my account immediately and asked for a refund.  When support responded back says later, they told me I should have read closer into the fine print and that refunds were not available to customers.

The whole experience was something I have advised against anyone else going through.  Very disappointed in this company and how they made me feel when attempting to get help/someone to talk to.

I had zero issues with my prescriber and my counselors (my original counselor left a couple of months after I started). Both were eager to listen, to help, and were truly empathetic and understanding. In short, if you are looking for a program that is fairly passive, Cerebral may be fine for you. If you need anything more than a recurring prescription and some basic guidance and exercises, avoid this service.

I had been on a leave of absence from my job due to the issues I was facing, and upon my first visit with both my counselor and my prescriber, I made this known. I also made it known that I would need a letter clearing me to return to work. I was told this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. When I requested that letter, it took over a month for me to receive it. I reached out to my support coordinator and their email support multiple times, just to be given the same canned response that they could not provide that, even though Cerebral‚Äôs own website has specific instructions on how to request that type of document.

Only after my appointment with my counselor where I could explain the situation to her did I get anywhere. She explained my prescriber would be the person I needed to talk to, but I was unable to schedule an appointment with her. My counselor helped me to get an appointment, and upon meeting with the prescriber and explaining the situation, she was shocked at the trouble I had been through getting such a simple request fulfilled. She told me that I would have the note from her in my email within 24 hours, but she actually got it to me in about 20 minutes.

While my counselors and prescriber helped me get through the issues I was initially facing when I started, the resulting financial hardship and strain that resulted from being out of work over a month longer than I expected due to Cerebral‚Äôs lack of care about anything more than collecting a recurring payment from me has brought on a new set of issues. While I intend to maintain my treatment, it will most definitely be through a different company.

I started Cerebral in January of 2022 as a convenient way to get medication for my anxiety prescribed, and got the $85/month subscription for medication and counseling. In the 4 months I‚Äôve had the app, I have seen my prescriber a few times and my care counselor once. I contacted Cerebral earlier this week to ask to cancel the counseling portion of my membership as my care counselor never reached out to schedule an appointment past my first session. Cerebrals customer service number told me I could ‚Äúschedule an appointment with my care counselor if I wanted‚Äù which is untrue. Through the app, unless an appointment is requested to be scheduled by my care team, I‚Äôm unable to make an appointment. Apparently, people who are struggling with mental health are supposed to have to also go out of their way to advocate to receive the service that they are paying for. 

I also had a lapse in medication this week due to an error with my prescriber. I messaged my care team as well as called Cerebral customer service to see what could be done. Customer service told me they would reach out to my prescriber and get back to me within 24-48 hours. After being without my medication for over 2 days, I messaged my care team again, 24 hours after my original message was sent. I was experiencing withdrawal symptoms from not having my medication and expressed I was worried about not taking it for an extended period of time based on the side effects I was having. I had messaged my care team a total of 2 times over a 24 hour period. I got a message from my care team over 26 hours after my original message was sent giving me a ‚Äúgentle reminder‚Äù that they are not a live service and to not message them more than once in a row. I suppose that I was supposed to just be relaxed about my lapse in medication for over 2 days and lack of response from the people responsible for prescribing it for me as I was experiencing bad withdrawal symptoms. 

After getting a call back from cerebral customer support and receiving my medication, I went to cancel my service. One of their options on their customer support number is to cancel service, and when you press the number, it tells you to email a certain email. I did so, and the email sent me back an automated response asking me to fill out a form. This process for cancelling by having to go through 3 different routes seems absolutely ridiculous for people who are seeking help for mental illness. 

Cerebral is absolutely not made for people with mental illnesses in mind. If I can‚Äôt get prompt response for emergent situations, such as receiving my needed medication, and am not receiving counseling, what in the world was I paying $85 a month for? I have picked up my last month of prescription and cancelled and will be finding a new mental health service.

After two months of this app I have decided that everyone should know my experience. I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews but this is important and you should know before you join. 

From the start it was rocky road:

1) while onboarding I was not able to complete my orientation for at least 24 hours as there was a bug in the system‚Äî I was paying for something I couldn‚Äôt access. Which okay I get things happen but it wasn‚Äôt a great first impression.

2) My first appointment with my prescriber was very impersonal. She did not smile seem interested or act very caring about what I needed other than ‚ÄúI had a lot going on‚Äù. We all have had days but this was my first interaction and I was underwhelmed by her attitude.

3) For my first appointment with my care counselor, I woke up early and was on time, but she did not join. Turns out she quit and nobody informed me until a couple days later. My first payment I didn‚Äôt even see a care team member‚Äî only a prescriber because of the no show and based on the second ones availability. And the second one showed up 10 mins late!!! I thought here we go again. 

4) I kept getting a notification to make an appointment with my prescriber except she didn‚Äôt have any availability for the next six months and because I was on Adderall this is something that has to be prescribed every month as well as meeting with the prescriber. So I reached out to the care team who was able to find a date sometime next week. The problem was my medicine was going to run out by the end of this week and my prescriber wasn‚Äôt answering the care teams messages so I almost ran out of the medicine and we had to get an emergency supply to get me to the next appointment. I‚Äôve now found a local prescriber that will see me so I don‚Äôt have to deal with the inconsistencies of your platform. 

Overall, I‚Äôm really disappointed. I was hoping that this app would be a solution to me having a hard time finding a prescriber in my area. It‚Äôs only caused me headaches and stress‚Äî the exact thing I‚Äôm trying to avoid. How can you charge people money and not deliver consistently the services? Especially in mental health. I will not recommend this app to anyone because you cannot play around with someone‚Äôs mental health and you need to get actual doctors who are committed to the platform.

I signed up because I was tired of having KP cancel my appointments the day before and even minutes before the scheduled appointment. Having already coordinated with work for the time off to take these appointments meant when KP canceled I used PTO for nothing.

I signed up for therapy and medication services and booked the two appointments. A couple days later my therapy appointment was canceled and no reason was given and no option to rebook. The medication appointment did go through and I was switched to a different medication, which is what I wanted to do and have been trying to get in to see my psychiatrist with KP for the past six months to do. 

Then a week later I could book a therapy appointment and completed that one. But still can‚Äôt book a subsequent one. I had already booked a medication appointment for the following month, but the day of that one was canceled due to unforeseen circumstances and the next available one is two months away. 

In the mean time I have been out of my medication and sent a message. They assured me that the refill order has been sent to my pharmacy but every time I try to order it the pharmacy says they need to obtain approval from the doctor. I relay this message back to Cerebral and they replied with some generic sounding message that if I need refills to reply back with a message. So I reply again explaining what the pharmacy says and they reply asking if they are trying to get an insurance approval. Each message I sent has said ‚Äúapproval from the doctor‚Äù. 

So I‚Äôve been off my medication for a couple of weeks now and struggling really hard. I‚Äôve read the other comments about trying to cancel so I won‚Äôt even bother trying to cancel. I signed up using a disposable card number and paused it so it will just decline.

I‚Äôm shocked that this app has 5 stars. I assume it‚Äôs a lot of fake reviews seeing how most of the top recommended reviews reveal the true side of this terrible company.

I recently moved to Cali from a different state and had to change providers. I learned about Cerebral through social media (should‚Äôve been my first red flag). I thought I‚Äôd give it a try as I struggle with ADHD and often get frustrated when having to find new providers that work with my insurance. Unfortunately it has been a huge headache. They refuse to let you talk to your prescribers directly and instead want you to work through their support portal in order to talk to them. This game of telephone has lead to multiple errors from the prescriber as well as severe delays. Cerebral will tell you they need 3 days to communicate with the prescriber only for you to find out the wrong or incomplete info was given to the prescriber which causes another 3-5 day delay. If you want to actually talk to your prescriber directly you must schedule an appointment with them, but you‚Äôll be surprised to find out these prescribers are booked for more than a month out at a time so nothing can be done in a timely manner. This will prevent you from continuing or adjusting your medication which is not acceptable for a service you are paying out of pocket for on top of everything else.

If you think calling cerebral directly would work better to get issues resolved you‚Äôd be incorrect. They will provide little info and ask you for more time. If you want to speak directly to a higher up you‚Äôll also be put in a queue that will last several days before the higher up will contact you directly. What‚Äôs even more appalling is that anything you discuss over the phone is completely forgotten or not recorded for ‚Äúyour‚Äù support team of counselors within the app. So ‚Äúyour‚Äù counselors won‚Äôt take the necessary next steps to resolve the issue and you‚Äôll have to continue to follow up with your team within the app for several days.

This is a company that apparently prides themselves on providing adequate mental healthcare. However they do not actually care about your mental health as you are just another dollar sign. They spend more money on advertising than they do on hiring enough employees as well as training them to provide adequate service. If you have true mental health issues and are looking for help do not go to this company and risk the possibility of them making your mental health worse. I beg of you. They do not have your best interest at heart.
Their way of service is a lie ...

If you happen to join though told not to‚Ä¶. Stay away from Ovis. She is an incompetent liar. My whole experience is based off this woman and though I requested someone else, she was all I got. 
Talk about no one ounce of ability to listen‚Ä¶ they just want to pinhole you up in a category that simple for them. 
They are lazy, numerous times left awaiting while my work was at jeopardy to then (when they say ‚Äúif your more than 10 min late to meeting‚Äù but after having you wait hours before with a no show‚Ä¶ will cut you out at just a couple min after ( lost signal for just a moment) 
Ohhh they say one thing, without you getting a word in. So you plan on what they say‚Ä¶. Then, they tell you they said something else (oh, and they have is marked they said so! ) friken Liar, I know exactly what you said and I k now what you didn‚Äôt say, (and that was any questions I have) what, that you can‚Äôt answer because of (woop de doop de doo) 
I am on medication and yet, these people act like I am a drug addict!!! They treat you like one and seriously‚Ä¶. You are just a number on a phone call‚Ä¶. These people only care about your money!!  That‚Äôs it‚Ä¶. 
I have had so many moments of strife, demoralized, challenged as though ‚ÄúI am the one not listening‚Äù and this place has cause more episodes than it cares to say they help!  

This place is a fraud!!! (Not as bad as some
Of the other frauds‚Ä¶. But frauds regardless!) 

Find someone else, your well being may be saved in doing so.

I have been a member of cerebral for over a year. I used the service because I move around a lot and was looking for more consistency with my medication routine. At first, I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my service. I had a prescriber who cared and a care counselor who was useful and helped me in relevant ways. For instance, my initial prescriber went out of her way to help me get my medication at an affordable price and went so far as to call me on my personal cell phone to ensure that I was taken care of. 

Everything went down hill when that prescriber left the service. 

I have been bounced around to a new prescriber each month. This means that each month I must go over my entire medication history, relay trauma to a new person, and wait to get an appointment. Appointments with prescribers must be made two months in advance and most have very limited availability (like 10 PM EST). To be quite honest, that wouldn‚Äôt bother me too much as I was getting consistent care. 

But I‚Äôm not. 

Every month since May 2021 I have had to go a week without medication because my prescriber does not renew my prescription. Every month we go through the same routine (regardless of who my current prescriber is): I notice I have 7 pills left and message my care coordinator for a refill, three days later my care coordinator says they will contact my prescriber and let them know, after not hearing something for several days I contact again when I have one or two pills left, my care coordinator says they will contact my prescriber again and they will respond within 48 hours, I call customer service because I need medication, I go through sudden withdrawal for a day while I wait, I get my medication. 

If that wasn‚Äôt enough, I have been switched to a new medication regime with ABSOLUTELY NO NOTICE from my prescriber. I was given no instructions or warning that I would be forced to go through withdrawal from my medications I had previously been on. As of right now, I have been trying to contact my ‚Äúcare team‚Äù for over 48 hours for hep with no response. 

The worse part of this experience is I truly, genuinely need help. I have been left in a state where I cannot stand for more than 20 minutes at a time (no shower, no driving, no cleaning, no cooking, no working). I have used every appropriate avenue available to me and have still be IGNORED by this service. 

If you‚Äôre in a situation where you are looking to use this service, please do not. I am begging you. My mental health is absolutely worse since using this service. The worst part is I am now dependent on this medication and cannot terminate usage of the service until I can get an appointment with a psychiatrist who gives a crap about me.

I was very excited to be able to try this service for care. I have used previous companies in the past and truly have had positive results on all aspects of my life. 

This company on the other hand does not care about customer service. 

The availability of appointments times takes weeks (2 to 3) to be able do your initial visit. 

If you have any type of busy work schedule do to Covid or anything life events don‚Äôt try to reschedule!! They will Mark you as missed your appointment and charge you anyway saying you ‚Äúused their services‚Äù. The second appointment I was supposed to be sent a reschedule link and that came four days after my appointment. 

Rescheduling... that will add another 2 to 3 week wait to your visits. 

An entire month of service for not one visit. 

Then trying to reach out to customer care to explain the scenario. There seems to be zero training. My emails (because that was the ‚Äúbest‚Äù option to reach them) are returned days later. Finally I decided after a days of trying to cancel to try them by phone. 

I was met by a customer service rep who was dead set on telling me know. 

I explained my work situation and how I had lost my job previously to Covid and that I was so excited to use their service but it seemed impossible to see someone. She said it was my fault to cancel and didn‚Äôt care I was trying to simply reschedule. 

I asked for a supervisor to speak to instead because I felt very much unheard (which is crazy for a counseling service) which was met by multiple excuses. Finally she agreed and said someone would call me back. 

Instead I receive an email from the same woman not listening to me saying the decision was FINAL! No refund even if you didn‚Äôt use the services.

Please use a different service for you mental health needs. 

I am so passionate about finding your fit for Mental Health and this leaves so much to be desired. 

They kept my money for the first month. No other options given to me other providers with better availability, no. Credits? No. 

They do not care about their customer or mental health.

The premise and promise of the app and service is great. 

The only bright spot for me was meeting with my prescriber ‚Äî she was fantastic. However, there were several times that my appointment was cancelled shortly before our scheduled time. Once I was able to get an appointment, my prescriber asked me if everything was okay and wondered why I had cancelled our last meeting. I told her that I didn‚Äôt and it she was as confused as I was. 

I paid for 3 months and saw a care counselor once. Nice enough person but none of the information was new to me and I didn‚Äôt get much value out of the interaction. Mostly first-level advice and recommendations that you could get from a few books or blog posts. 

The customer support response time was slow and often many of my answers didn‚Äôt get resolved until the 2nd or 3rd time. I really wanted this service to work but unfortunately it seemed to be a lot of good ideas but poor execution. I had 3-4 meetings cancelled with my care counselor day-of and no explanation ‚Äî just an automated email notifying me of the cancelled appointment. Then, I‚Äôd go a try to reschedule and there wouldn‚Äôt be any available for 2+ months. Very frustrating and unreliable, especially when you‚Äôre dealing with mental health care. 

Perhaps they‚Äôll review this and other people‚Äôs feedback and improve. I realize that there is a huge demand and need for online mental health services and align with the premise of Cerbral but am disappointed with the overall experience. I‚Äôve worked in startups for most of my career and understand the challenges of scaling a company but would like to see an improvement in the CX before reconsidering the service.

I used this service for a year. 
1st: I did not want medication- just therapy. I have a trusted PA that I‚Äôve been working with for years.  I was in crisis. My first therapist tried to upswell me on my plan to include medication.  I was upset and crying and just dismissed it.  Our second session I stated ‚ÄúI will not be discussing that any time soon. I‚Äôm setting a boundary.‚Äù And she seemed receptive.  By the end of the call- I‚Äôm sobbing about how sad I am and how hard I‚Äôm struggling.  She suggests multiple sessions a week and I said that was something I was interested in.  She then proceeded to dump me.  At the end of my second session.  While I was still in crisis.
