They don‚Äôt provide that level of care- but she gave me a link to a local mental hospital I could go to get evaluated.  DISGUSTED.  I tried to cancel- and was talked into meeting a new therapist since I was already charged for the next 2 weeks.

2nd: this app GHOSTED ME. my new therapist was great. It‚Äôs why I was on this app for nearly a year.  She was not the problem.  Scheduling sucked.  You can‚Äôt schedule more than one session at a time- and can‚Äôt have a regular time slot.  Inconvenient but my therapist worked with me to set them up.  I‚Äôm in a pretty good place- but entering a VERY STRESSFUL situation (moving to a new country and starting a whole new life by myself).  I got very busy and forgot to schedule 2 or 3 weeks of appointments.  No one contacted me. I logged on to schedule an appointment and the app wouldn‚Äôt let me select the option.  I chalked it up to a glitch, and decided to try later.  The next three attempts over the next few days were the same. A full booking cycle had gone by and I had paid in full when I had zero sessions (AGAIN- WAS NOT CONTACTED). I got charged again- and reached out and was told that I didn‚Äôt complete the cancel.  I‚Äôm still jumping through hoops to cancel like this is a toxic gym membership and not tool for mental health.  I think my doctor was great- but I do wonder why she didn‚Äôt reach out, or if she was unable, why didn‚Äôt my ‚Äúcare team‚Äù reach out? 

Luckily, I made progress and am strong enough to make it through this- but I cannot imagine if I had been first dumped on the second session and then ghosted after nearly a year if I was still in a dark place.  Especially considering what both therapists knew what I was trying to heal.

 I‚Äôm my experience- if I failed to schedule- my therapist would have checked in until they knew I was safe.  There are good doctors working with this service- but for the App- it seems like a money grab. They continue to attempt to charge my card I have locked.

I was excited to start a virtual service, but my experience with Cerebral was an extreme let down. Additionally, if I had been in a poorer mental state this could have also been dangerous. 

I paid for medication management and care counseling. While there were expected frustrations like connectivity issues, late provider, or generic advice, the most egregious issue was with my medication management. 

During my first meeting with my prescriber, I made it very clear that I would not be taking a certain medication due to negative experiences in the past. Despite this, and without consulting me again, I was sent this medication. I contacted my ‚Äúcare team‚Äù and reminded them/expressed my concern, and they apologized and I was refunded the price of the medication. 

Then I was sent ANOTHER refill of this unwanted and unneeded medication, enough medication that could have easily been used to self-harm or at the least have negative side effects, which I was clear about in my very first meeting. 

After contacting my care team in addition to customer service, I was repeatedly asked me to explain the situation, which I did. My specific concerns about the potential dangers and unethical willingness to send out medication against a patient‚Äôs wishes, plus the lack of internal communication between members of the care team, were not addressed. I was merely offered a discount for the next few months of service. 

I asked for a refund of the undesired medication and for the month I did not use any counseling services since it was clear they were not listening, but these were not granted. 

Other less serious problems made it an annoying service: the advice or response from my counselor was problematic (wording suggesting we should be grateful for traumatic experiences) and the type of advice anyone could get from a Google search. 

I have had wonderful therapeutic experiences in the past, including virtual meetings. My experience with Cerebral, however, created more stress, anxiety, and exacerbated the concerns that prompted me to seek them out in the first place.

Used the app for two months. The app itself is a mess, lots of bugs, did not retain my insurance information, and the telemedicine function is also very janky. 

But I could forgive the above if the service was actually worthwhile. Basically, this is only worth anything at all if you have no insurance and just need access to medicine. The counseling function is worthless - 30 minutes a month and they forced me to changed counselors after one session with no notice or reason. Who wants to start working with a counselor and keep changing? 

I also had an issue where I had a bad experience with one of the prescriptions. I notified them and it went through what seems to be a bunch of different channels of decision makers until they finally got me a new prescription - but once that new prescription was filled, it pushed my other prescription‚Äôs refill date out two additional weeks. Now my monthly medication has a two week gap - not good for the obvious reasons.

When I relayed my issues to Cerebral, I got a canned ‚Äúsorry you are unhappy with your medication delivery‚Äù and offered me 30% off for three weeks. What? I‚Äôm saying there‚Äôs a whole host of issues, one of which is this odd delay in one of prescriptions, and this support agent boils it down to ‚Äúsorry we couldn‚Äôt get you your meds fast enough, here‚Äôs a discount.‚Äù 

This service is only worth it if you don‚Äôt have insurance and are in desperate need of *any* support for your mental health. It is not convenient, not personal, and does not make me feel like anything other than an active monthly user in this company‚Äôs pitch deck for their next round of funding. It is not a substitute for in person services if you have the good fortune of having solid health insurance.

UPDATE: Cerebral responded to my review about the company being impersonal with the same canned response from ‚ÄúMolly V.‚Äù Cerebral uses for every negative review. What a joke.

Cerebral tends to be money-hungry. Ironic for a mental-health app. 

Pros:

- My therapist was great. :)
- You get a selection of therapists that you can choose from
- You can dispute it with your bank for a refund, so that was nice!

Cons:

- I paid on August 28th for my September therapy sessions. I e-mailed in on August 29th to cancel my membership. Per my e-mail, I stated, ‚ÄúI understand that this month has already been paid for as I would like to finish up my therapy sessions for this month.‚Äù The Employee responded with, ‚ÄúI would advise to request your cancellation by 9 am PT one business day before your next scheduled billing date to cancel your account as we have no way to have it set to cancel at a specific date.‚Äù 

I understand there‚Äôs no way to set a specific date to cancel, so I requested to cancel asap as it‚Äôs understandably uncomfortable to rely on customer support to actually cancel a day prior to the next billing date. Once I cancelled my subscription, it *also* cancelled my service for the month that *I had already paid for*. This doesn‚Äôt make sense and is not customer-service friendly or mental-health friendly ‚Äî it comes off as a money-hungry company. Why would you cancel the service for the month that you had already paid ahead of time for?  When it comes to any other service that you pay ahead of time for, once you cancel and get the confirmation of cancellation, it is applicable to the next billing cycle as you maintain the service for the remainder of which you had already paid for. After asking one last time for a refund and kindly requesting for said Employee to provide some Customer Support, I was responded with:

‚ÄúPlease be advised that we operate on a subscription model, the monthly fee is not based on services being rendered (i.e., receiving new medication, meeting with a therapist or prescriber). I do know that this is not the response that you would like to receive, and I sincerely apologize that we cannot be more flexible here. I completely understand your disappointment and do hope that you are able to find care that is a great fit for you.‚Äù

The Employee was kind and respectful, but as a Customer Support employee myself who also works in a Subscription field, I do not think much customer support was provided, especially when I kindly asked  for a refund a couple of times. It was rather a robotic response with a lack of empathy; you *can* be more flexible, but you choose not to; you can escalate it, give a customer a one-time courtesy refund so that they will come back. This may very well not be the employee‚Äôs fault, but rather, upper management. Given this experience, I will choose to not come back.

I used Cerebral for months to get my prescriptions and although I like how the app and service is designed in some ways, I can now confidently say that Cerebral believes in exploiting those who are marginalized based on my recent experiences.

I was charged $85 for services for the month of June and was just told yesterday that they could not provide those services because I do not have a state ID for the state I just moved to. For further context, I did NOT need a state ID to receive services in the last state I lived in and I communicated to Cerebral and my previous prescriber for MONTHS that I would be moving to another state and told them specifically which state I was moving to. 

I explained the situation to the person helping me through the ‚ÄúMessages‚Äù feature through the app and the representative said it was against Cerebral policy to provide me with a refund for the services that I could not have access to. I did not have a single session with a prescriber or care counselor during the month of June. So, effectively, Cerebral charged me $85 just to tell me at the last minute that they could not provide the care that I needed. Now I don‚Äôt have my meds and I‚Äôm out $85 as an unemployed person in a new state who struggles with multiple mental health issues. Awesome. Can‚Äôt wait to spend hours trying to dispute this with my credit card company. 

This is EXPLOITATION. There is absolutely no excuse for a company charging for services they DID NOT PROVIDE to you. Especially when your clientele consists entirely of people who struggle with mental illness. Shame on you, Cerebral! 

By the way, they sent out emails recently stating that they won‚Äôt be able to prescribe controlled substances in a few months so if you‚Äôre trying to get regular ADHD medication, they won‚Äôt be able to help with that either. Just seek treatment elsewhere, seriously. This app is a scam.

In the midst of a mental health crisis I impulsively downloaded the cerebral app and began the registration process. I ultimately opted to go with a more traditional, in-person psychiatric care option and forgot that I had ever considered using Cerebral. Several months later, after having my debit card declined while purchasing groceries, I checked my bank statement and to my horror I‚Äôd just been charged $85 by Cerebral. After more digging, I found that the company had charged me a total of $200 over the course of three months. This may not seem like much money, but when it gets in the way of my ability to buy food for myself and my family, it becomes a big deal.

I‚Äôm currently pursuing a refund as I never once utilized their services; I haven‚Äôt even opened the app since I downloaded it. My initial email was replied to expeditiously, but upon them realizing I wouldn‚Äôt settle for their purported 2-3 day waiting period to *cancel* my account, much less receive a refund, they stopped replying to my emails.

Finally, one person processed a refund for one of the three months I was charged for, and refused to give me any answer as to whether I‚Äôd receive the remaining $115. I will be pursuing legal action if I continue to be ignored by this predatory company.

In my case they‚Äôre withholding a minuscule amount of money (by their standards) from a mentally ill man who hasn‚Äôt had the money to buy food for more than a week. I‚Äôve been eating microwave popcorn for dinner, and it is quite literally Cerebral‚Äôs fault.

I signed up back in late February and was given their earliest appointment in April the medication and counsel care. It was very inconvenient since I do have ADHD and was looking for alternative medication outside of Adderall and Vyvance; as well, wanted a more relatable counselor to speak with so I wanted to give them a try. The promotion was to get the medication for a low subscription price AND THEN being billed AFTER that once being able to try the medication and see if it‚Äôs a fit for you or not. Makes sense right? Well that‚Äôs not the case. I was billed $85 in March and was going to get billed again another $85 April, which would of been before my appointment date before receiving nothing at all! Before I have them a chance to do me so dirty, I cancelled and asked for a refund. The live agent was very kind and advised me to write an email to cancel and get a full refund. I was happy about that. Once writing their email team, two days later I received a horrible, disturbing response from them. This is verbatim: 

Japhet C (Cerebral)

Apr 1, 2022, 0:31 PDT

Hi Dominique,

 

I am sorry to hear that you'd like to cancel your service at this time. I‚Äôve gone ahead and processed your cancellation request.

I apologize but per our billing policy, we are unable to process a refund. Since we bill using a subscription model, we are unable to reverse charges regardless of whether our services have been utilized.

When you register with us, you agree to your payment method being billed beginning on the date of registration and subsequently every month while the account is active, even if you have yet to complete the registration, have a visit with a provider, or start taking any medications. Please refer to our Recurring Billing Policy and Terms and Conditions, which you have agreed on when you signed up.

This is Completely unacceptable and I feel totally taking advantage of especially after asking for MENTAL HELP! I advised other to not partake in this greedy company and stick with your local doctors provided my your insurance companies. Cerebral is just out here taking advantage of ill people that‚Äôs searching for help. Disgusting ü§Æ

I am a phd Student and had this app recommended to me in order to help receive testing accommodations for adhd. At first, I thought it was great and convenient. Everything from your phone, friendly care coordinators, decent website. But then the provider issues started coming, and it‚Äôs been a compounding landslide of a fourth month nightmare.

I first used cerebral in October. To receive accommodations, I needed to get a form filled out by my prescriber. I emailed her the first week of November, was told it would be back by the end of the week. At the end of the week, no form: I emailed, and same thing. Eventually, after a few weeks of this, as well as bringing it up at my appointment in December, I still never received it. I sent another email, mentioned it again at my January appointment, was told it‚Äôs be here by the end of the week.

The first week of this February, I contacted my care coordinator, who said she would contact the provider about the forms, four months after starting services services. She did. I didn‚Äôt hear anything, and contacted her again. She said she emailed the provider but no word.  Through the next 3 weeks, I contacted the care provider three or four times about the form and getting it filled out, and no word.

By this time I needed to submit the form by the end of the week to receive accommodations. I called customer service, was told they will look into getting me a new provider and email me. They emailed me and I returned the call to schedule an appointment with a new provider. The new service rep I now spoke with was completely confused about the scenario. Nonetheless, she was able to get me an emergency spot with a new provider Thursday, hoping that I could get the form to submit by Friday. The new provider was in Tennessee. I live in California. Legally they can‚Äôt prescribe narcotics across state lines. He apologized and said, ‚Äúyeah, someone over there is messin up man!‚Äù

I was unable to receive accommodations for my PHD exams, despite a four month head start effort, due to Cerebral. 

I‚Äôm just bummed, and it feels predatory. I feel like cerebral took advantage of those with mental illness by making it seem like an accessible service that‚Äôs easy to use. After luring you in, your connected with out of state providers, confused workers, and overly apologetic coordinators that provide apologies instead of solutions. You‚Äôre prescribed meds, and don‚Äôt wanna risk finding another doctor in fear of not being able to get them refilled. It‚Äôs been a nightmare, and having worked in medical offices, it‚Äôs just bizarre how poor this company operates and treats clients. A four page Q&A form with circle the answer questions, and four months in, dozens of emails, nothing but a few bank statements of me paying for this service. It‚Äôs a tragic excuse for psych aid for anybody who needs medical care, and if receiving consistent and safe medicine and treatment is important please consider other sites or firms.

Honestly surprised to see that I am the only one giving a bad review considering how unpleasant my experience was has been. Where to start? First, my ‚Äúprovider‚Äù shows up to our first video conference wearing a beanie and a hoody, like did you just wake up? I get it‚Äôs COVID season and we are having to do Telehealth but how unprofessional... Then to make it better my provider prescribes me a prescription which she says will be sent off and processed that same day to ship. We are going on 5 days with no update. 

The ‚Äúchat‚Äù you get with your counselor and care coordinator isn‚Äôt live so you‚Äôre lucky if one of them sees it and responds when you need them to. I reached out to them and got a minimal response saying ‚Äúoh she‚Äôs working on it‚Äù. 

Last night I sent an email to their contact support explaining my situation and received a response saying that my situation was getting transferred to someone else that dealt with providers and prescriptions as it was a very serious matter and would be handled as soon as possible. I waited all day and heard nothing so I called their contact hotline for live support to see if I could get an update on what was going on. I was placed on hold with a statement saying your expected wait time is 4 minutes... 12 minutes later I was forwarded to an answering machine. Have I gotten a response? Negative ghost rider. Will I after this review? Probably not. 

The moral of the story... If you are suffering right now this app is not timely and I hope you learn from my mistake and go get help that will actually respond to your needs quickly. Great concept but it‚Äôs a mess right now. Save your time and effort and go somewhere else IMO. I hope this helps even one person struggling so they are not stuck wishing and waiting for a promised service.

Horrible customer service, once I told the lady that I knew she wasn‚Äôt gonna prescribe me the medicine I needed she said what you need to shut up and let me finish talking. And now I want to cancel but they‚Äôre going to have someone reach out to me in the next two days to cancel. And to get a refund. They need to say that they are not going to prescribe benzos even know it says that they do.Waste of time and money.

I have been a customer of Cerebral since July 2021, and in my time as a customer I have not had a single month where there hasn't been some kind of issue regarding obtaining my prescriptions. 

Not to mention, upon signing up to receive Cerebral's therapy and medication management service, I was not informed prior to the expiration of the first month @ $35 introductory offer, which inflated to over $300 without notice. I should have listened to the warning bells going off in my head after this first incident, however I was not in a financial position to obtain mental health services from another provider at the time.

Cerebral's mission of "breaking down the barriers for access to mental healthcare" is laughable, as my experience with Cerebral has been one of facing constant barriers. 

Barrier #1 - I have not been able to obtain my prescribed medications due to FREQUENT issues regarding dosage amounts and name brand vs generic mix-ups. However, Cerebral continues to charge me for a bogus "medication management" service. Additionally, I relocated from WA to MA and was required to restart my care with a different provider, even though all of my information was already with Cerebral. I had this new appointment with a provider on Oct 1, but have still not been able to obtain 3 out of my 4 prescribed medications as of today, Oct 22.
Barrier #2 - I am unable to connect directly with my provider and am instead routed through a "care team" to discuss sensitive matters regarding my medication status and mental health.
Barrier #3 - I was PATRONIZED by a "care team" member attempting to justify the cost of Cerebral's services in response to an unauthorized charge of $300+. I subsequently requested that my concerns be brought to a supervisor, however I only received a partial refund.

For a company claiming to provide mental health support services, Cerebral falls drastically short. Providing access to medication for mental health requires the highest level of attention-to-detail and follow-through. Cerebral demonstrates neither. Inconsistencies in medication usage can lead to severe consequences, including suicide. 

I am obtaining counsel to support me in resolving these issues with Cerebral, and will also be posting this communication on Cerebral's Apple App Store as a review, as well as Trust Pilot, and the Better Business Bureau.
I SIGNED UP FOR $85 A MONTH. THEY CHANGED MY PLAN TO $400 A MONTH, CHARGED ME & REFUSED A REFUND.
Avoid at all costs
Yup

I was excited about trying this app ‚Äì I‚Äôve had the option of other platforms like better help and Talkspace for a while, but Cerebral promises online psychiatry, not just general physicians (to prescribe you medications) and talk therapy. I wanted the expertise of a psychiatrist when it comes to prescriptions‚Äì they understand the mind, and that‚Äôs the reason why I decided to try cerebral. Unfortunately, the psychiatry element is all marketing. My prescriber had no background in psych at all, no expertise in any amount of mental health issues, and made me feel so uncomfortable within the first five minutes of talking to him I ended up cancelling my whole subscription then and there. He giggled at really serious issues, made blanket statements back to me that sounded like he got them from an anti-depressant commercial, and behaved so awkwardly and strangely that it truly seemed like he didn‚Äôt understand even the most basic social cues, let alone anything about psychiatry. I am fully convinced that our conversation was his first encounter in the professional medical realm. 

Aside from that, when you are booking appointments with your therapist, you are only showing availability in the far future. It looks like everyone of their therapist is booked up completely for weeks. When you call them, they will be able to tell you availability within the next few days for that person, that you cannot see on your side of the application. When I had to reschedule an appointment, I was only given availability for three weeks later, so I had to call. The person on the phone told me my therapist had availability the next day. That was nowhere on my app. So you may end up paying for four talk therapy sessions a month, and only being able to schedule two or three of them, simply because you don‚Äôt know their true availability.Would not recommend.

I used this app one time. Once. I PAID my out of pocket expense for the only visit I had. 10 months later (while paying $30/mo for the actual app I don‚Äôt even use) I received an email stating $169.00 would be deducted from my account for out of pocket expenses for my financial responsibility. My financial responsibility was paid for though for that only visit. Why wait 10 months to inform and attempt charge me for this visit that I already paid my out of pocket expense for?? Fishy fishy

Tried for two months. Got a antidepressant script the first month. Didn‚Äôt have a refill and couldn‚Äôt get an appointment or in contact with anyone for several days. Thankfully my pharmacist gave me a small amount of medication until I got it sorted. Fast forward 4 weeks, I‚Äôm almost out again, and go the pharmacy for a refill because my prescriber told me I would have refills for three months this time. Didn‚Äôt happen. Messaged on the app and they said they wouldn‚Äôt send any refills until I had another appointment even though I had my second appt less than a month ago and was told I would have three month supply. Nearly had to withdraw cold turkey from a strong antidepressant bc they‚Äôre incompetent. They also tried to sell me my script through their online pharmacy even though I explicitly requested it to be sent to my pharmacy the second time. Had to call back and forth for an entire day to have them cancel the delivery and just send it to my pharmacy. Try at your own risk. Don‚Äôt be surprised if your left to come down from an antidepressant cold turkey because you can‚Äôt be helped for days.

After they charged me $85 for the third time and I cancelled bc I had to go find and pay an actual doctor to write the script, I asked for a refund and the refused. What a ripoff.

I stopped using the services after the promotional month. Never booked a new appointment and they kept billing me. They didn‚Äôt even have an online cancel button until May 31st and when I‚Äôd call it would send me to voicemail. They claim they have a ‚Äúno reimbursement‚Äù policy even though I paid for something I never received. That‚Äôs like paying for something on Amazon that was never sent. LITERAL THEFT!

Quickly becomes apparent that this is more like a bait & switch scam than a convenient and cost effective mental healthcare platform. Trial month followed by $85 recurring charge (not including $75/month prescription in my case), and no prescriber appointments were even available within my first trial month, which are required to start, or in my case continue, treatment. There is no option to contact Cerebral beyond the chat, and replies take over 24 hours (phone number listed has four option that all redirect you to chat within app). I have screen shot my chat history to document the two months of hassle and back-and-forth for issues big and small; among them, prescriber not following up with me initially for over a week despite telling me it would only be a day or two (and then incorrectly saying she had tried to reach out earlier - false), not providing required diagnostic code to pharmacy when submitting prescription, then providing me with the code rather than submitting herself as requested/required by the pharmacy. You would assume the refill process would have gone better, yet I was told by my prescriber that this would be submitted at the time we spoke ten days ago. I‚Äôve had to contact Cerebral almost every day since then, and have been provided multiple excuses citing system errors and computer glitches as to why my medication has not been mailed or called into my pharmacy. Keep in mind, you usually have to wait at least 24 hours to receive a response to each of your inquires. Latest update is that they claim my prescription had at last been mailed through FedEx, yet was cancelled by me. Absolutely false, never requested cancellation of the order, and don‚Äôt even see option to do so, but I‚Äôm sure they know this. Cerebral has not been able to provide timely care or even basic refills, and at $160 this is hardly a cost effective option for mental health care. In my case, I am now motivated to seek psychologist/psychiatrist care through private health insurance as soon as possible. I am also submitting a complaint and review to the Better Business Bureau (not that Cerebral is even accredited). These are not certified psychologists or psychiatrists. They are also unable to prescribe the typical and most effective medications to treat ADHD (stimulants like Adderall). Higher cost and more inconvenient than visits with mental health professionals without your insurance plan.

I would‚Äôve given 1 star, but I‚Äôm trying to get fair. It‚Äôs great people can have access to mental health, but honestly it‚Äôs just a team of unprofessional, uncaring ‚Äúcounselors‚Äù and a robotic mess ‚Äúcare‚Äù team. 

I was told very seriously I‚Äôve been mostly misdiagnosed and really need to talk to someone more familiar with bipolar 2. I wait an extra few weeks, scared, unmedicated, yet hopeful I was finally getting the help I need. 

My appointment comes, told it could be a thyroid issue and to eat more red meat and given a medication I have taken before and know it‚Äôs not helpful. Yeah, so now I‚Äôm this even more stressful situation where a service meant to help a vunerable population takes advantage.

I asked for a refund. I not only did not receive help, my time was wasted, and I was told information that can seriously harm those with issues such as bipolar. Refused a refund, kept saying it‚Äôs a ‚Äúmonthly subscription service‚Äù even though I mentioned I need the refund so I can take the money and get the help. 

I will be starting a petition soon to have the attorney general look at the harmful nature of this service soon, look out for me @cererbalcareteam

Confusing, misleading, and a waste of money
I tried to sign up with insurance and was told I was covered, the description of my plan was vague, so I called customer support who assured me I can get therapy with this plan. Then I spoke to my prescriber who told I might not be able to get therapy since I wasn't getting medication but someone should be in touch to tell me for sure, then I was told to schedule a call with my therapist. After meeting with a "care counselor" and trying to upgrade to my plan to meet more regularly, I'm told by customer support they weren't a licensed therapist, and there are no therapists covered by my insurance I can meet with, so I'll have to pay 194-300 /month to get therapy. Everyone told me something different, no one seems to know what's going on, and just wasted a bunch of time and (some) money.

Cerebral was great at first. I liked my initial provider but they switched me to a new provider after my initial appointment stating that my provider was on vacation for 3 months. My second provider was even better. Until after 2-3 visits they discovered they made a mistake and my provider wasn‚Äôt credentialed with my insurance company. In the meantime, over my 6ish months with Cerebral, I was only able to get my medication in a timely manner for the first 2 months. After that there was an issue every single time where they said my meds would be delivered but they never shipped. I switched to having it sent to my local pharmacy but that was even worse because my prescriptions were never sent over and I would have to hound the care coordinators to get it each month. Back to the providers, the second switch due to Cerebrals error was my last straw and I decided to cancel even though I was almost out of meds and they wouldn‚Äôt help me get a refill. That‚Äôs not the end of my frustration with Cerebral though. After I cancelled all of the sudden in April Cerebral and the provider filed a claim on my insurance for a visit in January when there had never been any previous claims filed. They knew she was out of network so I can imagine why they wanted to file a claim now. The bill was $209.83 and Cerebral refused to answer emails about it until they tried to charge me $72.66 of it. I filed a claim with the BBB. Cerebral said they would reach out to me but a month later never have. Finally they refunded me most of the months services I paid for. But there is still an open claim with my insurance and they haven‚Äôt communicated with me to respond and confirm if they are still pursuing that claim. I switched to Klarity and have had a way better experience - no monthly cost, I only pay for a visit with my provider and my meds. My provider is fantastic and has timely sent my prescription refills each month with zero issues. Overall, would not recommend Cerebral unless you love change constantly and thrive on stress.

First of all, I have an MA in Clinical Mental Health and have also lived with a mental illness for over 15 years. I know what I am talking about and am not some red-flag patient or drug-seeker who complains about everything. At first I thought Cerebral would be an a godsend after years of PAs and CRNPs running through different combinations of the same meds unsuccessfully for TRD in a large health system that had tons of red tape and overwhelmed providers with poor training who frequently quit. I had high hopes after my initial meetings with Cerebral. Now, about 6 months in, I am so fed up that I needed to post a review, because Cerebral makes good provision of care IMPOSSIBLE. I got set up with an awesome provider on the other side of the country who has been totally revamping my med regimen. She's wonderful and an MD, and the only reason I now stay. That's where the good ends. You get NO ACCESS TO RECORDS at all, not even when your last appointment was or visit summaries. If you need something like paperwork, rescheduling, testing, work letters, etc you HAVE to go through Cerebral's people- and you will get no responses for days or weeks, if you EVER get a response at all. For example, my provider repeatedly requested ADHD testing; they never sent it (in hindsight, probably because they no longer allow prescribing of most ADHD meds and didn't want to lose a customer by getting a diagnosis.) 
We later had to request a medical letter for work b/c of severe discontinuation syndrome while weaning off a long-time SNRI. It took several weeks and multiple contacts from my doc for them to send me the letter. (When they did send it, it had huge Cerebral letterhead with "Psychiatry Department" in big letters, so I couldn't even use it- I didn't want to get fired, but I also didn't want to be stigmatized at my job when the office manager was my direct supervisor. I ended up quitting my job instead.) My provider had to give me her personal cell phone early on, because whenever we needed something it would take so long (and sometimes never happen at all, despite multiple requests.) 
My "Care Counselor" changed multiple times and finally I just stopped even trying (I can't imagine how bad trying to get full therapy is). They were useless anyway; just gave you pre-packaged advice you could get from Google. 
And finally, they recently "updated" a bunch of policies regarding 1) what meds can be prescribed and 2) how clients will be charged and for what.
I fought for a week to get a cancellation fee taken off when I accidentally clicked on an appointment for the wrong month and it was only two hours away (ie, meant to hit June 20th at 2pm, accidentally tapped on May 20th at 2pm, and it was currently May 20th at 12pm.) I cancelled it immediately after making it when I realized my mistake- literally two minutes later- and they still charged me $29 and would NOT take it off, even after I escalated the complaint. 
Oh, and if you try to complain or get an issue resolved, however cordially, they will send you bot-generated policy quotes repeatedly without even reading your email. (They sent me the same automated copy-paste email reply 3 times that did not address my actual issue, proving they had not read the email- OOPS, fake customer service exposed!) 
Also, your provider will be very limited in what they can do for you. I am being weaned off of a long-time antidepressant and am experiencing debilitating discontinuation syndrome. My doctor flat out told me that what I really need is temporary benzos, but she can't prescribe them because of Cerebral's new rules. I've never had an addiction or misused meds or even been on benzos before, but I can't have them because of a blanket policy. 
So as soon as I get stable again on the new meds, I am OUT, because even the best provider is made useless by Cerebral's overbearing policies. Your doctor will not be able to treat you the way they should; Cerebral will bill you for an accidental tap of the finger even when no one's time was used, no one lost an appointment slot, no one even knew any appointment had been made, and said appointment only existed for about 30 seconds! They will not give you paperwork you need, and if you try to complain about any of it, they will have a bot with a fake human name quote policy at your repeatedly without even reading your email before finally saying "you agreed to be charged the cancellation fee when you canceled" (I had to, or I couldn't cancel it.) 
In summary, Cerebral: 1) Gets you in the door with great providers. 2) Cripples those providers and does not allow them to provide the best care. 3.) Does not provide any customer service or record-keeping, 4.) Tries to fake you out and make you go away by using bot generated customer service emails. 5.) Uses policy as an excuse for nickel-and-diming you instead of common sense.

After first it seems like it really is worth it but trust all the lower reviews. It‚Äôs only good for maybe 3 months after you will never be able to speak to a counselor.save your money and just find something local

I did everything in my power to cancel my subscription and am still being billed months later. Customer service line redirects you to email. This makes it impossible to speak to a representative and handle this properly. @cerebral look at this as an opportunity to create jobs. Kthx.

Stay far, far away. The app is clunky at best. Rarely are the video calls successful because of the service they use. However, NONE OF THIS COMPARES to the problems with the company itself. They are incapable of keeping staff. No prescribers or providers seem to last more than three months. Errors with prescriptions are too numerous to count. They forget to send it to the pharmacy or your prescriber quits and you have to wait for a new one before you can have your prescription refilled. The customer support is a joke. Its not necessarily the fault of the customer service agents themselves, but they are genuinely no help. There is genuinely nothing that they can do for you if you call in for help.

So please, I beg of you, seek mental health help elsewhere. Literally anywhere else.

You basically as a patient have to be on top of making sure that your medication gets approved by insurance and making sure it gets filled. On top of that you have to pay monthly just to get prescribed, i would suggest better communication between patients, prescriber and insurance side of things need to be more clear.  if I‚Äôm paying 90.00 a month and the prescriber gets annoyed because I want it sent to a different pharmacy that‚Äôs not my concern. Sorry you have to take 2 minutes out of your day to switch my pharmacy. I also should not have to ask for a prior authorization, that should be done automatically. I should not have to follow up and ask if it was processed, I should be notified. 

Major improvements need to be done.

Even though I have insurance, I figured shelling out $85 a month would be worth it to finally get some ADHD treatment and diagnosis. I signed up for the basic and cheapest plan - medication and care counselor. Your care coordinator is the middle man between you and your prescriber, who you have no way of speaking to in between virtual appointments. I made my first 30 min appointment with my prescriber and they didn‚Äôt show up, so that wasn‚Äôt an endearing start to this program. I rescheduled for a couple days later. That is a positive - I was able to get appointments very quickly after signing up. My first actual visit with my prescriber was ok but they seemed very bored, like this wasn‚Äôt anything they wanted to do. I was prescribed adderall XR after a series of questions and me explaining my symptoms, what I have trouble with etc. it was very easy to get prescribed adderall. So, great for people who need the help. The problem I had was that I never received treatment. I had to confirm with my care counselor - who was very friendly and nice - that my prescription was sent to my pharmacy. So I waited, and waited, and waited. My prescription still wasn‚Äôt ready. I had to go in to my pharmacy and asked what was going on. They said they needed the diagnosis code from my prescriber in order for my insurance to cover the cost of meds. This is 2 weeks since I was prescribed adderall. Another week goes by. I have to reach out to my team and ask what‚Äôs going on. My coordinator was very nice but I kept having to message them. I felt like I was in the dark. I ended up contacting support, which was absolutely no help. So by now, I have received a response in my message portal saying the diagnosis code was given and was just waiting on if any more info was needed. I had contacted my pharmacy again just to confirm this was true‚Ä¶ they said the issue is still unresolved, that my prescription will expire in less than a week and I could pay out of pocket‚Ä¶ but I have insurance for a reason - I will essentially be paying $85 a month for this medication. At this point I decided to cancel because my second month payment will withdraw in a couple days and I still haven‚Äôt received treatment! This experience was way more frustrating than I expected. I was so hopeful in the beginning but didn‚Äôt seem worth it to keep waiting and waiting and waiting and paying for treatment I was not getting. I submitted my cancel request (you have to send an email and your membership will NOT cancel until you get a response from somebody confirming). My second month payment went through yesterday, so I can only hope once my cancelation is confirmed, I am able to get a refund. Cerebral just gave me more unnecessary stress and I had to circle back, confirm, etc with my team. Communication is not great on their end. I will be seeking treatment elsewhere‚Ä¶ seems pretty scammy to me. Would not recommend based on my experience.

I signed up with cerebral on April 19. I filled out my questionnaire and chose from the 4 therapists listed. The therapist I chose didn‚Äôt have availability that worked for me until May 1st but I was feeling good about the process and was willing to wait. Yesterday, my therapist was removed from my team due to a scheduling issue. I was given a new therapist with no opportunity to chose. I inquired if all the therapists offered are available in Illinois and if I was expected to search through what seemed like hundreds of therapists. My response received was, ‚ÄúPlease know that there are Therapists particular in your state Illinois.‚Äù With no other support or guidance. At this point I have received no care and it‚Äôs been a week. I asked to cancel and receive a full refund. I was offered a partial refund and they cancelled my account immediately. I paid $79, received no help, no guidance when I was left without a therapist and a refund of $23.70. I am so disappointed, as I was looking forward to the convenience that this service claimed to offer.

I‚Äôve been paying for months. Have never had a therapy session. The psychiatrist has no availability and their HR is a sh*t show. I want my money back, I‚Äôve been trying for weeks to get an appointment but their app and staff is a MESS. Save yourself the trouble.

I recently attempted to get access to services but my insurance card was not being clarified for the app. I tried several times and did not get access to any content past the initial assessment page. Then ingot charged $85 a month later for a subscription I was locked out of. I contacted customer service and they issued me a $25.50 refund saying it was all they could do. This company does not cared about serving the population they state to serve. I would not recommend this to anyone.

I was excited to try this and get some help. Explained how I keep getting different diagnosis and want a In-depth look. After 30 minutes she never told me what exactly she thinks I have but prescribed yet another medication. I thought ok I‚Äôll try! THEN got billed $76.00 for medication THAT I WAS NOT TOLD ABOUT WHEN SHE PRESCRIBED THEM. I couldn‚Äôt cancel cause it already shipped and they charged me full price for the program instead of the ‚Äúdeal‚Äù and it‚Äôs hard to get ahold of anyone and no way to cancel without emailing them. Not very clear on how it all works and what to expect.  I was very hopeful but yet again another disappointing mental health idea.

Don‚Äôt go with @getcerebral - if you need help. Trying to cancel? Its impossible no matter how many cancellation requests you fill out. They continue to take funds automatically from your account. If you are suffering from mental health issues, do not choose cerebral. It will worsen your state of mind. This is four months later after signing up and immediately being told they couldn‚Äôt help my husband AND that they didn‚Äôt have services in our area. They took more money from our bank account, just yesterday. After one initial consultation in November 2021 to say they wouldn‚Äôt be able to provide for him. Absolute red flag company. Bad choice, go with something else, please take care of yourself and choose something better.

This service is horrible. First of all the councellor hung up on me after I asked an innocent question (why are you asking for my home state? I already provided that info). 

Next I tried to get a refund and wish to cancel the service. The support person claims the service is completely non-refundable and the intend to charge me $85 each month for the next year. The Cerebral.com website says ‚Äúcancel anytime.‚Äù So the company staff are not truthful. Cerebral quickly deleted the part where I was told non-cancellable & non-refundable. The support rep says there was language to that effect. If that was the truth:
1) it was buried in the T‚Äôs & C‚Äôs
2) it still contradicts the language on their website.

This company is very shady. Buyer beware!

The first month was fine, whereas I received my prescription without any issues. (I‚Äôll not even bother getting into the first practitioner I seen basically told me she couldn‚Äôt help me and was passing me on to someone more qualified. Just to pass me to someone that had zero clue what was going on so I had to start over with her and she was actually pretty judgmental- that was real fun, said no one reaching out for help.) The second month came and I had my appointment the same day as finishing my previous month‚Äôs prescription. Had my apt, doctor knew I was officially out of my meds because I told her and while having our apt reiterated where to send my meds and that she was doing so, just like the previous month. Thought all was fine. It wasn‚Äôt. The next day, 3/15, I went to my pharmacy to get my medicine and they had nothing for me and no new prescription had been called in. I left the pharmacy and went home and messaged Cerebral right away about what was going on. I finally hear back almost 24 hours later and yet still no prescription or solution. They can‚Äôt get thru to my prescriber or the on call. Meanwhile this place has many doctors they could have easily started reaching out to so we could get the prescription taken care of immediately. But no. More days have gone by. No one does anything to help knowing that the psych medication is much needed, can make me very sick without out it, and most importantly, how dangerous it is to stop these medications ‚Äúcold turkey‚Äù. They finally message me Saturday(3/19) evening at 655pm, that my prescription had been sent. I messaged back that that was no longer helpful and they were days late in solving a problem that needed attention immediately. It wasn‚Äôt helpful because my pharmacy was already closed for the day and they are closed on Sundays. I wrote them this immediately and never heard back about what to do next. No one at Cerebral had offered any solutions in getting me my prescription immediately so I wouldn‚Äôt have to be sick. I feel this is very unacceptable and disappointing, being it‚Äôs a mental health facility. I‚Äôve been home, alone with no help, with a toddler, sick for days because of this negligence. I had not been able to do anything around the house and struggled to even care for myself and my 3 year old because Ive been so sick from not having my medicine. Now that it‚Äôs been 6/7 days without my prescription my meds will be mostly, if not all the way, be out of my system and I‚Äôll have to start all over. Back to square one! Getting to that point was hard enough! It took me weeks to even take the steps to make the appointment and start the process of speaking to a doctor and starting a medication. Now I have to look elsewhere and begin again. They know this, it‚Äôs a mental health center, yet are treating the situation like it‚Äôs no big deal. It‚Äôs a very very big deal. This is NOT ok and I plan to look into some kind of justice being done. I‚Äôve read more negative reviews here about the same kinds of situations that I‚Äôve just encountered with this company, then there should ever be. Being treated like crap by your ‚Äúcare team‚Äù who is actually there to help you just is not ok. They just let me get sick and stay freakin sick instead of figuring out a solution. What kind of mental health facility does that?! Bottom line, I don‚Äôt recommend Cerebral to anyone. I‚Äôm now taking the steps to cancel this service, try to get reimbursed for the money they have just taken out and for the prescription they charged me for that the sent out(that is still not even here and won‚Äôt be here until Wednesday. That‚Äôs about 10 days from my appointment date that I would be receiving my medication because of a mistake on their end. I‚Äôll update if I have any issues on getting my money back.

Paid $139 upfront to learn first available prescriber appt is 10 days away; even longer for any therapist. You cannot get help by phone. Emailed immediately to cancel, they said Sorry no refunds but we‚Äôll give you $41.70 back‚Ä¶ Yes, seriously. UPDATE 3/15/22: Cerebral still refuses to refund, saying it‚Äôs a subscription service and I‚Äôll be billed regardless if they provide any services. In my case, the services I needed (with require speaking to a human) would not be available for 2 weeks. I can‚Äôt wait that long; withdrawals from my Rx are horrible. There is a reason they make you give your credit card info before they show you who/when your options are. BTW these are NOT psychiatrists or psychologists, and who knows what their qualifications are for ‚Äòprescribers.‚Äô Total scam.

I opened an account with Cerebral on 3/10/22 and they immediately debited my account $30 on 3/10/22. I signed up for therapy for $99 for the month and was matched to a counselor. I was accepted through my insurance in AR. Was matched with a therapist and scheduled a session for the day of the super bowl @6:15pm. I just needed help..

I joined cerebral back in October 2021 using a trial code to only pay $30 for the first month regardless of which package. I have filed a complaint with the FTC as they have broken a lease or regulation regarding subscription cancelation ease and have extremely bad business practices. I suggest others who have had A similar experience do the same, in hopes that cerebral will be required to change and prevent others from having to go through the stress.

My personal experience:
I got to meet with a nurse in the first week, however the half hour allotted ended up being less than 5 minutes. The nurse was 15 minutes late and didn‚Äôt make up for it with extra minutes after the appointment would‚Äôve ended, and she left our appointment five minutes before it was scheduled to end. I was told I should get the premium package with therapy (after I expressed I wasn‚Äôt interested in that because I have a in person therapist) and I was also told that I need to speak to a different nurse practitioner.
A week goes by and finally the app allowed me to schedule with the different nurse practitioner. It would be near the end of my trial but that was OK. However, an emergency on my end came up and I had to cancel my appointment. Her next available appointment wasn‚Äôt for another three months! Cerebral would not let me schedule with a different nurse, only her. Even if I wanted to temporarily cancel my subscription until then, my appointments would all be canceled as well. So, my only option was to schedule that appointment and pay $85 minimum for three more months before I could even potentially get help. 
In the third of my fourth week, I was scheduled to meet with a doctor. Cerebral canceled my appointment about 24 hours before it was scheduled. Her next availability wasn‚Äôt until weeks after my trial would end, so I tried looking for other doctors with their service. Again, I can schedule with anyone other than that person.
I wrote a complaint and asked to unsubscribe via email to their customer support. It took them three days to respond at which point they said they can‚Äôt offer me a refund. That‚Äôs OK, I just wanted to stop my subscription. When they emailed me back, they said I had missed the deadline (according to the TOS; two business days by 9 AM via email before the new invoice is printed) I would need to pay the $85 for the upcoming month, even though I wouldn‚Äôt have access to my account because I had canceled. I responded back to them because my initial email which was sent before that deadline stated I wanted to cancel, and their initial response didn‚Äôt occur until a few hours after the deadline- which gave me zero opportunity to try to properly cancel (again). They responded back and said they cannot help me.
I had to put a lock on my bank account for over a month to avoid their attempts at charging me. I was getting emails demanding I pay it. Eventually, it stopped and I haven‚Äôt heard from them again.
However, making a subscription harder to cancel than it is to sign up for is against FTC‚Äôs laws and regulations. 

And, a heads up-if you do decide to switch your program with the trial offer (which clearly states it is for any of the programs), it will try to charge you the full price‚Äôs difference. Even though the receipt will say $0 due, when you hit submit to switch to a premium plan during your trial period, it will automatically try to charge your bank over $200 for a few days. I contacted customer support about this, and they were again of no help.

This app is a scam. After filling out my info & the questionnaire, I was told there was a problem finding therapists licensed in my state & to try again later. I tried several times over the course of several days with the same result. When I reached out to support I was told the error would be resolved quickly & to keep trying. After 5 days of this I decided to give up & I asked for a refund since I had never been matched with a therapist. I was told the service, ‚Äúis like Netflix or Hulu,‚Äù & refunds were not available since it was a subscription service. At no point was I ever matched with a therapist. This company only cares about taking your money & I am appalled that they claim to try to help people.

When I first started cerebral I had a lot of high hopes for it because it seemed to be going well. It was difficult to upload my insurance and when it was time to get my prescription refilled they took forever to send it through. Since I wasn‚Äôt getting the services I wanted I decided to cancel. They told me if I was to get charged it would be refunded. They charged my account three days later and when I asked for the refund the said they couldn‚Äôt do it due to the fact that I cancelled outside the renewal date, but their providers didn‚Äôt help me in that time and that‚Äôs why I cancelled. They‚Äôre supposed to help people struggling. Not worth the frustration to me.

This app/service isn‚Äôt worth the hassle. I had and appointment with a doctor, logged into the waiting room to be seen on a video call. The doctor never showed up for the appointment. I reached out to customer support and told them I wanted to cancel my subscription and I would like a full refund since I didn‚Äôt use any of their services. They refunded me only $9 out of all the money I paid.As somebody that struggles with their mental health, they did not do anything to help resolve any issues even after the fact. You‚Äôre better off seeing a professional for in person care.

What a scam. As part of the sign up process you have to pay for the first month before you can see available providers or schedule an appt. That should have been a red flag. Turns out there was only one provider and the first appt was 6 weeks out so I immediately sent a cancellation email. They charged me $14.95 for that. After complaining I was told it was a subscription service and there are no refunds (even though I never actually completed sign up). Eventually they agreed to refund $4.35. What a joke. Stay away.

So, I signed up after seeing on TikTok. Sounded great and easy. This was December 10th. As part of this, you agree to their subscription model that bills monthly. Fine. But after you pay and agree to this, they say ooh ok well the first appointment is January 9th. And your ‚Äúcare counselor‚Äù appt is 17th of January. So then what am I paying for?!?  I spoke to a client services team meme we who said no worries, just fill out this cancellation form and someone will be in touch about your refund. Four days later I hear back from them and they say, ‚Äú We‚Äôre happy to help in any way we can, but we‚Äôre limited in our ability to deviate from our billing policy. Here at Cerebral, we bill based on a subscription model. This includes access to the entire platform and all its features. This subscription is similar to streaming services like Netflix or Hulu where you‚Äôre billed regardless of use to keep the subscription active. Understandably, this may be disappointing, but we‚Äôre unfortunately unable to issue a full refund because our services were accessible to you.‚Äù Seriously? How were your services accessible to me in the ten minutes it took me to cancel when I am not able to speak to a prescriber for a whole month?!? DISGRACEFUL

Cerebral.com‚Äôs system is designed to get your credit card information before you have chosen services.  Even if you do not want medication, you will receive a call from a medication specialist so they can charge you for that service (even if you tell the interviewer that you do not want medication).  If you make an appointment to speak with a counselor, you will immediately be charged for that future appointment.  Cancelling the appointment does not reverse the charge (even if you cancel more than a week in advance).  Requesting a refund gets a reply saying they are sorry but their system does not permit refunds.  The whole thing is a fraud to charge you whether you choose to use their services or not.  I have complained about them to the Better Business Bureau (where they already have a grade of F).  I will update this review if Cerebral.com finally responds to my repeated requests for a refund.

I used this app for 2 months. The first month it was great but unfortunately ran into issues when I needed a prescription refill. My physician didn‚Äôt send it into the pharmacy she said that she would. Despite reaching out for support it took over a week to resolve and I was out of medication for that period of time. I don‚Äôt like that I couldn‚Äôt reach out to my physician directly for something so simple and instead had to rely on a care team to process the request. Also they don‚Äôt accept my insurance so I paid full price for a month of services I didn‚Äôt receive. So I‚Äôm ditching the app and will find a doc irl that accepts my insurance. 

It should be noted that Cerebral doesn‚Äôt do refunds even if they fail to deliver the services you pay for with your subscription :/

My experience with Cerebral has been lackluster at best. At first, after initially having a consultation with the psychiatric nurse practitioner and then scheduling and meeting with my care provider, I thought this was good. 

My experience after that has been less than stellar. It turns out there was an error with getting my medicine filled. Which caused a delay. I understand times are tough, etc. but I was told it was an error in their system, not necessarily the pharmacy‚Äôs fault. 

I finally got my medication and began taking it. I was supposed to take two medications. One I was to take one pill a day for two weeks and then take two a day until my refill came in. 

Here it is the end of December, and I‚Äôve only received on round of medication. I asked why it wasn‚Äôt filled out because it‚Äôs important to take your medicine as prescribed and not miss a dose. I reached out to my care provider who said it appears there was, get this, another error in fulfilling my medication so I didn‚Äôt have any medicine whatsoever. 

They sent in a prescription to my local pharmacy that I had to pay additional money for, to hold me over for two weeks until my new medicine is sent to me. 

What bothered me was that one of the medicines that I was taking two of (went from 20mg to 40mg) was refilled for..20mg. And I was told to only take one day. The dosage and instructions are completely messed up. The communication is completely out of alignment. I broke this down to my care provider out of concern that the nurse practitioner wasn‚Äôt even following the medication instructions she gave me. I was simply followed up with a ‚ÄúWe are sorry. This is our fault‚Äù with no further corrections provided. Literally so now I‚Äôm taking a smaller dosage then what I‚Äôm supposed to be taking because the practitioner didn‚Äôt send in the new dosage that I have been on. It‚Äôs not been consistent and the attention to details and errors are too lackluster to recommend this service right now. You shouldn‚Äôt guarantee a service when you can‚Äôt fulfill your duties to your patients. I‚Äôve now paid over $200.00 and have only had one prescription filled (plus out of costs prescription for pharmacy) and two small 30 minute sessions with a care counselor that you barely even have time to really work through problems with for it to be even remotely worthwhile. In my experience, the care manager really only works as a liaison between you and the company but that‚Äôs about it. And due to my issues so far in regards to prescription fulfillment, I‚Äôd look into other services.

I requested to cancel as you cannot do so yourself going to subscription information. The care was great but due to other reasons I was not interested in continuing. I requested to cancel, and was charged for the next months fee the following day. Since contacting about canceling via email. I was told it has to go into review by a cancellation team. I haven‚Äôt been notified if my account was cancelled or not. During those multiple emails, I requested a refund multiple times for this upcoming month that I am not using, again I requested cancellation the day prior to being charged.
Request for cancellation: 11/11/21
Day of charge to my card: 11/12/21
It‚Äôs been days since I was told I would be contacted about a refund. My multiple requests to have my money refunded has been responded by that is not the support teams responsibility and someone else will contact me. 
I contact my bank, and now find out the $325 I was charged without my permission may not return to my account before the dispute is found to be in my favor or not.  Timeframe on finding out is anywhere up to 90 days. Reason for the possible delay. The company is hard to reach. They won‚Äôt even give me the information I‚Äôm asking for, so guess I‚Äôll be waiting the 90 days. Care was great but the customer service feels criminal, I‚Äôm charged after requesting cancellation, cannot get an answer from the company, and my bank is telling me if they don‚Äôt hear from them with a solution its 90 days‚Ä¶.

In a final statement, again the treatment was great by therapist and prescriber. However the company itself needs to care about the consumers. I have been shown here they fall short.

A couple weeks ago I was trying to enter my insurance information into the website & app.  I have ‚ÄúDirect Care Administrators‚Äù insurance.  This is listed on the drop down of accepted insurances for medical & for prescription on both your website & your app.  So I assumed there was an error happening with the app.  I sent a email in to support.  I kept getting emails with ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù and not anything to actually help me.  I decided that since my insurance was listed & I would benefit from therapy services as well to go ahead and sign up for the prescription, counselor, & therapy option.  I do this thinking my insurance was accepted by cerebral so it would not be a huge charge to me directly as my insurance was again listed as an accepted insurance on both the medical & prescription drop downs on the website & app.  When I went to do this once I selected to upgrade there was no option to go back, I was informed I would be charged ‚Äúthe difference‚Äù from what I had already paid to the upgrade.  There was zero mention anywhere saying refunds would only be given at 50%.  Since I couldn‚Äôt go back I had no option but to keep going forward despite the website not registering my insurance that was listed on the drop down.  Because it wouldn‚Äôt accept my insurance when I tried to enter it after selecting from the drop down of accepted insurance & then I saw a $240 charge to my checking account I immediately cancelled the ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù & change it back to what I previously selected which was prescription & counseling.  I then called into Cerebral to figure out why my insurance was on the drop down & the app not website would take it when I entered my insurance information.  I was told by the person I spoke to when I called in that my insurance was not actually accepted by cerebral for medical but was accepted for prescription.  It was listed in both areas in the drop down on the app & website.  I asked if I could be refunded for the upgrade that was made on my account & immediately changed back to prescription & counseling.  I was informed I would be & she would notify the department who was responsible for refunds.  I was never told anything about a refund not being for the full $240.  This was an error on Cerebral‚Äôs part for having listed my insurance as being accepted by Cerebral on the website & app.  Had my insurance been accepted like the drop downs on the website & app showed it was I would have remained with the higher plan.  But because it wasn‚Äôt I can‚Äôt afford to pay for therapy services out of pocket.  So I cancelled it & figured I would need to find a provider who accepted my insurance.  I then noticed a few days later a $120 refund into my account.  I was charged $240, not $120 so because I was confused as to why I wasn‚Äôt refunded the full $240 for a service I was never provided, was only upgraded in my account for a total of less than 5 minutes, I called Cerebral again.  The person I spoke to when I called said there was a ‚Äúpolicy of 50%‚Äù refund.  I asked where I would have been informed of this because had I known that this existed I would have called in to verify my insurance as opposed to upgrading with the knowledge of being informed by your website & app that my insurance was accepted.  I was told this was something that was ‚Äúonly on our end‚Äù as in that I the customer couldn‚Äôt see anywhere that this 50% refund policy even existed & only people on the Cerebral employee end could see.  It‚Äôs extremely poor customer service & extremely poor treatment for a service that is to be providing mental health services.  The person I spoke to despite me trying to explain this continued to read a scripted message over me trying to talk to her.  I asked to speak to a supervisor, she responded saying ‚Äúyou want to speak with a supervisor?‚Äù  I said ‚Äúyes‚Äù.  She responded saying ‚Äúthere isn‚Äôt one available but I can have a supervisor give you a call back‚Äù.  I told her I would like for this to happen & the call ended.  It has been 5 days now & I haven‚Äôt received any call back from a supervisor.  Out of my own curiosity because I didn‚Äôt recall seeing on the app or website anything about a ‚Äú50% refund‚Äù I went looking through all of the ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù areas, all of the website & was unable to locate anything that said this.  I assumed maybe it showed up when I went to upgrade plans, so I went back to the upgrade area & figured I would click to upgrade & since I already was aware once you select to upgrade that you can‚Äôt go back on the app I decided I would just close out the app instead of selecting the only option on the app which was to go forward I would close the app out completely & not upgrade.  So I went to do this, & when I selected to upgrade to the prescription, counseling, & therapy services there was a pop up this time that did not happen before when I had done this & was charged $240.  The pop up informed me that Cerebral was not able to provide ‚Äútherapy services in my state‚Äù (Utah).  So Cerebral showed my insurance as an accepted insurance in their drop down list despite it not being accepted by them, charged me for medical services that they legally cannot even provide in my state, and despite both of these problems being at the fault of Cerebral misinforming customers they refused to refund me for the full $240 I was charged. When upgrading it also does not tell you what the cost is for the higher plan, it only says you will be charged for the difference of the plan you selected originally and the upgraded plan.  I would highly recommend anyone considering using Cerebral to call them directly before signing up, selecting any services, etc.  From my experience what I was told on the app & website was not at all accurate.

I told them immediately what had happened and they told me to give them pharmacy info to send it there. Once I did one of my medications had an insurance hold. My team did not do anything about this until I went to the pharmacy, found out, and messaged them in the app. 

I was told to put my insurance in the app, but that is impossible because my insurer is not an option for their insurance. It wasn‚Äôt until I called that they were able to input the insurance info. 

It is now two weeks later, one week of which I have been without any of my main medication, and they are finally telling me that they could ship me some to get it to me sooner.

What a waste of money.  You have to pay up front for a month of therapy and/or meds support, THEN you get the opportunity to select your doctors.  But wait, the therapists aren‚Äôt available for 1-3 weeks.  So you pay for the service, but you don‚Äôt actually receive what you‚Äôre paying for.  And if you make the mistake I did and select a therapist who isn‚Äôt available for OVER 3 weeks, you can‚Äôt just unselect them in the app and choose someone else.  You have to go back and forth with customer service suggesting therapists until they suggest someone you like.  I signed up THREE WEEKS AGO YESTERDAY and I STILL DO NOT HAVE A THERAPIST.  Oh, but they‚Äôll take my money anyway NO PROBLEM.  Haven‚Äôt heard back from customer service in 2 days.  I feel like I‚Äôve been totally ripped off; this is just one more example of how difficult it is to get mental healthcare.

ALSO, I didn‚Äôt have the opportunity to approve the cost of my meds.  They just charged my card and sent them.  It was only $20, but it‚Äôs still crazy to not be able to approve or decline the transaction because by law you can‚Äôt return meds once they‚Äôre dispensed to you.

Not only that, but the only way to schedule your next appointment is to click on a link they send you that expires in 24 hours.  I missed the 24 hour window twice, and they did not send the link a third time despite my requesting that they send it yet again.  Which is fine, because there‚Äôs a 50% chance I would have missed it a third time as well and I‚Äôm so disappointed and frustrated with this whole experience that I do not want to continue using the service.
